<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_458"><span id="lf0610_label_498">39</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt152" id="lf0610_footnote_nt152_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_459"><span id="lf0610_label_500">40</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt153" id="lf0610_footnote_nt153_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_460"><span id="lf0610_label_502">41</span> He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet&#x2019;s reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man&#x2019;s reward.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_461"><span id="lf0610_label_503">42</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt154" id="lf0610_footnote_nt154_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold <span class="ital">water</span> only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_026" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_505">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_462"><span id="lf0610_label_506">1</span> And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_463"><span id="lf0610_label_507">2</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt155" id="lf0610_footnote_nt155_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_464"><span id="lf0610_label_509">3</span> And said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_465"><span id="lf0610_label_510">4</span> Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_466"><span id="lf0610_label_511">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt156" id="lf0610_footnote_nt156_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt157" id="lf0610_footnote_nt157_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the poor have the gospel preached to them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_467"><span id="lf0610_label_514">6</span> And blessed is <span class="ital">he,</span> whosoever shall not be offended in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_468"><span id="lf0610_label_515">7</span> &#xB6; And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_469"><span id="lf0610_label_516">8</span> But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear soft <span class="ital">clothing</span> are in kings&#x2019; houses.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_470"><span id="lf0610_label_517">9</span> But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_471"><span id="lf0610_label_518">10</span> For this is <span class="ital">he,</span> of whom it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt158" id="lf0610_footnote_nt158_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>13<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_472"><span id="lf0610_label_520">11</span> Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_473"><span id="lf0610_label_521">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt159" id="lf0610_footnote_nt159_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt160" id="lf0610_footnote_nt160_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_474"><span id="lf0610_label_524">13</span> For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_475"><span id="lf0610_label_525">14</span> And if ye will receive <span class="ital">it,</span> this is <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt161" id="lf0610_footnote_nt161_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Elias, which was for to come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_476"><span id="lf0610_label_527">15</span> He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_477"><span id="lf0610_label_528">16</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt162" id="lf0610_footnote_nt162_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_478"><span id="lf0610_label_530">17</span> And saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_479"><span id="lf0610_label_531">18</span> For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_480"><span id="lf0610_label_532">19</span> The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_481"><span id="lf0610_label_533">20</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt163" id="lf0610_footnote_nt163_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_482"><span id="lf0610_label_535">21</span> Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_483"><span id="lf0610_label_536">22</span> But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_484"><span id="lf0610_label_537">23</span> And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_485"><span id="lf0610_label_538">24</span> But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_486"><span id="lf0610_label_539">25</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt164" id="lf0610_footnote_nt164_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_487"><span id="lf0610_label_541">26</span> Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_488"><span id="lf0610_label_542">27</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt165" id="lf0610_footnote_nt165_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt166" id="lf0610_footnote_nt166_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and <span class="ital">he</span> to whomsoever the Son will reveal <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_489"><span id="lf0610_label_545">28</span> &#xB6; Come unto me, all <span class="ital">ye</span> that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_490"><span id="lf0610_label_546">29</span> Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt167" id="lf0610_footnote_nt167_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and ye shall find rest unto your souls.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_491"><span id="lf0610_label_548">30</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt168" id="lf0610_footnote_nt168_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For my yoke <span class="ital">is</span> easy, and my burden is light.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_027" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_550">12</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_492"><span id="lf0610_label_551">1</span> At that time <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt169" id="lf0610_footnote_nt169_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_493"><span id="lf0610_label_553">2</span> But when the Pharisees saw <span class="ital">it,</span> they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_494"><span id="lf0610_label_554">3</span> But he said unto them, Have ye not read <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt170" id="lf0610_footnote_nt170_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_495"><span id="lf0610_label_556">4</span> How he entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt171" id="lf0610_footnote_nt171_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>but only for the priests?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_496"><span id="lf0610_label_558">5</span> Or have ye not read in the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt172" id="lf0610_footnote_nt172_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_497"><span id="lf0610_label_560">6</span> But I say unto you, That in this place is <span class="ital">one</span> greater than the temple.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>14<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_498"><span id="lf0610_label_561">7</span> But if ye had known what <span class="ital">this</span> meaneth, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt173" id="lf0610_footnote_nt173_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_499"><span id="lf0610_label_563">8</span> For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_500"><span id="lf0610_label_564">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt174" id="lf0610_footnote_nt174_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_501"><span id="lf0610_label_566">10</span> &#xB6; And, behold, there was a man which had <span class="ital">his</span> hand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days? that they might accuse him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_502"><span id="lf0610_label_567">11</span> And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift <span class="ital">it</span> out?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_503"><span id="lf0610_label_568">12</span> How much then is a man better than a sheep? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_504"><span id="lf0610_label_569">13</span> Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched <span class="ital">it</span> forth; and it was restored whole, like as the other.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_505"><span id="lf0610_label_570">14</span> &#xB6; Then the Pharisees went out, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt175" id="lf0610_footnote_nt175_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>held a council against him, how they might destroy him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_506"><span id="lf0610_label_572">15</span> But when Jesus knew <span class="ital">it,</span> he withdrew himself from thence: and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_507"><span id="lf0610_label_573">16</span> And charged them that they should not make him known:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_508"><span id="lf0610_label_574">17</span> That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_509"><span id="lf0610_label_575">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt176" id="lf0610_footnote_nt176_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold my servant, whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_510"><span id="lf0610_label_577">19</span> He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_511"><span id="lf0610_label_578">20</span> A bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench, till he send forth judgment unto victory.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_512"><span id="lf0610_label_579">21</span> And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_513"><span id="lf0610_label_580">22</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt177" id="lf0610_footnote_nt177_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind, and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_514"><span id="lf0610_label_582">23</span> And all the people were amazed, and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt178" id="lf0610_footnote_nt178_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>Is not this the son of David?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_515"><span id="lf0610_label_584">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt179" id="lf0610_footnote_nt179_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But when the Pharisees heard <span class="ital">it,</span> they said, This <span class="ital">fellow</span> doth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_516"><span id="lf0610_label_586">25</span> And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_517"><span id="lf0610_label_587">26</span> And if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_518"><span id="lf0610_label_588">27</span> And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast <span class="ital">them</span> out? therefore they shall be your judges.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_519"><span id="lf0610_label_589">28</span> But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_520"><span id="lf0610_label_590">29</span> Or else how can one enter into a strong man&#x2019;s house, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_521"><span id="lf0610_label_591">30</span> He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_522"><span id="lf0610_label_592">31</span> &#xB6; Wherefore I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt180" id="lf0610_footnote_nt180_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemy <span class="ital">against</span> the <span class="ital">Holy</span> Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_523"><span id="lf0610_label_594">32</span> And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the <span class="ital">world</span> to come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_524"><span id="lf0610_label_595">33</span> Either make the tree good, and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt, and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by <span class="ital">his</span> fruit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_525"><span id="lf0610_label_596">34</span> O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt181" id="lf0610_footnote_nt181_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>15<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_526"><span id="lf0610_label_598">35</span> A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_527"><span id="lf0610_label_599">36</span> But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_528"><span id="lf0610_label_600">37</span> For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_529"><span id="lf0610_label_601">38</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt182" id="lf0610_footnote_nt182_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_530"><span id="lf0610_label_603">39</span> But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_531"><span id="lf0610_label_604">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt183" id="lf0610_footnote_nt183_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale&#x2019;s belly; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_532"><span id="lf0610_label_606">41</span> The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt184" id="lf0610_footnote_nt184_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas <span class="ital">is</span> here.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_533"><span id="lf0610_label_608">42</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt185" id="lf0610_footnote_nt185_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon <span class="ital">is</span> here.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_534"><span id="lf0610_label_610">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt186" id="lf0610_footnote_nt186_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_535"><span id="lf0610_label_612">44</span> Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth <span class="ital">it</span> empty, swept, and garnished.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_536"><span id="lf0610_label_613">45</span> Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt187" id="lf0610_footnote_nt187_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and the last <span class="ital">state</span> of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_537"><span id="lf0610_label_615">46</span> &#xB6; While he yet talked to the people, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt188" id="lf0610_footnote_nt188_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>behold, <span class="ital">his</span> mother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_538"><span id="lf0610_label_617">47</span> Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_539"><span id="lf0610_label_618">48</span> But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_540"><span id="lf0610_label_619">49</span> And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_541"><span id="lf0610_label_620">50</span> For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_028" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_621">13</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_542"><span id="lf0610_label_622">1</span> The same day went Jesus out of the house, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt189" id="lf0610_footnote_nt189_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and sat by the sea side.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_543"><span id="lf0610_label_624">2</span> And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_544"><span id="lf0610_label_625">3</span> And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt190" id="lf0610_footnote_nt190_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold, a sower went forth to sow;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_545"><span id="lf0610_label_627">4</span> And when he sowed, some <span class="ital">seeds</span> fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_546"><span id="lf0610_label_628">5</span> Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_547"><span id="lf0610_label_629">6</span> And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt191" id="lf0610_footnote_nt191_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>had no root, they withered away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_548"><span id="lf0610_label_631">7</span> And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_549"><span id="lf0610_label_632">8</span> But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_550"><span id="lf0610_label_633">9</span> Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_551"><span id="lf0610_label_634">10</span> And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_552"><span id="lf0610_label_635">11</span> He answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>16<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_553"><span id="lf0610_label_636">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt192" id="lf0610_footnote_nt192_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_554"><span id="lf0610_label_638">13</span> Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_555"><span id="lf0610_label_639">14</span> And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias, which saith, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt193" id="lf0610_footnote_nt193_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_556"><span id="lf0610_label_641">15</span> For this people&#x2019;s heart is waxed gross, and <span class="ital">their</span> ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed; lest at any time they should see with <span class="ital">their</span> eyes, and hear with <span class="ital">their</span> ears, and should understand with <span class="ital">their</span> heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_557"><span id="lf0610_label_642">16</span> But blessed <span class="ital">are</span> your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_558"><span id="lf0610_label_643">17</span> For verily I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt194" id="lf0610_footnote_nt194_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>That many prophets and righteous <span class="ital">men</span> have desired to see <span class="ital">those things</span> which ye see, and have not seen <span class="ital">them;</span> and to hear <span class="ital">those things</span> which ye hear, and have not heard <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_559"><span id="lf0610_label_645">18</span> &#xB6; Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_560"><span id="lf0610_label_646">19</span> When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth <span class="ital">it</span> not, then cometh the wicked <span class="ital">one,</span> and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart. This is he which received seed by the way side.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_561"><span id="lf0610_label_647">20</span> But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_562"><span id="lf0610_label_648">21</span> Yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_563"><span id="lf0610_label_649">22</span> He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_564"><span id="lf0610_label_650">23</span> But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth <span class="ital">it;</span> which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_565"><span id="lf0610_label_651">24</span> &#xB6; Another parable put he forth unto them saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_566"><span id="lf0610_label_652">25</span> But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_567"><span id="lf0610_label_653">26</span> But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_568"><span id="lf0610_label_654">27</span> So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_569"><span id="lf0610_label_655">28</span> He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_570"><span id="lf0610_label_656">29</span> But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_571"><span id="lf0610_label_657">30</span> Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_572"><span id="lf0610_label_658">31</span> &#xB6; Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt195" id="lf0610_footnote_nt195_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_573"><span id="lf0610_label_660">32</span> Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_574"><span id="lf0610_label_661">33</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt196" id="lf0610_footnote_nt196_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt197" id="lf0610_footnote_nt197_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_575"><span id="lf0610_label_664">34</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt198" id="lf0610_footnote_nt198_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>17<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_576"><span id="lf0610_label_666">35</span> That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt199" id="lf0610_footnote_nt199_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_577"><span id="lf0610_label_668">36</span> Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_578"><span id="lf0610_label_669">37</span> He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_579"><span id="lf0610_label_670">38</span> The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked <span class="ital">one;</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_580"><span id="lf0610_label_671">39</span> The enemy that sowed them is the devil; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt200" id="lf0610_footnote_nt200_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_581"><span id="lf0610_label_673">40</span> As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_582"><span id="lf0610_label_674">41</span> The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt201" id="lf0610_footnote_nt201_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>things that offend, and them which do iniquity;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_583"><span id="lf0610_label_676">42</span> And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_584"><span id="lf0610_label_677">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt202" id="lf0610_footnote_nt202_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_585"><span id="lf0610_label_679">44</span> &#xB6; Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_586"><span id="lf0610_label_680">45</span> &#xB6; Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_587"><span id="lf0610_label_681">46</span> Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt203" id="lf0610_footnote_nt203_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>went and sold all that he had, and bought it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_588"><span id="lf0610_label_683">47</span> &#xB6; Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_589"><span id="lf0610_label_684">48</span> Which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_590"><span id="lf0610_label_685">49</span> So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_591"><span id="lf0610_label_686">50</span> And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_592"><span id="lf0610_label_687">51</span> Jesus saith unto them, Have ye understood all these things? They say unto him, Yea, Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_593"><span id="lf0610_label_688">52</span> Then said he unto them, Therefore every scribe <span class="ital">which is</span> instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man <span class="ital">that is</span> an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure <span class="ital">things</span> new and old.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_594"><span id="lf0610_label_689">53</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass, <span class="ital">that</span> when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_595"><span id="lf0610_label_690">54</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt204" id="lf0610_footnote_nt204_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this <span class="ital">man</span> this wisdom, and <span class="ital">these</span> mighty works?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_596"><span id="lf0610_label_692">55</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt205" id="lf0610_footnote_nt205_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Is not this the carpenter&#x2019;s son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_597"><span id="lf0610_label_694">56</span> And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this <span class="ital">man</span> all these things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_598"><span id="lf0610_label_695">57</span> And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt206" id="lf0610_footnote_nt206_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_599"><span id="lf0610_label_697">58</span> And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_029" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_698">14</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_600"><span id="lf0610_label_699">1</span> At that time <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt207" id="lf0610_footnote_nt207_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_601"><span id="lf0610_label_701">2</span> And said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt208" id="lf0610_footnote_nt208_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>do shew forth themselves in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_602"><span id="lf0610_label_703">3</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt209" id="lf0610_footnote_nt209_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put <span class="ital">him</span> in prison for Herodias&#x2019; sake, his brother Philip&#x2019;s wife.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_603"><span id="lf0610_label_705">4</span> For John said unto him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt210" id="lf0610_footnote_nt210_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>It is not lawful for thee to have her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_604"><span id="lf0610_label_707">5</span> And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt211" id="lf0610_footnote_nt211_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>because they counted him as a prophet.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>18<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_605"><span id="lf0610_label_709">6</span> But when Herod&#x2019;s birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_606"><span id="lf0610_label_710">7</span> Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_607"><span id="lf0610_label_711">8</span> And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist&#x2019;s head in a charger.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_608"><span id="lf0610_label_712">9</span> And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath&#x2019;s sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commanded <span class="ital">it</span> to be given <span class="ital">her.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_609"><span id="lf0610_label_713">10</span> And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_610"><span id="lf0610_label_714">11</span> And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she brought <span class="ital">it</span> to her mother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_611"><span id="lf0610_label_715">12</span> And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_612"><span id="lf0610_label_716">13</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt212" id="lf0610_footnote_nt212_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When Jesus heard <span class="ital">of it,</span> he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart: and when the people had heard <span class="ital">thereof,</span> they followed him on foot out of the cities.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_613"><span id="lf0610_label_718">14</span> And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_614"><span id="lf0610_label_719">15</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt213" id="lf0610_footnote_nt213_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves victuals.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_615"><span id="lf0610_label_721">16</span> But Jesus said unto them, They need not depart; give ye them to eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_616"><span id="lf0610_label_722">17</span> And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_617"><span id="lf0610_label_723">18</span> He said, Bring them hither to me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_618"><span id="lf0610_label_724">19</span> And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves to <span class="ital">his</span> disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_619"><span id="lf0610_label_725">20</span> And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_620"><span id="lf0610_label_726">21</span> And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_621"><span id="lf0610_label_727">22</span> &#xB6; And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_622"><span id="lf0610_label_728">23</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt214" id="lf0610_footnote_nt214_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt215" id="lf0610_footnote_nt215_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and when the evening was come, he was there alone.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_623"><span id="lf0610_label_731">24</span> But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_624"><span id="lf0610_label_732">25</span> And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_625"><span id="lf0610_label_733">26</span> And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cried out for fear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_626"><span id="lf0610_label_734">27</span> But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_627"><span id="lf0610_label_735">28</span> And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_628"><span id="lf0610_label_736">29</span> And he said, Come. And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water, to go to Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_629"><span id="lf0610_label_737">30</span> But when he saw the wind <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt216" id="lf0610_footnote_nt216_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, Lord, save me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_630"><span id="lf0610_label_739">31</span> And immediately Jesus stretched forth <span class="ital">his</span> hand, and caught him, and said unto him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_631"><span id="lf0610_label_740">32</span> And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_632"><span id="lf0610_label_741">33</span> Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_633"><span id="lf0610_label_742">34</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt217" id="lf0610_footnote_nt217_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_634"><span id="lf0610_label_744">35</span> And when the men of that place had knowledge of him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto him all that were diseased;</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>19<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_635"><span id="lf0610_label_745">36</span> And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_030" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_746">15</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_636"><span id="lf0610_label_747">1</span> Then <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt218" id="lf0610_footnote_nt218_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_637"><span id="lf0610_label_749">2</span> Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_638"><span id="lf0610_label_750">3</span> But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_639"><span id="lf0610_label_751">4</span> For God commanded, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt219" id="lf0610_footnote_nt219_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Honour thy father and mother: and, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt220" id="lf0610_footnote_nt220_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_640"><span id="lf0610_label_754">5</span> But ye say, Whosoever shall say to <span class="ital">his</span> father or <span class="ital">his</span> mother, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt221" id="lf0610_footnote_nt221_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a><span class="ital">It is</span> a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_641"><span id="lf0610_label_756">6</span> And honour not his father or his mother, <span class="ital">he shall be free.</span> Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_642"><span id="lf0610_label_757">7</span> <span class="ital">Ye</span> hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_643"><span id="lf0610_label_758">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt222" id="lf0610_footnote_nt222_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with <span class="ital">their</span> lips; but their heart is far from me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_644"><span id="lf0610_label_760">9</span> But in vain they do worship me, teaching <span class="ital">for</span> doctrines the commandments of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_645"><span id="lf0610_label_761">10</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt223" id="lf0610_footnote_nt223_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_646"><span id="lf0610_label_763">11</span> Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_647"><span id="lf0610_label_764">12</span> Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_648"><span id="lf0610_label_765">13</span> But he answered and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt224" id="lf0610_footnote_nt224_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_649"><span id="lf0610_label_767">14</span> Let them alone: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt225" id="lf0610_footnote_nt225_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_650"><span id="lf0610_label_769">15</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt226" id="lf0610_footnote_nt226_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_651"><span id="lf0610_label_771">16</span> And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_652"><span id="lf0610_label_772">17</span> Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_653"><span id="lf0610_label_773">18</span> But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_654"><span id="lf0610_label_774">19</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt227" id="lf0610_footnote_nt227_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_655"><span id="lf0610_label_776">20</span> These are <span class="ital">the things</span> which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_656"><span id="lf0610_label_777">21</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt228" id="lf0610_footnote_nt228_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_657"><span id="lf0610_label_779">22</span> And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, <span class="ital">thou</span> son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_658"><span id="lf0610_label_780">23</span> But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_659"><span id="lf0610_label_781">24</span> But he answered and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt229" id="lf0610_footnote_nt229_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_660"><span id="lf0610_label_783">25</span> Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_661"><span id="lf0610_label_784">26</span> But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children&#x2019;s bread, and to cast <span class="ital">it</span> to dogs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_662"><span id="lf0610_label_785">27</span> And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters&#x2019; table.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_663"><span id="lf0610_label_786">28</span> Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great <span class="ital">is</span> thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_664"><span id="lf0610_label_787">29</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt230" id="lf0610_footnote_nt230_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_665"><span id="lf0610_label_789">30</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt231" id="lf0610_footnote_nt231_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And great multitudes came unto him, having <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>20<span class="bracket">]</span></span> with them <span class="ital">those that were</span> lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus&#x2019; feet; and he healed them:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_666"><span id="lf0610_label_791">31</span> Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_667"><span id="lf0610_label_792">32</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt232" id="lf0610_footnote_nt232_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then Jesus called his disciples <span class="ital">unto him,</span> and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_668"><span id="lf0610_label_794">33</span> And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_669"><span id="lf0610_label_795">34</span> And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_670"><span id="lf0610_label_796">35</span> And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_671"><span id="lf0610_label_797">36</span> And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake <span class="ital">them,</span> and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_672"><span id="lf0610_label_798">37</span> And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken <span class="ital">meat</span> that was left seven baskets full.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_673"><span id="lf0610_label_799">38</span> And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_674"><span id="lf0610_label_800">39</span> And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_031" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_801">16</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_675"><span id="lf0610_label_802">1</span> The <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt233" id="lf0610_footnote_nt233_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_676"><span id="lf0610_label_804">2</span> He answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, <span class="ital">It will be</span> fair weather: for the sky is red.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_677"><span id="lf0610_label_805">3</span> And in the morning, <span class="ital">It will be</span> foul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring. O <span class="ital">ye</span> hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye not <span class="ital">discern</span> the signs of the times?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_678"><span id="lf0610_label_806">4</span> A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas. And he left them, and departed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_679"><span id="lf0610_label_807">5</span> And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_680"><span id="lf0610_label_808">6</span> &#xB6; Then Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_681"><span id="lf0610_label_809">7</span> And they reasoned among themselves, saying, <span class="ital">It is</span> because we have taken no bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_682"><span id="lf0610_label_810">8</span> <span class="ital">Which</span> when Jesus perceived, he said unto them, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_683"><span id="lf0610_label_811">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt234" id="lf0610_footnote_nt234_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_684"><span id="lf0610_label_813">10</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt235" id="lf0610_footnote_nt235_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_685"><span id="lf0610_label_815">11</span> How is it that ye do not understand that I spake <span class="ital">it</span> not to you concerning bread, that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_686"><span id="lf0610_label_816">12</span> Then understood they how that he bade <span class="ital">them</span> not beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_687"><span id="lf0610_label_817">13</span> &#xB6; When Jesus came into the coasts of C&#xE6;sarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt236" id="lf0610_footnote_nt236_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whom do men say that I the Son of man am?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_688"><span id="lf0610_label_819">14</span> And they said, Some <span class="ital">say that thou art</span> John the Baptist: some, Elias; and others, Jeremias, or one of the prophets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_689"><span id="lf0610_label_820">15</span> He saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_690"><span id="lf0610_label_821">16</span> And Simon Peter answered and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt237" id="lf0610_footnote_nt237_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Thou <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt238" id="lf0610_footnote_nt238_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>art the Christ, the Son of the living God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_691"><span id="lf0610_label_824">17</span> And Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-jona: for flesh and blood hath not revealed <span class="ital">it</span> unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>21<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_692"><span id="lf0610_label_825">18</span> And I say also unto thee, That <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt239" id="lf0610_footnote_nt239_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_693"><span id="lf0610_label_827">19</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt240" id="lf0610_footnote_nt240_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt241" id="lf0610_footnote_nt241_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_694"><span id="lf0610_label_830">20</span> Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_695"><span id="lf0610_label_831">21</span> &#xB6; From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples, how that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_696"><span id="lf0610_label_832">22</span> Then Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall not be unto thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_697"><span id="lf0610_label_833">23</span> But he turned, and said unto Peter, Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art an offence unto me: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_698"><span id="lf0610_label_834">24</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt242" id="lf0610_footnote_nt242_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any <span class="ital">man</span> will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_699"><span id="lf0610_label_836">25</span> For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_700"><span id="lf0610_label_837">26</span> For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_701"><span id="lf0610_label_838">27</span> For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt243" id="lf0610_footnote_nt243_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and then he shall reward every man according to his works.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_702"><span id="lf0610_label_840">28</span> Verily I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt244" id="lf0610_footnote_nt244_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>There be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_032" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_842">17</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_703"><span id="lf0610_label_843">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt245" id="lf0610_footnote_nt245_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_704"><span id="lf0610_label_845">2</span> And was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_705"><span id="lf0610_label_846">3</span> And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_706"><span id="lf0610_label_847">4</span> Then answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_707"><span id="lf0610_label_848">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt246" id="lf0610_footnote_nt246_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_708"><span id="lf0610_label_850">6</span> And when the disciples heard <span class="ital">it,</span> they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_709"><span id="lf0610_label_851">7</span> And Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_710"><span id="lf0610_label_852">8</span> And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_711"><span id="lf0610_label_853">9</span> And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_712"><span id="lf0610_label_854">10</span> And his disciples asked him, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt247" id="lf0610_footnote_nt247_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_713"><span id="lf0610_label_856">11</span> And Jesus answered and said unto them, Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_714"><span id="lf0610_label_857">12</span> But I say unto you, That Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they listed. Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_715"><span id="lf0610_label_858">13</span> Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_716"><span id="lf0610_label_859">14</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt248" id="lf0610_footnote_nt248_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a <span class="ital">certain</span> man, kneeling down to him, and saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_717"><span id="lf0610_label_861">15</span> Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>22<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_718"><span id="lf0610_label_862">16</span> And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_719"><span id="lf0610_label_863">17</span> Then Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_720"><span id="lf0610_label_864">18</span> And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_721"><span id="lf0610_label_865">19</span> Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_722"><span id="lf0610_label_866">20</span> And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt249" id="lf0610_footnote_nt249_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_723"><span id="lf0610_label_868">21</span> Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_724"><span id="lf0610_label_869">22</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt250" id="lf0610_footnote_nt250_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_725"><span id="lf0610_label_871">23</span> And they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again. And they were exceeding sorry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_726"><span id="lf0610_label_872">24</span> &#xB6; And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt251" id="lf0610_footnote_nt251_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>tribute <span class="ital">money</span> came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_727"><span id="lf0610_label_874">25</span> He saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_728"><span id="lf0610_label_875">26</span> Peter saith unto him, Of strangers. Jesus saith unto him, Then are the children free.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_729"><span id="lf0610_label_876">27</span> Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt252" id="lf0610_footnote_nt252_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_033" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_878">18</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_730"><span id="lf0610_label_879">1</span> At <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt253" id="lf0610_footnote_nt253_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_731"><span id="lf0610_label_881">2</span> And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_732"><span id="lf0610_label_882">3</span> And said, Verily I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt254" id="lf0610_footnote_nt254_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_733"><span id="lf0610_label_884">4</span> Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_734"><span id="lf0610_label_885">5</span> And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_735"><span id="lf0610_label_886">6</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt255" id="lf0610_footnote_nt255_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and <span class="ital">that</span> he were drowned in the depth of the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_736"><span id="lf0610_label_888">7</span> &#xB6; Woe unto the world because of offences! for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_737"><span id="lf0610_label_889">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt256" id="lf0610_footnote_nt256_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut them off, and cast <span class="ital">them</span> from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_738"><span id="lf0610_label_891">9</span> And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast <span class="ital">it</span> from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_739"><span id="lf0610_label_892">10</span> Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_740"><span id="lf0610_label_893">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt257" id="lf0610_footnote_nt257_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_741"><span id="lf0610_label_895">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt258" id="lf0610_footnote_nt258_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>How think ye? if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_742"><span id="lf0610_label_897">13</span> And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>23<span class="bracket">]</span></span> you, he rejoiceth more of that <span class="ital">sheep,</span> than of the ninety and nine which went not astray.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_743"><span id="lf0610_label_898">14</span> Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_744"><span id="lf0610_label_899">15</span> &#xB6; Moreover <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt259" id="lf0610_footnote_nt259_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_745"><span id="lf0610_label_901">16</span> But if he will not hear <span class="ital">thee, then</span> take with thee one or two more, that in <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt260" id="lf0610_footnote_nt260_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_746"><span id="lf0610_label_903">17</span> And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell <span class="ital">it</span> unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt261" id="lf0610_footnote_nt261_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>heathen man and a publican.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_747"><span id="lf0610_label_905">18</span> Verily I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt262" id="lf0610_footnote_nt262_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_748"><span id="lf0610_label_907">19</span> Again I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_749"><span id="lf0610_label_908">20</span> For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_750"><span id="lf0610_label_909">21</span> &#xB6; Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt263" id="lf0610_footnote_nt263_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>till seven times?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_751"><span id="lf0610_label_911">22</span> Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_752"><span id="lf0610_label_912">23</span> &#xB6; Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would take account of his servants</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_753"><span id="lf0610_label_913">24</span> And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt264" id="lf0610_footnote_nt264_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>talents.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_754"><span id="lf0610_label_915">25</span> But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_755"><span id="lf0610_label_916">26</span> The servant therefore fell down, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt265" id="lf0610_footnote_nt265_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_756"><span id="lf0610_label_918">27</span> Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_757"><span id="lf0610_label_919">28</span> But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt266" id="lf0610_footnote_nt266_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pence: and he laid hands on him, and took <span class="ital">him</span> by the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_758"><span id="lf0610_label_921">29</span> And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_759"><span id="lf0610_label_922">30</span> And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_760"><span id="lf0610_label_923">31</span> So when his fellowservants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_761"><span id="lf0610_label_924">32</span> Then his lord, after that he had called him, said unto him, O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_762"><span id="lf0610_label_925">33</span> Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_763"><span id="lf0610_label_926">34</span> And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_764"><span id="lf0610_label_927">35</span> So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_034" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_928">19</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_765"><span id="lf0610_label_929">1</span> And it came to pass, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt267" id="lf0610_footnote_nt267_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a><span class="ital">that</span> when Jesus had finished these sayings, he departed from Galilee, and came into the coasts of Jud&#xE6;a beyond Jordan;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_766"><span id="lf0610_label_931">2</span> And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_767"><span id="lf0610_label_932">3</span> &#xB6; The Pharisees also came unto him, tempting him, and saying unto him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_768"><span id="lf0610_label_933">4</span> And he answered and said unto them, Have ye not read, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt268" id="lf0610_footnote_nt268_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that he which made <span class="ital">them</span> at the beginning made them male and female,</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>24<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_769"><span id="lf0610_label_935">5</span> And said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt269" id="lf0610_footnote_nt269_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt270" id="lf0610_footnote_nt270_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>they twain shall be one flesh?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_770"><span id="lf0610_label_938">6</span> Wherefore they are no more twain, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_771"><span id="lf0610_label_939">7</span> They say unto him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt271" id="lf0610_footnote_nt271_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement, and to put her away?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_772"><span id="lf0610_label_941">8</span> He saith unto them, Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it was not so.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_773"><span id="lf0610_label_942">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt272" id="lf0610_footnote_nt272_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And I say unto you, Whosoever shall put away his wife, except <span class="ital">it be</span> for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery: and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_774"><span id="lf0610_label_944">10</span> &#xB6; His disciples say unto him, If the case of the man be so with <span class="ital">his</span> wife, it is not good to marry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_775"><span id="lf0610_label_945">11</span> But he said unto them, All <span class="ital">men</span> cannot receive this saying, save <span class="ital">they</span> to whom it is given.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_776"><span id="lf0610_label_946">12</span> For there are some eunuchs, which were so born from <span class="ital">their</span> mother&#x2019;s womb: and there are some eunuchs, which were made eunuchs of men: and there be eunuchs, which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven&#x2019;s sake. He that is able to receive <span class="ital">it,</span> let him receive <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
