<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1111"><span id="lf0610_label_1393">55</span> In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes. Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>36<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1112"><span id="lf0610_label_1394">56</span> But all this was done, that the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt378" id="lf0610_footnote_nt378_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1113"><span id="lf0610_label_1396">57</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt379" id="lf0610_footnote_nt379_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they that had laid hold on Jesus led <span class="ital">him</span> away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1114"><span id="lf0610_label_1398">58</span> But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest&#x2019;s palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1115"><span id="lf0610_label_1399">59</span> Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1116"><span id="lf0610_label_1400">60</span> But found none: yea, though many false witnesses came, <span class="ital">yet</span> found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1117"><span id="lf0610_label_1401">61</span> And said, This <span class="ital">fellow</span> said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt380" id="lf0610_footnote_nt380_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1118"><span id="lf0610_label_1403">62</span> And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what <span class="ital">is it which</span> these witness against thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1119"><span id="lf0610_label_1404">63</span> But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1120"><span id="lf0610_label_1405">64</span> Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt381" id="lf0610_footnote_nt381_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1121"><span id="lf0610_label_1407">65</span> Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1122"><span id="lf0610_label_1408">66</span> What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1123"><span id="lf0610_label_1409">67</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt382" id="lf0610_footnote_nt382_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smote <span class="ital">him</span> with <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt383" id="lf0610_footnote_nt383_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the palms of their hands,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1124"><span id="lf0610_label_1412">68</span> Saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1125"><span id="lf0610_label_1413">69</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt384" id="lf0610_footnote_nt384_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1126"><span id="lf0610_label_1415">70</span> But he denied before <span class="ital">them</span> all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1127"><span id="lf0610_label_1416">71</span> And when he was gone out into the porch, another <span class="ital">maid</span> saw him, and said unto them that were there, This <span class="ital">fellow</span> was also with Jesus of Nazareth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1128"><span id="lf0610_label_1417">72</span> And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1129"><span id="lf0610_label_1418">73</span> And after a while came unto <span class="ital">him</span> they that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also art <span class="ital">one</span> of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1130"><span id="lf0610_label_1419">74</span> Then began he to curse and to swear, <span class="ital">saying,</span> I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1131"><span id="lf0610_label_1420">75</span> And Peter remembered the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt385" id="lf0610_footnote_nt385_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_042" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1422">27</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1132"><span id="lf0610_label_1423">1</span> When the morning was come, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt386" id="lf0610_footnote_nt386_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1133"><span id="lf0610_label_1425">2</span> And when they had bound him, they led <span class="ital">him</span> away, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1134"><span id="lf0610_label_1426">3</span> &#xB6; Then Judas, which had betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1135"><span id="lf0610_label_1427">4</span> Saying, I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said, What <span class="ital">is that</span> to us? see thou <span class="ital">to that.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1136"><span id="lf0610_label_1428">5</span> And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt387" id="lf0610_footnote_nt387_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and departed, and went and hanged himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1137"><span id="lf0610_label_1430">6</span> And the chief priests took the silver pieces, and said, It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1138"><span id="lf0610_label_1431">7</span> And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter&#x2019;s field, to bury strangers in.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>37<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1139"><span id="lf0610_label_1432">8</span> Wherefore that field was called, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt388" id="lf0610_footnote_nt388_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The field of blood, unto this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1140"><span id="lf0610_label_1434">9</span> Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt389" id="lf0610_footnote_nt389_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was valued, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt390" id="lf0610_footnote_nt390_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>whom they of the children of Israel did value;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1141"><span id="lf0610_label_1437">10</span> And gave them for the potter&#x2019;s field, as the Lord appointed me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1142"><span id="lf0610_label_1438">11</span> And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1143"><span id="lf0610_label_1439">12</span> And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1144"><span id="lf0610_label_1440">13</span> Then <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt391" id="lf0610_footnote_nt391_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1145"><span id="lf0610_label_1442">14</span> And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1146"><span id="lf0610_label_1443">15</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt392" id="lf0610_footnote_nt392_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now at <span class="ital">that</span> feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1147"><span id="lf0610_label_1445">16</span> And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1148"><span id="lf0610_label_1446">17</span> Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1149"><span id="lf0610_label_1447">18</span> For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1150"><span id="lf0610_label_1448">19</span> &#xB6; When he was set down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that just man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1151"><span id="lf0610_label_1449">20</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt393" id="lf0610_footnote_nt393_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1152"><span id="lf0610_label_1451">21</span> The governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? They said, Barabbas.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1153"><span id="lf0610_label_1452">22</span> Pilate <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt394" id="lf0610_footnote_nt394_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>saith unto them, What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ? <span class="ital">They</span> all <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt395" id="lf0610_footnote_nt395_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>say unto him, Let him be crucified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1154"><span id="lf0610_label_1455">23</span> And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1155"><span id="lf0610_label_1456">24</span> &#xB6; When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, but <span class="ital">that</span> rather a tumult was made, he took water, and washed <span class="ital">his</span> hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person: see ye <span class="ital">to it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1156"><span id="lf0610_label_1457">25</span> Then answered all the people, and said, His blood <span class="ital">be</span> on us, and on our children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1157"><span id="lf0610_label_1458">26</span> &#xB6; Then released he Barabbas unto them: and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered <span class="ital">him</span> to be crucified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1158"><span id="lf0610_label_1459">27</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt396" id="lf0610_footnote_nt396_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt397" id="lf0610_footnote_nt397_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>common hall, and gathered unto him the whole band <span class="ital">of soldiers.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1159"><span id="lf0610_label_1462">28</span> And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1160"><span id="lf0610_label_1463">29</span> &#xB6; And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they put <span class="ital">it</span> upon his head, and a reed in his right hand: and they bowed the knee before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1161"><span id="lf0610_label_1464">30</span> And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1162"><span id="lf0610_label_1465">31</span> And after that they had mocked him, they took the robe off from him, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucify <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1163"><span id="lf0610_label_1466">32</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt398" id="lf0610_footnote_nt398_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to bear his cross.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1164"><span id="lf0610_label_1468">33</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt399" id="lf0610_footnote_nt399_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1165"><span id="lf0610_label_1470">34</span> &#xB6; They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted <span class="ital">thereof,</span> he would not drink.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1166"><span id="lf0610_label_1471">35</span> And they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt400" id="lf0610_footnote_nt400_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1167"><span id="lf0610_label_1473">36</span> And sitting down they watched him there;</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>38<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1168"><span id="lf0610_label_1474">37</span> And set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1169"><span id="lf0610_label_1475">38</span> Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1170"><span id="lf0610_label_1476">39</span> &#xB6; And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1171"><span id="lf0610_label_1477">40</span> And saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest <span class="ital">it</span> in three days, save thyself. If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1172"><span id="lf0610_label_1478">41</span> Likewise also the chief priests mocking <span class="ital">him,</span> with the scribes and elders, said,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1173"><span id="lf0610_label_1479">42</span> He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1174"><span id="lf0610_label_1480">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt401" id="lf0610_footnote_nt401_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1175"><span id="lf0610_label_1482">44</span> The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1176"><span id="lf0610_label_1483">45</span> Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1177"><span id="lf0610_label_1484">46</span> And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is to say, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt402" id="lf0610_footnote_nt402_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1178"><span id="lf0610_label_1486">47</span> Some of them that stood there, when they heard <span class="ital">that,</span> said, This <span class="ital">man</span> calleth for Elias.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1179"><span id="lf0610_label_1487">48</span> And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt403" id="lf0610_footnote_nt403_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and filled <span class="ital">it</span> with vinegar, and put <span class="ital">it</span> on a reed, and gave him to drink.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1180"><span id="lf0610_label_1489">49</span> The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1181"><span id="lf0610_label_1490">50</span> &#xB6; Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1182"><span id="lf0610_label_1491">51</span> And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1183"><span id="lf0610_label_1492">52</span> And the graves were opened; and many bodies <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt404" id="lf0610_footnote_nt404_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>of the saints which slept arose,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1184"><span id="lf0610_label_1494">53</span> And came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1185"><span id="lf0610_label_1495">54</span> Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1186"><span id="lf0610_label_1496">55</span> And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1187"><span id="lf0610_label_1497">56</span> Among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee&#x2019;s children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1188"><span id="lf0610_label_1498">57</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt405" id="lf0610_footnote_nt405_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimath&#xE6;a, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus&#x2019; disciple:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1189"><span id="lf0610_label_1500">58</span> He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1190"><span id="lf0610_label_1501">59</span> And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1191"><span id="lf0610_label_1502">60</span> And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1192"><span id="lf0610_label_1503">61</span> And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1193"><span id="lf0610_label_1504">62</span> &#xB6; Now the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1194"><span id="lf0610_label_1505">63</span> Saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1195"><span id="lf0610_label_1506">64</span> Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error shall be worse than the first.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1196"><span id="lf0610_label_1507">65</span> Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, make <span class="ital">it</span> as sure as ye can.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1197"><span id="lf0610_label_1508">66</span> So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_043" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1509">28</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1198"><span id="lf0610_label_1510">1</span> In the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt406" id="lf0610_footnote_nt406_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first <span class="ital">day</span> of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1199"><span id="lf0610_label_1512">2</span> And, behold, there <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt407" id="lf0610_footnote_nt407_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>was a great earthquake: for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1200"><span id="lf0610_label_1514">3</span> His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1201"><span id="lf0610_label_1515">4</span> And for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as dead <span class="ital">men.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1202"><span id="lf0610_label_1516">5</span> And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1203"><span id="lf0610_label_1517">6</span> He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1204"><span id="lf0610_label_1518">7</span> And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1205"><span id="lf0610_label_1519">8</span> And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1206"><span id="lf0610_label_1520">9</span> &#xB6; And as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, All hail. And they came and held him by the feet, and worshipped him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1207"><span id="lf0610_label_1521">10</span> Then said Jesus unto them, Be not afraid: go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1208"><span id="lf0610_label_1522">11</span> &#xB6; Now when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1209"><span id="lf0610_label_1523">12</span> And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1210"><span id="lf0610_label_1524">13</span> Saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him <span class="ital">away</span> while we slept.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1211"><span id="lf0610_label_1525">14</span> And if this come to the governor&#x2019;s ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1212"><span id="lf0610_label_1526">15</span> So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1213"><span id="lf0610_label_1527">16</span> &#xB6; Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1214"><span id="lf0610_label_1528">17</span> And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1215"><span id="lf0610_label_1529">18</span> And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1216"><span id="lf0610_label_1530">19</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt408" id="lf0610_footnote_nt408_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1217"><span id="lf0610_label_1532">20</span> Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway, <span class="ital">even</span> unto the end of the world. Amen.</p>
</div>
</div>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>40<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<div id="lf0610_div_044" class="type-part S_Mark">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_009">THE GOSPEL ACCORDING TO S. MARK.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_045" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1533">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1218"><span id="lf0610_label_1534">1</span> <span class="sc">The</span> beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1219"><span id="lf0610_label_1535">2</span> As it is written in the prophets, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt409" id="lf0610_footnote_nt409_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1220"><span id="lf0610_label_1537">3</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt410" id="lf0610_footnote_nt410_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1221"><span id="lf0610_label_1539">4</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt411" id="lf0610_footnote_nt411_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt412" id="lf0610_footnote_nt412_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>for the remission of sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1222"><span id="lf0610_label_1542">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt413" id="lf0610_footnote_nt413_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And there went out unto him all the land of Jud&#xE6;a, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1223"><span id="lf0610_label_1544">6</span> And John was <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt414" id="lf0610_footnote_nt414_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>clothed with camel&#x2019;s hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1224"><span id="lf0610_label_1546">7</span> And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1225"><span id="lf0610_label_1547">8</span> I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1226"><span id="lf0610_label_1548">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt415" id="lf0610_footnote_nt415_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1227"><span id="lf0610_label_1550">10</span> And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt416" id="lf0610_footnote_nt416_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1228"><span id="lf0610_label_1552">11</span> And there came a voice from heaven, <span class="ital">saying,</span> Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1229"><span id="lf0610_label_1553">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt417" id="lf0610_footnote_nt417_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And immediately the spirit driveth him into the wilderness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1230"><span id="lf0610_label_1555">13</span> And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1231"><span id="lf0610_label_1556">14</span> Now after that John was put in prison, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt418" id="lf0610_footnote_nt418_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1232"><span id="lf0610_label_1558">15</span> And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1233"><span id="lf0610_label_1559">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt419" id="lf0610_footnote_nt419_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1234"><span id="lf0610_label_1561">17</span> And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1235"><span id="lf0610_label_1562">18</span> And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1236"><span id="lf0610_label_1563">19</span> And when he had gone a little farther thence, he saw James the <span class="ital">son</span> of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1237"><span id="lf0610_label_1564">20</span> And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1238"><span id="lf0610_label_1565">21</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt420" id="lf0610_footnote_nt420_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1239"><span id="lf0610_label_1567">22</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt421" id="lf0610_footnote_nt421_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1240"><span id="lf0610_label_1569">23</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt422" id="lf0610_footnote_nt422_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1241"><span id="lf0610_label_1571">24</span> Saying, Let <span class="ital">us</span> alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>41<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1242"><span id="lf0610_label_1572">25</span> And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1243"><span id="lf0610_label_1573">26</span> And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1244"><span id="lf0610_label_1574">27</span> And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine <span class="ital">is</span> this? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1245"><span id="lf0610_label_1575">28</span> And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1246"><span id="lf0610_label_1576">29</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt423" id="lf0610_footnote_nt423_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1247"><span id="lf0610_label_1578">30</span> But Simon&#x2019;s wife&#x2019;s mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1248"><span id="lf0610_label_1579">31</span> And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1249"><span id="lf0610_label_1580">32</span> And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1250"><span id="lf0610_label_1581">33</span> And all the city was gathered together at the door.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1251"><span id="lf0610_label_1582">34</span> And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt424" id="lf0610_footnote_nt424_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>to speak, because they knew him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1252"><span id="lf0610_label_1584">35</span> And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1253"><span id="lf0610_label_1585">36</span> And Simon and they that were with him followed after him</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1254"><span id="lf0610_label_1586">37</span> And when they had found him, they said unto him, All <span class="ital">men</span> seek for thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1255"><span id="lf0610_label_1587">38</span> And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1256"><span id="lf0610_label_1588">39</span> And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1257"><span id="lf0610_label_1589">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt425" id="lf0610_footnote_nt425_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1258"><span id="lf0610_label_1591">41</span> And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth <span class="ital">his</span> hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1259"><span id="lf0610_label_1592">42</span> And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1260"><span id="lf0610_label_1593">43</span> And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1261"><span id="lf0610_label_1594">44</span> And saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1262"><span id="lf0610_label_1595">45</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt426" id="lf0610_footnote_nt426_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But he went out, and began to publish <span class="ital">it</span> much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_046" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1597">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1263"><span id="lf0610_label_1598">1</span> And again <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt427" id="lf0610_footnote_nt427_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he entered into Capernaum after <span class="ital">some</span> days; and it was noised that he was in the house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1264"><span id="lf0610_label_1600">2</span> And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive <span class="ital">them,</span> no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1265"><span id="lf0610_label_1601">3</span> And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1266"><span id="lf0610_label_1602">4</span> And when they could not come nigh unto him <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt428" id="lf0610_footnote_nt428_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken <span class="ital">it</span> up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1267"><span id="lf0610_label_1604">5</span> When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1268"><span id="lf0610_label_1605">6</span> But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1269"><span id="lf0610_label_1606">7</span> Why doth this <span class="ital">man</span> thus speak blasphemies? <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt429" id="lf0610_footnote_nt429_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>who can forgive sins but God only?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>42<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1270"><span id="lf0610_label_1608">8</span> And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1271"><span id="lf0610_label_1609">9</span> Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, <span class="ital">Thy</span> sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1272"><span id="lf0610_label_1610">10</span> But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1273"><span id="lf0610_label_1611">11</span> I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1274"><span id="lf0610_label_1612">12</span> And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1275"><span id="lf0610_label_1613">13</span> And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1276"><span id="lf0610_label_1614">14</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt430" id="lf0610_footnote_nt430_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And as he passed by, he saw Levi the <span class="ital">son</span> of Alph&#xE6;us sitting <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt431" id="lf0610_footnote_nt431_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1277"><span id="lf0610_label_1617">15</span> And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1278"><span id="lf0610_label_1618">16</span> And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1279"><span id="lf0610_label_1619">17</span> When Jesus heard <span class="ital">it,</span> he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1280"><span id="lf0610_label_1620">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt432" id="lf0610_footnote_nt432_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1281"><span id="lf0610_label_1622">19</span> And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1282"><span id="lf0610_label_1623">20</span> But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1283"><span id="lf0610_label_1624">21</span> No man also seweth a piece of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt433" id="lf0610_footnote_nt433_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1284"><span id="lf0610_label_1626">22</span> And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1285"><span id="lf0610_label_1627">23</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt434" id="lf0610_footnote_nt434_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1286"><span id="lf0610_label_1629">24</span> And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1287"><span id="lf0610_label_1630">25</span> And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1288"><span id="lf0610_label_1631">26</span> How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1289"><span id="lf0610_label_1632">27</span> And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1290"><span id="lf0610_label_1633">28</span> Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_047" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1634">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1291"><span id="lf0610_label_1635">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt435" id="lf0610_footnote_nt435_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1292"><span id="lf0610_label_1637">2</span> And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1293"><span id="lf0610_label_1638">3</span> And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>43<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1294"><span id="lf0610_label_1639">4</span> And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1295"><span id="lf0610_label_1640">5</span> And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt436" id="lf0610_footnote_nt436_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched <span class="ital">it</span> out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1296"><span id="lf0610_label_1642">6</span> And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1297"><span id="lf0610_label_1643">7</span> But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Jud&#xE6;a,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1298"><span id="lf0610_label_1644">8</span> And from Jerusalem, and from Idum&#xE6;a, and <span class="ital">from</span> beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidou, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1299"><span id="lf0610_label_1645">9</span> And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1300"><span id="lf0610_label_1646">10</span> For he had healed many; insomuch that they <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt437" id="lf0610_footnote_nt437_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1301"><span id="lf0610_label_1648">11</span> And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1302"><span id="lf0610_label_1649">12</span> And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1303"><span id="lf0610_label_1650">13</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt438" id="lf0610_footnote_nt438_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth <span class="ital">unto him</span> whom he would: and they came unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1304"><span id="lf0610_label_1652">14</span> And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1305"><span id="lf0610_label_1653">15</span> And to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1306"><span id="lf0610_label_1654">16</span> And Simon he surnamed Peter;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1307"><span id="lf0610_label_1655">17</span> And James the <span class="ital">son</span> of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1308"><span id="lf0610_label_1656">18</span> And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the <span class="ital">son</span> of Alph&#xE6;us, and Thadd&#xE6;us, and Simon the Canaanite,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1309"><span id="lf0610_label_1657">19</span> And Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt439" id="lf0610_footnote_nt439_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>into an house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1310"><span id="lf0610_label_1659">20</span> And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1311"><span id="lf0610_label_1660">21</span> And when his <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt440" id="lf0610_footnote_nt440_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>friends heard <span class="ital">of it,</span> they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1312"><span id="lf0610_label_1662">22</span> &#xB6; And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt441" id="lf0610_footnote_nt441_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1313"><span id="lf0610_label_1664">23</span> And he called them <span class="ital">unto him,</span> and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1314"><span id="lf0610_label_1665">24</span> And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1315"><span id="lf0610_label_1666">25</span> And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1316"><span id="lf0610_label_1667">26</span> And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1317"><span id="lf0610_label_1668">27</span> No man can enter into a strong man&#x2019;s house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1318"><span id="lf0610_label_1669">28</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt442" id="lf0610_footnote_nt442_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1319"><span id="lf0610_label_1671">29</span> But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1320"><span id="lf0610_label_1672">30</span> Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1321"><span id="lf0610_label_1673">31</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt443" id="lf0610_footnote_nt443_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1322"><span id="lf0610_label_1675">32</span> And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1323"><span id="lf0610_label_1676">33</span> And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>44<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1324"><span id="lf0610_label_1677">34</span> And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1325"><span id="lf0610_label_1678">35</span> For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_048" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1679">4</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1326"><span id="lf0610_label_1680">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt444" id="lf0610_footnote_nt444_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1327"><span id="lf0610_label_1682">2</span> And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1328"><span id="lf0610_label_1683">3</span> Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1329"><span id="lf0610_label_1684">4</span> And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1330"><span id="lf0610_label_1685">5</span> And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1331"><span id="lf0610_label_1686">6</span> But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1332"><span id="lf0610_label_1687">7</span> And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1333"><span id="lf0610_label_1688">8</span> And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1334"><span id="lf0610_label_1689">9</span> And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1335"><span id="lf0610_label_1690">10</span> And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1336"><span id="lf0610_label_1691">11</span> And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all <span class="ital">these</span> things are done in parables:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1337"><span id="lf0610_label_1692">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt445" id="lf0610_footnote_nt445_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and <span class="ital">their</span> sins should be forgiven them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1338"><span id="lf0610_label_1694">13</span> And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1339"><span id="lf0610_label_1695">14</span> &#xB6; The sower soweth the word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1340"><span id="lf0610_label_1696">15</span> And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1341"><span id="lf0610_label_1697">16</span> And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1342"><span id="lf0610_label_1698">17</span> And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word&#x2019;s sake, immediately they are offended.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1343"><span id="lf0610_label_1699">18</span> And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1344"><span id="lf0610_label_1700">19</span> And the cares of this world, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt446" id="lf0610_footnote_nt446_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1345"><span id="lf0610_label_1702">20</span> And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive <span class="ital">it,</span> and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1346"><span id="lf0610_label_1703">21</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt447" id="lf0610_footnote_nt447_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt448" id="lf0610_footnote_nt448_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1347"><span id="lf0610_label_1706">22</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt449" id="lf0610_footnote_nt449_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1348"><span id="lf0610_label_1708">23</span> If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1349"><span id="lf0610_label_1709">24</span> And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt450" id="lf0610_footnote_nt450_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1350"><span id="lf0610_label_1711">25</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt451" id="lf0610_footnote_nt451_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1351"><span id="lf0610_label_1713">26</span> &#xB6; And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>45<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1352"><span id="lf0610_label_1714">27</span> And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1353"><span id="lf0610_label_1715">28</span> For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1354"><span id="lf0610_label_1716">29</span> But when the fruit is <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt452" id="lf0610_footnote_nt452_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1355"><span id="lf0610_label_1718">30</span> &#xB6; And he said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt453" id="lf0610_footnote_nt453_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1356"><span id="lf0610_label_1720">31</span> <span class="ital">It is</span> like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1357"><span id="lf0610_label_1721">32</span> But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1358"><span id="lf0610_label_1722">33</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt454" id="lf0610_footnote_nt454_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1359"><span id="lf0610_label_1724">34</span> But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1360"><span id="lf0610_label_1725">35</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt455" id="lf0610_footnote_nt455_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1361"><span id="lf0610_label_1727">36</span> And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1362"><span id="lf0610_label_1728">37</span> And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1363"><span id="lf0610_label_1729">38</span> And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1364"><span id="lf0610_label_1730">39</span> And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1365"><span id="lf0610_label_1731">40</span> And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1366"><span id="lf0610_label_1732">41</span> And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_049" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1733">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1367"><span id="lf0610_label_1734">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt456" id="lf0610_footnote_nt456_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1368"><span id="lf0610_label_1736">2</span> And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1369"><span id="lf0610_label_1737">3</span> Who had <span class="ital">his</span> dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1370"><span id="lf0610_label_1738">4</span> Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any <span class="ital">man</span> tame him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1371"><span id="lf0610_label_1739">5</span> And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1372"><span id="lf0610_label_1740">6</span> But when he saw Jesus afar off, he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt457" id="lf0610_footnote_nt457_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>ran and worshipped him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1373"><span id="lf0610_label_1742">7</span> And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, <span class="ital">thou</span> Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1374"><span id="lf0610_label_1743">8</span> For he said unto him, Come out of the man, <span class="ital">thou</span> unclean spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1375"><span id="lf0610_label_1744">9</span> And he asked him, What <span class="ital">is</span> thy name? And he answered, saying, My name <span class="ital">is</span> Legion: for we are many</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1376"><span id="lf0610_label_1745">10</span> And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1377"><span id="lf0610_label_1746">11</span> Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1378"><span id="lf0610_label_1747">12</span> And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1379"><span id="lf0610_label_1748">13</span> And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>46<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1380"><span id="lf0610_label_1749">14</span> And they that fed the swine fled, and told <span class="ital">it</span> in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1381"><span id="lf0610_label_1750">15</span> And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1382"><span id="lf0610_label_1751">16</span> And they that saw <span class="ital">it</span> told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and <span class="ital">also</span> concerning the swine.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1383"><span id="lf0610_label_1752">17</span> And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1384"><span id="lf0610_label_1753">18</span> And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1385"><span id="lf0610_label_1754">19</span> Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1386"><span id="lf0610_label_1755">20</span> And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all <span class="ital">men</span> did marvel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1387"><span id="lf0610_label_1756">21</span> And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1388"><span id="lf0610_label_1757">22</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt458" id="lf0610_footnote_nt458_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1389"><span id="lf0610_label_1759">23</span> And besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: <span class="ital">I pray thee,</span> come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1390"><span id="lf0610_label_1760">24</span> And <span class="ital">Jesus</span> went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1391"><span id="lf0610_label_1761">25</span> And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1392"><span id="lf0610_label_1762">26</span> And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1393"><span id="lf0610_label_1763">27</span> When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1394"><span id="lf0610_label_1764">28</span> For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1395"><span id="lf0610_label_1765">29</span> And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in <span class="ital">her</span> body that she was healed of that plague.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1396"><span id="lf0610_label_1766">30</span> And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1397"><span id="lf0610_label_1767">31</span> And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1398"><span id="lf0610_label_1768">32</span> And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1399"><span id="lf0610_label_1769">33</span> But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1400"><span id="lf0610_label_1770">34</span> And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1401"><span id="lf0610_label_1771">35</span> While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue&#x2019;s <span class="ital">house certain</span> which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1402"><span id="lf0610_label_1772">36</span> As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1403"><span id="lf0610_label_1773">37</span> And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1404"><span id="lf0610_label_1774">38</span> And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1405"><span id="lf0610_label_1775">39</span> And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1406"><span id="lf0610_label_1776">40</span> And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>47<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1407"><span id="lf0610_label_1777">41</span> And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1408"><span id="lf0610_label_1778">42</span> And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was <span class="ital">of the age</span> of twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1409"><span id="lf0610_label_1779">43</span> And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_050" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1780">6</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1410"><span id="lf0610_label_1781">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt459" id="lf0610_footnote_nt459_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1411"><span id="lf0610_label_1783">2</span> And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing <span class="ital">him</span> were astonished, saying, From whence hath this <span class="ital">man</span> these things? and what wisdom <span class="ital">is</span> thus which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1412"><span id="lf0610_label_1784">3</span> Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1413"><span id="lf0610_label_1785">4</span> But Jesus said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt460" id="lf0610_footnote_nt460_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1414"><span id="lf0610_label_1787">5</span> And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1415"><span id="lf0610_label_1788">6</span> And he marvelled because of their unbelief. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt461" id="lf0610_footnote_nt461_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he went round about the villages, teaching.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1416"><span id="lf0610_label_1790">7</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt462" id="lf0610_footnote_nt462_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt463" id="lf0610_footnote_nt463_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>called <span class="ital">unto him</span> the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1417"><span id="lf0610_label_1793">8</span> And commanded them that they should take nothing for <span class="ital">their</span> journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt464" id="lf0610_footnote_nt464_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>money in <span class="ital">their</span> purse:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1418"><span id="lf0610_label_1795">9</span> But <span class="ital">be</span> shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1419"><span id="lf0610_label_1796">10</span> And he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1420"><span id="lf0610_label_1797">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt465" id="lf0610_footnote_nt465_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt466" id="lf0610_footnote_nt466_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1421"><span id="lf0610_label_1800">12</span> And they went out, and preached that men should repent.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1422"><span id="lf0610_label_1801">13</span> And they cast out many devils, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt467" id="lf0610_footnote_nt467_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1423"><span id="lf0610_label_1803">14</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt468" id="lf0610_footnote_nt468_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And king Herod heard <span class="ital">of him;</span> (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1424"><span id="lf0610_label_1805">15</span> Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1425"><span id="lf0610_label_1806">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt469" id="lf0610_footnote_nt469_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But when Herod heard <span class="ital">thereof,</span> he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1426"><span id="lf0610_label_1808">17</span> For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias&#x2019; sake, his brother Philip&#x2019;s wife: for he had married her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1427"><span id="lf0610_label_1809">18</span> For John had said unto Herod, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt470" id="lf0610_footnote_nt470_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother&#x2019;s wife.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1428"><span id="lf0610_label_1811">19</span> Therefore Herodias had <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt471" id="lf0610_footnote_nt471_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1429"><span id="lf0610_label_1813">20</span> For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt472" id="lf0610_footnote_nt472_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1430"><span id="lf0610_label_1815">21</span> And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief <span class="ital">estates</span> of Galilee;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1431"><span id="lf0610_label_1816">22</span> And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give <span class="ital">it</span> thee.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>48<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1432"><span id="lf0610_label_1817">23</span> And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give <span class="ital">it</span> thee, unto the half of my kingdom.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1433"><span id="lf0610_label_1818">24</span> And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1434"><span id="lf0610_label_1819">25</span> And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1435"><span id="lf0610_label_1820">26</span> And the king was exceeding sorry; <span class="ital">yet</span> for his oath&#x2019;s sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1436"><span id="lf0610_label_1821">27</span> And immediately the king sent <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt473" id="lf0610_footnote_nt473_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1437"><span id="lf0610_label_1823">28</span> And brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1438"><span id="lf0610_label_1824">29</span> And when his disciples heard <span class="ital">of it,</span> they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1439"><span id="lf0610_label_1825">30</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt474" id="lf0610_footnote_nt474_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1440"><span id="lf0610_label_1827">31</span> And he said unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while: for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1441"><span id="lf0610_label_1828">32</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt475" id="lf0610_footnote_nt475_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1442"><span id="lf0610_label_1830">33</span> And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1443"><span id="lf0610_label_1831">34</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt476" id="lf0610_footnote_nt476_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1444"><span id="lf0610_label_1833">35</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt477" id="lf0610_footnote_nt477_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time <span class="ital">is</span> far passed:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1445"><span id="lf0610_label_1835">36</span> Send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1446"><span id="lf0610_label_1836">37</span> He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt478" id="lf0610_footnote_nt478_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?</p>
