<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1447"><span id="lf0610_label_1838">38</span> He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1448"><span id="lf0610_label_1839">39</span> And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1449"><span id="lf0610_label_1840">40</span> And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1450"><span id="lf0610_label_1841">41</span> And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave <span class="ital">them</span> to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1451"><span id="lf0610_label_1842">42</span> And they did all eat, and were filled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1452"><span id="lf0610_label_1843">43</span> And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1453"><span id="lf0610_label_1844">44</span> And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1454"><span id="lf0610_label_1845">45</span> And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt479" id="lf0610_footnote_nt479_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1455"><span id="lf0610_label_1847">46</span> And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1456"><span id="lf0610_label_1848">47</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt480" id="lf0610_footnote_nt480_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1457"><span id="lf0610_label_1850">48</span> And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1458"><span id="lf0610_label_1851">49</span> But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1459"><span id="lf0610_label_1852">50</span> For they all saw him, and were troubled. And <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>49<span class="bracket">]</span></span> immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1460"><span id="lf0610_label_1853">51</span> And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1461"><span id="lf0610_label_1854">52</span> For they considered not <span class="ital">the miracle</span> of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1462"><span id="lf0610_label_1855">53</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt481" id="lf0610_footnote_nt481_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1463"><span id="lf0610_label_1857">54</span> And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1464"><span id="lf0610_label_1858">55</span> And ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1465"><span id="lf0610_label_1859">56</span> And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt482" id="lf0610_footnote_nt482_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>him were made whole.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_051" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1861">7</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1466"><span id="lf0610_label_1862">1</span> Then <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt483" id="lf0610_footnote_nt483_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1467"><span id="lf0610_label_1864">2</span> And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt484" id="lf0610_footnote_nt484_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1468"><span id="lf0610_label_1866">3</span> For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash <span class="ital">their</span> hands <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt485" id="lf0610_footnote_nt485_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1469"><span id="lf0610_label_1868">4</span> And <span class="ital">when they come</span> from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, <span class="ital">as</span> the washing of cups, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt486" id="lf0610_footnote_nt486_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pots, brasen vessels, and of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt487" id="lf0610_footnote_nt487_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>tables.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1470"><span id="lf0610_label_1871">5</span> Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1471"><span id="lf0610_label_1872">6</span> He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt488" id="lf0610_footnote_nt488_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This people honoureth me with <span class="ital">their</span> lips, but their heart is far from me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1472"><span id="lf0610_label_1874">7</span> Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching <span class="ital">for</span> doctrines the commandments of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1473"><span id="lf0610_label_1875">8</span> For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, <span class="ital">as</span> the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1474"><span id="lf0610_label_1876">9</span> And he said unto them, Full well ye <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt489" id="lf0610_footnote_nt489_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1475"><span id="lf0610_label_1878">10</span> For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1476"><span id="lf0610_label_1879">11</span> But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, <span class="ital">It is</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt490" id="lf0610_footnote_nt490_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; <span class="ital">he shall be free.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1477"><span id="lf0610_label_1881">12</span> And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1478"><span id="lf0610_label_1882">13</span> Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1479"><span id="lf0610_label_1883">14</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt491" id="lf0610_footnote_nt491_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he had called all the people <span class="ital">unto him,</span> he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one <span class="ital">of you,</span> and understand:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1480"><span id="lf0610_label_1885">15</span> There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1481"><span id="lf0610_label_1886">16</span> If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1482"><span id="lf0610_label_1887">17</span> And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1483"><span id="lf0610_label_1888">18</span> And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, <span class="ital">it</span> cannot defile him;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1484"><span id="lf0610_label_1889">19</span> Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1485"><span id="lf0610_label_1890">20</span> And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>50<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1486"><span id="lf0610_label_1891">21</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt492" id="lf0610_footnote_nt492_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1487"><span id="lf0610_label_1893">22</span> Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1488"><span id="lf0610_label_1894">23</span> All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1489"><span id="lf0610_label_1895">24</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt493" id="lf0610_footnote_nt493_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know <span class="ital">it:</span> but he could not be hid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1490"><span id="lf0610_label_1897">25</span> For a <span class="ital">certain</span> woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1491"><span id="lf0610_label_1898">26</span> The woman was a <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt494" id="lf0610_footnote_nt494_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1492"><span id="lf0610_label_1900">27</span> But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children&#x2019;s bread, and to cast <span class="ital">it</span> unto the dogs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1493"><span id="lf0610_label_1901">28</span> And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children&#x2019;s crumbs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1494"><span id="lf0610_label_1902">29</span> And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1495"><span id="lf0610_label_1903">30</span> And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1496"><span id="lf0610_label_1904">31</span> &#xB6; And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1497"><span id="lf0610_label_1905">32</span> And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1498"><span id="lf0610_label_1906">33</span> And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1499"><span id="lf0610_label_1907">34</span> And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1500"><span id="lf0610_label_1908">35</span> And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1501"><span id="lf0610_label_1909">36</span> And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published <span class="ital">it;</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1502"><span id="lf0610_label_1910">37</span> And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_052" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1911">8</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1503"><span id="lf0610_label_1912">1</span> In those days <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt495" id="lf0610_footnote_nt495_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples <span class="ital">unto him,</span> and saith unto them,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1504"><span id="lf0610_label_1914">2</span> I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1505"><span id="lf0610_label_1915">3</span> And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1506"><span id="lf0610_label_1916">4</span> And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these <span class="ital">men</span> with bread here in the wilderness?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1507"><span id="lf0610_label_1917">5</span> And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1508"><span id="lf0610_label_1918">6</span> And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before <span class="ital">them;</span> and they did set <span class="ital">them</span> before the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1509"><span id="lf0610_label_1919">7</span> And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1510"><span id="lf0610_label_1920">8</span> So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken <span class="ital">meat</span> that was left seven baskets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1511"><span id="lf0610_label_1921">9</span> And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1512"><span id="lf0610_label_1922">10</span> &#xB6; And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1513"><span id="lf0610_label_1923">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt496" id="lf0610_footnote_nt496_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the Pharisees came forth, and began to <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>51<span class="bracket">]</span></span> question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1514"><span id="lf0610_label_1925">12</span> And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1515"><span id="lf0610_label_1926">13</span> And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1516"><span id="lf0610_label_1927">14</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt497" id="lf0610_footnote_nt497_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now <span class="ital">the disciples</span> had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1517"><span id="lf0610_label_1929">15</span> And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and <span class="ital">of</span> the leaven of Herod.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1518"><span id="lf0610_label_1930">16</span> And they reasoned among themselves, saying, <span class="ital">It is</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt498" id="lf0610_footnote_nt498_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>because we have no bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1519"><span id="lf0610_label_1932">17</span> And when Jesus knew <span class="ital">it,</span> he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1520"><span id="lf0610_label_1933">18</span> Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1521"><span id="lf0610_label_1934">19</span> When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1522"><span id="lf0610_label_1935">20</span> And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1523"><span id="lf0610_label_1936">21</span> And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1524"><span id="lf0610_label_1937">22</span> &#xB6; And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1525"><span id="lf0610_label_1938">23</span> And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1526"><span id="lf0610_label_1939">24</span> And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1527"><span id="lf0610_label_1940">25</span> After that he put <span class="ital">his</span> hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1528"><span id="lf0610_label_1941">26</span> And he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell <span class="ital">it</span> to any in the town.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1529"><span id="lf0610_label_1942">27</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt499" id="lf0610_footnote_nt499_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of C&#xE6;sarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1530"><span id="lf0610_label_1944">28</span> And they answered, John the Baptist: but some <span class="ital">say,</span> Elias; and others, One of the prophets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1531"><span id="lf0610_label_1945">29</span> And he saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am? And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1532"><span id="lf0610_label_1946">30</span> And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1533"><span id="lf0610_label_1947">31</span> And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and <span class="ital">of</span> the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1534"><span id="lf0610_label_1948">32</span> And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1535"><span id="lf0610_label_1949">33</span> But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1536"><span id="lf0610_label_1950">34</span> &#xB6; And when he had called the people <span class="ital">unto him</span> with his disciples also, he said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt500" id="lf0610_footnote_nt500_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1537"><span id="lf0610_label_1952">35</span> For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel&#x2019;s, the same shall save it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1538"><span id="lf0610_label_1953">36</span> For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1539"><span id="lf0610_label_1954">37</span> Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1540"><span id="lf0610_label_1955">38</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt501" id="lf0610_footnote_nt501_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_053" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_1957">9</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1541"><span id="lf0610_label_1958">1</span> And he said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt502" id="lf0610_footnote_nt502_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1542"><span id="lf0610_label_1960">2</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt503" id="lf0610_footnote_nt503_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And after six days Jesus taketh <span class="ital">with him</span> Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1543"><span id="lf0610_label_1962">3</span> And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1544"><span id="lf0610_label_1963">4</span> And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1545"><span id="lf0610_label_1964">5</span> And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1546"><span id="lf0610_label_1965">6</span> For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1547"><span id="lf0610_label_1966">7</span> And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1548"><span id="lf0610_label_1967">8</span> And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1549"><span id="lf0610_label_1968">9</span> And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1550"><span id="lf0610_label_1969">10</span> And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1551"><span id="lf0610_label_1970">11</span> &#xB6; And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1552"><span id="lf0610_label_1971">12</span> And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt504" id="lf0610_footnote_nt504_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1553"><span id="lf0610_label_1973">13</span> But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1554"><span id="lf0610_label_1974">14</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt505" id="lf0610_footnote_nt505_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he came to <span class="ital">his</span> disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1555"><span id="lf0610_label_1976">15</span> And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to <span class="ital">him</span> saluted him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1556"><span id="lf0610_label_1977">16</span> And he asked the scribes, What question ye <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt506" id="lf0610_footnote_nt506_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>with them?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1557"><span id="lf0610_label_1979">17</span> And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1558"><span id="lf0610_label_1980">18</span> And wheresoever he taketh him, he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt507" id="lf0610_footnote_nt507_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1559"><span id="lf0610_label_1982">19</span> He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1560"><span id="lf0610_label_1983">20</span> And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1561"><span id="lf0610_label_1984">21</span> And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1562"><span id="lf0610_label_1985">22</span> And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1563"><span id="lf0610_label_1986">23</span> Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things <span class="ital">are</span> possible to him that believeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1564"><span id="lf0610_label_1987">24</span> And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1565"><span id="lf0610_label_1988">25</span> When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, <span class="ital">Thou</span> dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1566"><span id="lf0610_label_1989">26</span> And <span class="ital">the spirit</span> cried, and rent him sore, and <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>53<span class="bracket">]</span></span> came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1567"><span id="lf0610_label_1990">27</span> But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1568"><span id="lf0610_label_1991">28</span> And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1569"><span id="lf0610_label_1992">29</span> And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1570"><span id="lf0610_label_1993">30</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt508" id="lf0610_footnote_nt508_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1571"><span id="lf0610_label_1995">31</span> For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1572"><span id="lf0610_label_1996">32</span> But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1573"><span id="lf0610_label_1997">33</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt509" id="lf0610_footnote_nt509_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1574"><span id="lf0610_label_1999">34</span> But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who <span class="ital">should be</span> the greatest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1575"><span id="lf0610_label_2000">35</span> And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, <span class="ital">the same</span> shall be last of all, and servant of all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1576"><span id="lf0610_label_2001">36</span> And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1577"><span id="lf0610_label_2002">37</span> Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1578"><span id="lf0610_label_2003">38</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt510" id="lf0610_footnote_nt510_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1579"><span id="lf0610_label_2005">39</span> But Jesus said, Forbid him not: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt511" id="lf0610_footnote_nt511_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1580"><span id="lf0610_label_2007">40</span> For he that is not against us is on our part.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1581"><span id="lf0610_label_2008">41</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt512" id="lf0610_footnote_nt512_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1582"><span id="lf0610_label_2010">42</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt513" id="lf0610_footnote_nt513_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And whosoever shall offend one of <span class="ital">these</span> little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1583"><span id="lf0610_label_2012">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt514" id="lf0610_footnote_nt514_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And if thy hand <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt515" id="lf0610_footnote_nt515_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1584"><span id="lf0610_label_2015">44</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt516" id="lf0610_footnote_nt516_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1585"><span id="lf0610_label_2017">45</span> And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1586"><span id="lf0610_label_2018">46</span> Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1587"><span id="lf0610_label_2019">47</span> And if thine eye <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt517" id="lf0610_footnote_nt517_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1588"><span id="lf0610_label_2021">48</span> Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1589"><span id="lf0610_label_2022">49</span> For every one shall be salted with fire, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt518" id="lf0610_footnote_nt518_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1590"><span id="lf0610_label_2024">50</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt519" id="lf0610_footnote_nt519_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Salt <span class="ital">is</span> good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_054" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2026">10</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1591"><span id="lf0610_label_2027">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt520" id="lf0610_footnote_nt520_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Jud&#xE6;a by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1592"><span id="lf0610_label_2029">2</span> &#xB6; And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away <span class="ital">his</span> wife? tempting him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1593"><span id="lf0610_label_2030">3</span> And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>54<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1594"><span id="lf0610_label_2031">4</span> And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put <span class="ital">her</span> away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1595"><span id="lf0610_label_2032">5</span> And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1596"><span id="lf0610_label_2033">6</span> But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1597"><span id="lf0610_label_2034">7</span> For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1598"><span id="lf0610_label_2035">8</span> And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1599"><span id="lf0610_label_2036">9</span> What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1600"><span id="lf0610_label_2037">10</span> And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same <span class="ital">matter.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1601"><span id="lf0610_label_2038">11</span> And he saith unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt521" id="lf0610_footnote_nt521_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1602"><span id="lf0610_label_2040">12</span> And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1603"><span id="lf0610_label_2041">13</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt522" id="lf0610_footnote_nt522_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and <span class="ital">his</span> disciples rebuked those that brought <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1604"><span id="lf0610_label_2043">14</span> But when Jesus saw <span class="ital">it,</span> he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1605"><span id="lf0610_label_2044">15</span> Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1606"><span id="lf0610_label_2045">16</span> And he took them up in his arms, put <span class="ital">his</span> hands upon them, and blessed them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1607"><span id="lf0610_label_2046">17</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt523" id="lf0610_footnote_nt523_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1608"><span id="lf0610_label_2048">18</span> And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? <span class="ital">there is</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt524" id="lf0610_footnote_nt524_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>none good but one, <span class="ital">that is,</span> God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1609"><span id="lf0610_label_2050">19</span> Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1610"><span id="lf0610_label_2051">20</span> And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1611"><span id="lf0610_label_2052">21</span> Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go thy way, seel whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1612"><span id="lf0610_label_2053">22</span> And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved; for he had great possessions.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1613"><span id="lf0610_label_2054">23</span> &#xB6; And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1614"><span id="lf0610_label_2055">24</span> And the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1615"><span id="lf0610_label_2056">25</span> It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1616"><span id="lf0610_label_2057">26</span> And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1617"><span id="lf0610_label_2058">27</span> And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men <span class="ital">it is</span> impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1618"><span id="lf0610_label_2059">28</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt525" id="lf0610_footnote_nt525_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1619"><span id="lf0610_label_2061">29</span> And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel&#x2019;s,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1620"><span id="lf0610_label_2062">30</span> But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1621"><span id="lf0610_label_2063">31</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt526" id="lf0610_footnote_nt526_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But many <span class="ital">that are</span> first shall be last; and the last first.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1622"><span id="lf0610_label_2065">32</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt527" id="lf0610_footnote_nt527_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>55<span class="bracket">]</span></span> they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1623"><span id="lf0610_label_2067">33</span> <span class="ital">Saying,</span> Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1624"><span id="lf0610_label_2068">34</span> And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1625"><span id="lf0610_label_2069">35</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt528" id="lf0610_footnote_nt528_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1626"><span id="lf0610_label_2071">36</span> And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1627"><span id="lf0610_label_2072">37</span> They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1628"><span id="lf0610_label_2073">38</span> But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1629"><span id="lf0610_label_2074">39</span> And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1630"><span id="lf0610_label_2075">40</span> But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but <span class="ital">it shall be given to them</span> for whom it is prepared.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1631"><span id="lf0610_label_2076">41</span> And when the ten heard <span class="ital">it,</span> they began to be much displeased with James and John.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1632"><span id="lf0610_label_2077">42</span> But Jesus called them <span class="ital">to him,</span> and saith unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt529" id="lf0610_footnote_nt529_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Ye know that they which <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt530" id="lf0610_footnote_nt530_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1633"><span id="lf0610_label_2080">43</span> But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your minister:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1634"><span id="lf0610_label_2081">44</span> And whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1635"><span id="lf0610_label_2082">45</span> For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1636"><span id="lf0610_label_2083">46</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt531" id="lf0610_footnote_nt531_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartim&#xE6;us, the son of Tim&#xE6;us, sat by the highway side begging.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1637"><span id="lf0610_label_2085">47</span> And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, <span class="ital">thou</span> son of David, have mercy on me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1638"><span id="lf0610_label_2086">48</span> And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, <span class="ital">Thou</span> son of David, have mercy on me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1639"><span id="lf0610_label_2087">49</span> And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he calleth thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1640"><span id="lf0610_label_2088">50</span> And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1641"><span id="lf0610_label_2089">51</span> And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1642"><span id="lf0610_label_2090">52</span> And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt532" id="lf0610_footnote_nt532_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>made thee whole. And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_055" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2092">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1643"><span id="lf0610_label_2093">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt533" id="lf0610_footnote_nt533_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1644"><span id="lf0610_label_2095">2</span> And saith unto them, Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bring <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1645"><span id="lf0610_label_2096">3</span> And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1646"><span id="lf0610_label_2097">4</span> And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1647"><span id="lf0610_label_2098">5</span> And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>56<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1648"><span id="lf0610_label_2099">6</span> And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1649"><span id="lf0610_label_2100">7</span> And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1650"><span id="lf0610_label_2101">8</span> And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt534" id="lf0610_footnote_nt534_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>branches off the trees, and strawed <span class="ital">them</span> in the way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1651"><span id="lf0610_label_2103">9</span> And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed <span class="ital">is</span> he that cometh in the name of the Lord:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1652"><span id="lf0610_label_2104">10</span> Blessed <span class="ital">be</span> the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1653"><span id="lf0610_label_2105">11</span> And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1654"><span id="lf0610_label_2106">12</span> &#xB6; And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1655"><span id="lf0610_label_2107">13</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt535" id="lf0610_footnote_nt535_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not <span class="ital">yet.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1656"><span id="lf0610_label_2109">14</span> And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever. And his disciples heard <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1657"><span id="lf0610_label_2110">15</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt536" id="lf0610_footnote_nt536_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1658"><span id="lf0610_label_2112">16</span> And would not suffer that any man should carry <span class="ital">any</span> vessel through the temple.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1659"><span id="lf0610_label_2113">17</span> And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1660"><span id="lf0610_label_2114">18</span> And the scribes and chief priests heard <span class="ital">it,</span> and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1661"><span id="lf0610_label_2115">19</span> And when even was come, he went out of the city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1662"><span id="lf0610_label_2116">20</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt537" id="lf0610_footnote_nt537_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1663"><span id="lf0610_label_2118">21</span> And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1664"><span id="lf0610_label_2119">22</span> And Jesus answering saith unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt538" id="lf0610_footnote_nt538_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Have faith in God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1665"><span id="lf0610_label_2121">23</span> For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1666"><span id="lf0610_label_2122">24</span> Therefore I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt539" id="lf0610_footnote_nt539_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive <span class="ital">them,</span> and ye shall have <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1667"><span id="lf0610_label_2124">25</span> And when ye stand praying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt540" id="lf0610_footnote_nt540_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1668"><span id="lf0610_label_2126">26</span> But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1669"><span id="lf0610_label_2127">27</span> &#xB6; And they come again to Jerusalem: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt541" id="lf0610_footnote_nt541_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1670"><span id="lf0610_label_2129">28</span> And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1671"><span id="lf0610_label_2130">29</span> And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt542" id="lf0610_footnote_nt542_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1672"><span id="lf0610_label_2132">30</span> The baptism of John, was <span class="ital">it</span> from heaven, or of men? answer me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1673"><span id="lf0610_label_2133">31</span> And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1674"><span id="lf0610_label_2134">32</span> But if we shall say, Of men; they feared <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>57<span class="bracket">]</span></span> the people: for all <span class="ital">men</span> counted John, that he was a prophet indeed</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1675"><span id="lf0610_label_2135">33</span> And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_056" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2136">12</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1676"><span id="lf0610_label_2137">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt543" id="lf0610_footnote_nt543_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he began to speak unto them by parables. A <span class="ital">certain</span> man planted a vineyard, and set an hedge about <span class="ital">it,</span> and digged <span class="ital">a place for</span> the winefat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1677"><span id="lf0610_label_2139">2</span> And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1678"><span id="lf0610_label_2140">3</span> And they caught <span class="ital">him,</span> and beat him, and sent <span class="ital">him</span> away empty.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1679"><span id="lf0610_label_2141">4</span> And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and wounded <span class="ital">him</span> in the head, and sent <span class="ital">him</span> away shamefully handled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1680"><span id="lf0610_label_2142">5</span> And again he sent another; and him they killed, and many others; beating some, and killing some.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1681"><span id="lf0610_label_2143">6</span> Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1682"><span id="lf0610_label_2144">7</span> But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1683"><span id="lf0610_label_2145">8</span> And they took him, and killed <span class="ital">him,</span> and cast <span class="ital">him</span> out of the vineyard.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1684"><span id="lf0610_label_2146">9</span> What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do? he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1685"><span id="lf0610_label_2147">10</span> And have ye not read this scripture; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt544" id="lf0610_footnote_nt544_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1686"><span id="lf0610_label_2149">11</span> This was the Lord&#x2019;s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1687"><span id="lf0610_label_2150">12</span> And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1688"><span id="lf0610_label_2151">13</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt545" id="lf0610_footnote_nt545_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in <span class="ital">his</span> words.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1689"><span id="lf0610_label_2153">14</span> And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to C&#xE6;sar, or not?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1690"><span id="lf0610_label_2154">15</span> Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt546" id="lf0610_footnote_nt546_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>penny, that I may see <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1691"><span id="lf0610_label_2156">16</span> And they brought <span class="ital">it.</span> And he saith unto them, Whose <span class="ital">is</span> this image and superscription? And they said unto him, C&#xE6;sar&#x2019;s.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1692"><span id="lf0610_label_2157">17</span> And Jesus answering said unto them, Render to C&#xE6;sar the things that are C&#xE6;sar&#x2019;s, and to God the things that are God&#x2019;s. And they marvelled at him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1693"><span id="lf0610_label_2158">18</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt547" id="lf0610_footnote_nt547_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1694"><span id="lf0610_label_2160">19</span> Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man&#x2019;s brother die, and leave <span class="ital">his</span> wife <span class="ital">behind him,</span> and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1695"><span id="lf0610_label_2161">20</span> Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1696"><span id="lf0610_label_2162">21</span> And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1697"><span id="lf0610_label_2163">22</span> And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1698"><span id="lf0610_label_2164">23</span> In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1699"><span id="lf0610_label_2165">24</span> And Jesus answering said unto them, Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1700"><span id="lf0610_label_2166">25</span> For when they shall rise from the dead, they <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>58<span class="bracket">]</span></span> neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels which are in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1701"><span id="lf0610_label_2167">26</span> And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I <span class="ital">am</span> the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1702"><span id="lf0610_label_2168">27</span> He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly err.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1703"><span id="lf0610_label_2169">28</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt548" id="lf0610_footnote_nt548_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1704"><span id="lf0610_label_2171">29</span> And Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments <span class="ital">is,</span> Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1705"><span id="lf0610_label_2172">30</span> And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: this <span class="ital">is</span> the first commandment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1706"><span id="lf0610_label_2173">31</span> And the second <span class="ital">is</span> like, <span class="ital">namely</span> this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1707"><span id="lf0610_label_2174">32</span> And the scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth: for there is one God; and there is none other but he:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1708"><span id="lf0610_label_2175">33</span> And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love <span class="ital">his</span> neighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1709"><span id="lf0610_label_2176">34</span> And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no man after that durst ask him <span class="ital">any question.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1710"><span id="lf0610_label_2177">35</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt549" id="lf0610_footnote_nt549_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the son of David?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1711"><span id="lf0610_label_2179">36</span> For David himself said by the Holy Ghost, The <span class="sc">Lord</span> said to my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1712"><span id="lf0610_label_2180">37</span> David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he <span class="ital">then</span> his son? And the common people heard him gladly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1713"><span id="lf0610_label_2181">38</span> &#xB6; And he said unto them in his doctrine, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt550" id="lf0610_footnote_nt550_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, and <span class="ital">love</span> salutations in the marketplaces,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1714"><span id="lf0610_label_2183">39</span> And the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1715"><span id="lf0610_label_2184">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt551" id="lf0610_footnote_nt551_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Which devour widows&#x2019; houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1716"><span id="lf0610_label_2186">41</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt552" id="lf0610_footnote_nt552_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt553" id="lf0610_footnote_nt553_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1717"><span id="lf0610_label_2189">42</span> And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt554" id="lf0610_footnote_nt554_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>mites, which make a farthing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1718"><span id="lf0610_label_2191">43</span> And he called <span class="ital">unto him</span> his disciples, and saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That this poor widow hath cast more in, than all they which have cast into the treasury:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1719"><span id="lf0610_label_2192">44</span> For all <span class="ital">they</span> did cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, <span class="ital">even</span> all her living.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_057" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2193">13</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1720"><span id="lf0610_label_2194">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt555" id="lf0610_footnote_nt555_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, see what manner of stones and what buildings <span class="ital">are here!</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1721"><span id="lf0610_label_2196">2</span> And Jesus answering said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1722"><span id="lf0610_label_2197">3</span> And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1723"><span id="lf0610_label_2198">4</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt556" id="lf0610_footnote_nt556_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Tell us, when shall these things be? and what <span class="ital">shall be</span> the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1724"><span id="lf0610_label_2200">5</span> And Jesus answering them began to say, Take heed lest any <span class="ital">man</span> deceive you:</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>59<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1725"><span id="lf0610_label_2201">6</span> For many shall come in my name, saying, I am <span class="ital">Christ;</span> and shall deceive many.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1726"><span id="lf0610_label_2202">7</span> And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: for <span class="ital">such things</span> must needs be; but the end <span class="ital">shall</span> not <span class="ital">be</span> yet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1727"><span id="lf0610_label_2203">8</span> For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these <span class="ital">are</span> the beginnings of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt557" id="lf0610_footnote_nt557_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>sorrows.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1728"><span id="lf0610_label_2205">9</span> &#xB6; But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1729"><span id="lf0610_label_2206">10</span> And the gospel must first be published among all nations.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1730"><span id="lf0610_label_2207">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt558" id="lf0610_footnote_nt558_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But when they shall lead <span class="ital">you,</span> and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1731"><span id="lf0610_label_2209">12</span> Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against <span class="ital">their</span> parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1732"><span id="lf0610_label_2210">13</span> And ye shall be hated of all <span class="ital">men</span> for my name&#x2019;s sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1733"><span id="lf0610_label_2211">14</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt559" id="lf0610_footnote_nt559_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Jud&#xE6;a flee to the mountains:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1734"><span id="lf0610_label_2213">15</span> And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter <span class="ital">therein,</span> to take any thing out of his house:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1735"><span id="lf0610_label_2214">16</span> And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1736"><span id="lf0610_label_2215">17</span> But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1737"><span id="lf0610_label_2216">18</span> And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1738"><span id="lf0610_label_2217">19</span> For <span class="ital">in</span> those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1739"><span id="lf0610_label_2218">20</span> And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect&#x2019;s sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1740"><span id="lf0610_label_2219">21</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt560" id="lf0610_footnote_nt560_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, here <span class="ital">is</span> Christ; or, lo, <span class="ital">he is</span> there; believe <span class="ital">him</span> not:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1741"><span id="lf0610_label_2221">22</span> For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if <span class="ital">it were</span> possible, even the elect.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1742"><span id="lf0610_label_2222">23</span> But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1743"><span id="lf0610_label_2223">24</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt561" id="lf0610_footnote_nt561_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1744"><span id="lf0610_label_2225">25</span> And the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1745"><span id="lf0610_label_2226">26</span> And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1746"><span id="lf0610_label_2227">27</span> And then shall he send his angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1747"><span id="lf0610_label_2228">28</span> Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When her branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1748"><span id="lf0610_label_2229">29</span> So ye in like manner, when ye shall see these things come to pass, know that it is nigh, <span class="ital">even</span> at the doors.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1749"><span id="lf0610_label_2230">30</span> Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1750"><span id="lf0610_label_2231">31</span> Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1751"><span id="lf0610_label_2232">32</span> &#xB6; But of that day and <span class="ital">that</span> hour knoweth no man, no, not the angels which are in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>60<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1752"><span id="lf0610_label_2233">33</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt562" id="lf0610_footnote_nt562_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1753"><span id="lf0610_label_2235">34</span> <span class="ital">For the Son of man is</span> as a man taking a far journey, who left his house, and gave authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1754"><span id="lf0610_label_2236">35</span> Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1755"><span id="lf0610_label_2237">36</span> Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1756"><span id="lf0610_label_2238">37</span> And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_058" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2239">14</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1757"><span id="lf0610_label_2240">1</span> After <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt563" id="lf0610_footnote_nt563_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>two days was <span class="ital">the feast of</span> the passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put <span class="ital">him</span> to death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1758"><span id="lf0610_label_2242">2</span> But they said, Not on the feast <span class="ital">day,</span> lest there be an uproar of the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1759"><span id="lf0610_label_2243">3</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt564" id="lf0610_footnote_nt564_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt565" id="lf0610_footnote_nt565_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>spikenard very precious; and she brake the box, and poured <span class="ital">it</span> on his head.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1760"><span id="lf0610_label_2246">4</span> And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1761"><span id="lf0610_label_2247">5</span> For it might have been sold for more than three hundred <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt566" id="lf0610_footnote_nt566_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pence, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1762"><span id="lf0610_label_2249">6</span> And Jesus said, Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1763"><span id="lf0610_label_2250">7</span> For ye have the poor with you always, and whensoever ye will ye may do them good: but me ye have not always.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1764"><span id="lf0610_label_2251">8</span> She hath done what she could: she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1765"><span id="lf0610_label_2252">9</span> Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world, <span class="ital">this</span> also that she hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1766"><span id="lf0610_label_2253">10</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt567" id="lf0610_footnote_nt567_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief priests, to betray him unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1767"><span id="lf0610_label_2255">11</span> And when they heard <span class="ital">it,</span> they were glad, and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1768"><span id="lf0610_label_2256">12</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt568" id="lf0610_footnote_nt568_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the first day of unleavened bread, when they <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt569" id="lf0610_footnote_nt569_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>killed the passover, his disciples said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1769"><span id="lf0610_label_2259">13</span> And he sendeth forth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, Go ye into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water: follow him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1770"><span id="lf0610_label_2260">14</span> And wheresoever he shall go in, say ye to the goodman of the house, The Master saith, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1771"><span id="lf0610_label_2261">15</span> And he will shew you a large upper room furnished <span class="ital">and</span> prepared: there make ready for us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1772"><span id="lf0610_label_2262">16</span> And his disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1773"><span id="lf0610_label_2263">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt570" id="lf0610_footnote_nt570_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And in the evening he cometh with the twelve.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1774"><span id="lf0610_label_2265">18</span> And as they sat and did eat, Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, One of you which eateth with me shall betray me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_1775"><span id="lf0610_label_2266">19</span> And they began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one, <span class="ital">Is</span> it I? and another <span class="ital">said, Is</span> it I?</p>
