<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2109"><span id="lf0610_label_2703">44</span> And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_066" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2704">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2110"><span id="lf0610_label_2705">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt668" id="lf0610_footnote_nt668_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2111"><span id="lf0610_label_2707">2</span> And saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing <span class="ital">their</span> nets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2112"><span id="lf0610_label_2708">3</span> And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon&#x2019;s, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land. And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2113"><span id="lf0610_label_2709">4</span> Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2114"><span id="lf0610_label_2710">5</span> And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2115"><span id="lf0610_label_2711">6</span> And when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2116"><span id="lf0610_label_2712">7</span> And they beckoned unto <span class="ital">their</span> partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2117"><span id="lf0610_label_2713">8</span> When Simon Peter saw <span class="ital">it,</span> he fell down at Jesus&#x2019; knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>73<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2118"><span id="lf0610_label_2714">9</span> For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2119"><span id="lf0610_label_2715">10</span> And so <span class="ital">was</span> also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2120"><span id="lf0610_label_2716">11</span> And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2121"><span id="lf0610_label_2717">12</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt669" id="lf0610_footnote_nt669_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on <span class="ital">his</span> face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2122"><span id="lf0610_label_2719">13</span> And he put forth <span class="ital">his</span> hand, and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2123"><span id="lf0610_label_2720">14</span> And he charged him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2124"><span id="lf0610_label_2721">15</span> But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2125"><span id="lf0610_label_2722">16</span> &#xB6; And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2126"><span id="lf0610_label_2723">17</span> And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Jud&#xE6;a, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was <span class="ital">present</span> to heal them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2127"><span id="lf0610_label_2724">18</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt670" id="lf0610_footnote_nt670_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought <span class="ital">means</span> to bring him in, and to lay <span class="ital">him</span> before him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2128"><span id="lf0610_label_2726">19</span> And when they could not find by what <span class="ital">way</span> they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with <span class="ital">his</span> couch into the midst before Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2129"><span id="lf0610_label_2727">20</span> And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2130"><span id="lf0610_label_2728">21</span> And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2131"><span id="lf0610_label_2729">22</span> But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2132"><span id="lf0610_label_2730">23</span> Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2133"><span id="lf0610_label_2731">24</span> But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2134"><span id="lf0610_label_2732">25</span> And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2135"><span id="lf0610_label_2733">26</span> And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2136"><span id="lf0610_label_2734">27</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt671" id="lf0610_footnote_nt671_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2137"><span id="lf0610_label_2736">28</span> And he left all, rose up, and followed him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2138"><span id="lf0610_label_2737">29</span> And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2139"><span id="lf0610_label_2738">30</span> But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2140"><span id="lf0610_label_2739">31</span> And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2141"><span id="lf0610_label_2740">32</span> I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2142"><span id="lf0610_label_2741">33</span> &#xB6; And they said unto him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt672" id="lf0610_footnote_nt672_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewise <span class="ital">the disciples</span> of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>74<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2143"><span id="lf0610_label_2743">34</span> And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2144"><span id="lf0610_label_2744">35</span> But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2145"><span id="lf0610_label_2745">36</span> &#xB6; And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was <span class="ital">taken</span> out of the new agreeth not with the old.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2146"><span id="lf0610_label_2746">37</span> And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2147"><span id="lf0610_label_2747">38</span> But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2148"><span id="lf0610_label_2748">39</span> No man also having drunk old <span class="ital">wine</span> straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_067" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2749">6</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2149"><span id="lf0610_label_2750">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt673" id="lf0610_footnote_nt673_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing <span class="ital">them</span> in <span class="ital">their</span> hands.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2150"><span id="lf0610_label_2752">2</span> And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2151"><span id="lf0610_label_2753">3</span> And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2152"><span id="lf0610_label_2754">4</span> How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2153"><span id="lf0610_label_2755">5</span> And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2154"><span id="lf0610_label_2756">6</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt674" id="lf0610_footnote_nt674_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2155"><span id="lf0610_label_2758">7</span> And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2156"><span id="lf0610_label_2759">8</span> But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2157"><span id="lf0610_label_2760">9</span> Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy <span class="ital">it?</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2158"><span id="lf0610_label_2761">10</span> And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2159"><span id="lf0610_label_2762">11</span> And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2160"><span id="lf0610_label_2763">12</span> And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2161"><span id="lf0610_label_2764">13</span> &#xB6; And when it was day, he called <span class="ital">unto him</span> his disciples: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt675" id="lf0610_footnote_nt675_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2162"><span id="lf0610_label_2766">14</span> Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2163"><span id="lf0610_label_2767">15</span> Matthew and Thomas, James the <span class="ital">son</span> of Alph&#xE6;us, and Simon called Zelotes,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2164"><span id="lf0610_label_2768">16</span> And Judas <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt676" id="lf0610_footnote_nt676_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a><span class="ital">the brother</span> of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2165"><span id="lf0610_label_2770">17</span> &#xB6; And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Jud&#xE6;a and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2166"><span id="lf0610_label_2771">18</span> And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2167"><span id="lf0610_label_2772">19</span> And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed <span class="ital">them</span> all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2168"><span id="lf0610_label_2773">20</span> &#xB6; And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>75<span class="bracket">]</span></span> and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt677" id="lf0610_footnote_nt677_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Blessed <span class="ital">be ye</span> poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2169"><span id="lf0610_label_2775">21</span> Blessed <span class="ital">are ye</span> that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed <span class="ital">are ye</span> that weep now: for ye shall laugh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2170"><span id="lf0610_label_2776">22</span> Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you <span class="ital">from their company,</span> and shall reproach <span class="ital">you,</span> and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man&#x2019;s sake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2171"><span id="lf0610_label_2777">23</span> Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward <span class="ital">is</span> great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2172"><span id="lf0610_label_2778">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt678" id="lf0610_footnote_nt678_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2173"><span id="lf0610_label_2780">25</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt679" id="lf0610_footnote_nt679_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2174"><span id="lf0610_label_2782">26</span> Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2175"><span id="lf0610_label_2783">27</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt680" id="lf0610_footnote_nt680_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2176"><span id="lf0610_label_2785">28</span> Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2177"><span id="lf0610_label_2786">29</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt681" id="lf0610_footnote_nt681_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And unto him that smiteth thee on the <span class="ital">one</span> cheek offer also the other; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt682" id="lf0610_footnote_nt682_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not <span class="ital">to take thy</span> coat also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2178"><span id="lf0610_label_2789">30</span> Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask <span class="ital">them</span> not again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2179"><span id="lf0610_label_2790">31</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt683" id="lf0610_footnote_nt683_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2180"><span id="lf0610_label_2792">32</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt684" id="lf0610_footnote_nt684_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2181"><span id="lf0610_label_2794">33</span> And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2182"><span id="lf0610_label_2795">34</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt685" id="lf0610_footnote_nt685_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And if ye lend <span class="ital">to them</span> of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2183"><span id="lf0610_label_2797">35</span> But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and <span class="ital">to</span> the evil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2184"><span id="lf0610_label_2798">36</span> Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2185"><span id="lf0610_label_2799">37</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt686" id="lf0610_footnote_nt686_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2186"><span id="lf0610_label_2801">38</span> Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2187"><span id="lf0610_label_2802">39</span> And he spake a parable unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt687" id="lf0610_footnote_nt687_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2188"><span id="lf0610_label_2804">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt688" id="lf0610_footnote_nt688_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The disciple is not above his master: but every one <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt689" id="lf0610_footnote_nt689_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>that is perfect shall be as his master.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2189"><span id="lf0610_label_2807">41</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt690" id="lf0610_footnote_nt690_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother&#x2019;s eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2190"><span id="lf0610_label_2809">42</span> Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother&#x2019;s eye.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2191"><span id="lf0610_label_2810">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt691" id="lf0610_footnote_nt691_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2192"><span id="lf0610_label_2812">44</span> For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2193"><span id="lf0610_label_2813">45</span> A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>76<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2194"><span id="lf0610_label_2814">46</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt692" id="lf0610_footnote_nt692_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2195"><span id="lf0610_label_2816">47</span> Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2196"><span id="lf0610_label_2817">48</span> He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2197"><span id="lf0610_label_2818">49</span> But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_068" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2819">7</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2198"><span id="lf0610_label_2820">1</span> Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt693" id="lf0610_footnote_nt693_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he entered into Capernaum.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2199"><span id="lf0610_label_2822">2</span> And a certain centurion&#x2019;s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2200"><span id="lf0610_label_2823">3</span> And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2201"><span id="lf0610_label_2824">4</span> And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2202"><span id="lf0610_label_2825">5</span> For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2203"><span id="lf0610_label_2826">6</span> Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2204"><span id="lf0610_label_2827">7</span> Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2205"><span id="lf0610_label_2828">8</span> For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2206"><span id="lf0610_label_2829">9</span> When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2207"><span id="lf0610_label_2830">10</span> And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2208"><span id="lf0610_label_2831">11</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2209"><span id="lf0610_label_2832">12</span> Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2210"><span id="lf0610_label_2833">13</span> And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2211"><span id="lf0610_label_2834">14</span> And he came and touched the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt694" id="lf0610_footnote_nt694_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>bier: and they that bare <span class="ital">him</span> stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2212"><span id="lf0610_label_2836">15</span> And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2213"><span id="lf0610_label_2837">16</span> And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2214"><span id="lf0610_label_2838">17</span> And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Jud&#xE6;a, and throughout all the region round about.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2215"><span id="lf0610_label_2839">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt695" id="lf0610_footnote_nt695_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2216"><span id="lf0610_label_2841">19</span> &#xB6; And John calling <span class="ital">unto him</span> two of his disciples sent <span class="ital">them</span> to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2217"><span id="lf0610_label_2842">20</span> When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2218"><span id="lf0610_label_2843">21</span> And in that same hour he cured many of <span class="ital">their</span> infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many <span class="ital">that were</span> blind he gave sight.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>77<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2219"><span id="lf0610_label_2844">22</span> Then Jesus answering said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2220"><span id="lf0610_label_2845">23</span> And blessed is <span class="ital">he,</span> whosoever shall not be offended in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2221"><span id="lf0610_label_2846">24</span> &#xB6; And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness for to see? A reed shaken with the wind?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2222"><span id="lf0610_label_2847">25</span> But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings&#x2019; courts.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2223"><span id="lf0610_label_2848">26</span> But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2224"><span id="lf0610_label_2849">27</span> This is <span class="ital">he,</span> of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2225"><span id="lf0610_label_2850">28</span> For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2226"><span id="lf0610_label_2851">29</span> And all the people that heard <span class="ital">him,</span> and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2227"><span id="lf0610_label_2852">30</span> But the Pharisees and lawyers <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt696" id="lf0610_footnote_nt696_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>rejected the counsel of God <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt697" id="lf0610_footnote_nt697_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>against themselves, being not baptized of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2228"><span id="lf0610_label_2855">31</span> &#xB6; And the Lord said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt698" id="lf0610_footnote_nt698_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2229"><span id="lf0610_label_2857">32</span> They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2230"><span id="lf0610_label_2858">33</span> For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2231"><span id="lf0610_label_2859">34</span> The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2232"><span id="lf0610_label_2860">35</span> But wisdom is justified of all her children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2233"><span id="lf0610_label_2861">36</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt699" id="lf0610_footnote_nt699_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee&#x2019;s house, and sat down to meat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2234"><span id="lf0610_label_2863">37</span> And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that <span class="ital">Jesus</span> sat at meat in the Pharisee&#x2019;s house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2235"><span id="lf0610_label_2864">38</span> And stood at his feet behind <span class="ital">him</span> weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe <span class="ital">them</span> with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed <span class="ital">them</span> with the ointment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2236"><span id="lf0610_label_2865">39</span> Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw <span class="ital">it,</span> he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman <span class="ital">this is</span> that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2237"><span id="lf0610_label_2866">40</span> And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2238"><span id="lf0610_label_2867">41</span> There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt700" id="lf0610_footnote_nt700_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pence, and the other fifty.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2239"><span id="lf0610_label_2869">42</span> And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2240"><span id="lf0610_label_2870">43</span> Simon answered and said, I suppose that <span class="ital">he,</span> to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2241"><span id="lf0610_label_2871">44</span> And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped <span class="ital">them</span> with the hairs of her head.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2242"><span id="lf0610_label_2872">45</span> Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>78<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2243"><span id="lf0610_label_2873">46</span> My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2244"><span id="lf0610_label_2874">47</span> Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, <span class="ital">the same</span> loveth little.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2245"><span id="lf0610_label_2875">48</span> And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2246"><span id="lf0610_label_2876">49</span> And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2247"><span id="lf0610_label_2877">50</span> And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_069" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2878">8</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2248"><span id="lf0610_label_2879">1</span> And it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelve <span class="ital">were</span> with him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2249"><span id="lf0610_label_2880">2</span> And certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt701" id="lf0610_footnote_nt701_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>out of whom went seven devils,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2250"><span id="lf0610_label_2882">3</span> And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod&#x2019;s steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2251"><span id="lf0610_label_2883">4</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt702" id="lf0610_footnote_nt702_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2252"><span id="lf0610_label_2885">5</span> A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2253"><span id="lf0610_label_2886">6</span> And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2254"><span id="lf0610_label_2887">7</span> And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2255"><span id="lf0610_label_2888">8</span> And other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an hundredfold. And when he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt703" id="lf0610_footnote_nt703_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>had said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2256"><span id="lf0610_label_2890">9</span> And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2257"><span id="lf0610_label_2891">10</span> And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2258"><span id="lf0610_label_2892">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt704" id="lf0610_footnote_nt704_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2259"><span id="lf0610_label_2894">12</span> Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2260"><span id="lf0610_label_2895">13</span> They on the rock <span class="ital">are they,</span> which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2261"><span id="lf0610_label_2896">14</span> And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of <span class="ital">this</span> life, and bring no fruit to perfection.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2262"><span id="lf0610_label_2897">15</span> But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep <span class="ital">it,</span> and bring forth fruit with patience.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2263"><span id="lf0610_label_2898">16</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt705" id="lf0610_footnote_nt705_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth <span class="ital">it</span> under a bed; but setteth <span class="ital">it</span> on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2264"><span id="lf0610_label_2900">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt706" id="lf0610_footnote_nt706_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither <span class="ital">any thing</span> hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2265"><span id="lf0610_label_2902">18</span> Take heed therefore how ye hear: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt707" id="lf0610_footnote_nt707_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt708" id="lf0610_footnote_nt708_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>seemeth to have.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2266"><span id="lf0610_label_2905">19</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt709" id="lf0610_footnote_nt709_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then came to him <span class="ital">his</span> mother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2267"><span id="lf0610_label_2907">20</span> And it was told him <span class="ital">by certain</span> which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2268"><span id="lf0610_label_2908">21</span> And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>79<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2269"><span id="lf0610_label_2909">22</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt710" id="lf0610_footnote_nt710_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2270"><span id="lf0610_label_2911">23</span> But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled <span class="ital">with water,</span> and were in jeopardy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2271"><span id="lf0610_label_2912">24</span> And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2272"><span id="lf0610_label_2913">25</span> And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2273"><span id="lf0610_label_2914">26</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt711" id="lf0610_footnote_nt711_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2274"><span id="lf0610_label_2916">27</span> And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in <span class="ital">any</span> house, but in the tombs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2275"><span id="lf0610_label_2917">28</span> When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, <span class="ital">thou</span> Son of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2276"><span id="lf0610_label_2918">29</span> (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2277"><span id="lf0610_label_2919">30</span> And Jesus asked him, saying, What is thy name? And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2278"><span id="lf0610_label_2920">31</span> And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2279"><span id="lf0610_label_2921">32</span> And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2280"><span id="lf0610_label_2922">33</span> Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2281"><span id="lf0610_label_2923">34</span> When they that fed <span class="ital">them</span> saw what was done, they fled, and went and told <span class="ital">it</span> in the city and in the country.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2282"><span id="lf0610_label_2924">35</span> Then they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2283"><span id="lf0610_label_2925">36</span> They also which saw <span class="ital">it</span> told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2284"><span id="lf0610_label_2926">37</span> &#xB6; Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2285"><span id="lf0610_label_2927">38</span> Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2286"><span id="lf0610_label_2928">39</span> Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee. And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2287"><span id="lf0610_label_2929">40</span> And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people <span class="ital">gladly</span> received him: for they were all waiting for him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2288"><span id="lf0610_label_2930">41</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt712" id="lf0610_footnote_nt712_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And, behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus&#x2019; feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2289"><span id="lf0610_label_2932">42</span> For he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2290"><span id="lf0610_label_2933">43</span> &#xB6; And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2291"><span id="lf0610_label_2934">44</span> Came behind <span class="ital">him,</span> and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2292"><span id="lf0610_label_2935">45</span> And Jesus said, Who touched me? When all <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>80<span class="bracket">]</span></span> denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press <span class="ital">thee,</span> and sayest thou, Who touched me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2293"><span id="lf0610_label_2936">46</span> And Jesus said, Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2294"><span id="lf0610_label_2937">47</span> And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2295"><span id="lf0610_label_2938">48</span> And he said unto her, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2296"><span id="lf0610_label_2939">49</span> &#xB6; While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue&#x2019;s <span class="ital">house,</span> saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2297"><span id="lf0610_label_2940">50</span> But when Jesus heard <span class="ital">it,</span> he answered him, saying, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2298"><span id="lf0610_label_2941">51</span> And when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2299"><span id="lf0610_label_2942">52</span> And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said, Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2300"><span id="lf0610_label_2943">53</span> And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2301"><span id="lf0610_label_2944">54</span> And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid, arise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2302"><span id="lf0610_label_2945">55</span> And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2303"><span id="lf0610_label_2946">56</span> And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_070" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_2947">9</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2304"><span id="lf0610_label_2948">1</span> Then <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt713" id="lf0610_footnote_nt713_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2305"><span id="lf0610_label_2950">2</span> And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2306"><span id="lf0610_label_2951">3</span> And he said unto them, Take nothing for <span class="ital">your</span> journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2307"><span id="lf0610_label_2952">4</span> And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2308"><span id="lf0610_label_2953">5</span> And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2309"><span id="lf0610_label_2954">6</span> And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2310"><span id="lf0610_label_2955">7</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt714" id="lf0610_footnote_nt714_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2311"><span id="lf0610_label_2957">8</span> And of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2312"><span id="lf0610_label_2958">9</span> And Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2313"><span id="lf0610_label_2959">10</span> &#xB6; And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt715" id="lf0610_footnote_nt715_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2314"><span id="lf0610_label_2961">11</span> And the people, when they knew <span class="ital">it,</span> followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2315"><span id="lf0610_label_2962">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt716" id="lf0610_footnote_nt716_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2316"><span id="lf0610_label_2964">13</span> But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2317"><span id="lf0610_label_2965">14</span> For they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make them sit down by fifties in a company.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2318"><span id="lf0610_label_2966">15</span> And they did so, and made them all sit down.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2319"><span id="lf0610_label_2967">16</span> Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>81<span class="bracket">]</span></span> and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2320"><span id="lf0610_label_2968">17</span> And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2321"><span id="lf0610_label_2969">18</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt717" id="lf0610_footnote_nt717_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom say the people that I am?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2322"><span id="lf0610_label_2971">19</span> They answering said, John the Baptist; but some <span class="ital">say,</span> Elias; and others <span class="ital">say,</span> that one of the old prophets is risen again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2323"><span id="lf0610_label_2972">20</span> He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Peter answering said, The Christ of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2324"><span id="lf0610_label_2973">21</span> And he straitly charged them, and commanded <span class="ital">them</span> to tell no man that thing;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2325"><span id="lf0610_label_2974">22</span> Saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt718" id="lf0610_footnote_nt718_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slam, and be raised the third day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2326"><span id="lf0610_label_2976">23</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt719" id="lf0610_footnote_nt719_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he said to <span class="ital">them</span> all, If any <span class="ital">man</span> will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2327"><span id="lf0610_label_2978">24</span> For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2328"><span id="lf0610_label_2979">25</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt720" id="lf0610_footnote_nt720_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2329"><span id="lf0610_label_2981">26</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt721" id="lf0610_footnote_nt721_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, and <span class="ital">in his</span> Father&#x2019;s, and of the holy angels.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2330"><span id="lf0610_label_2983">27</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt722" id="lf0610_footnote_nt722_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2331"><span id="lf0610_label_2985">28</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt723" id="lf0610_footnote_nt723_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass about an eight days after these <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt724" id="lf0610_footnote_nt724_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2332"><span id="lf0610_label_2988">29</span> And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment <span class="ital">was</span> white <span class="ital">and</span> glistering.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2333"><span id="lf0610_label_2989">30</span> And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2334"><span id="lf0610_label_2990">31</span> Who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2335"><span id="lf0610_label_2991">32</span> But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2336"><span id="lf0610_label_2992">33</span> And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2337"><span id="lf0610_label_2993">34</span> While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2338"><span id="lf0610_label_2994">35</span> And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2339"><span id="lf0610_label_2995">36</span> And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they kept <span class="ital">it</span> close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2340"><span id="lf0610_label_2996">37</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt725" id="lf0610_footnote_nt725_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2341"><span id="lf0610_label_2998">38</span> And, behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2342"><span id="lf0610_label_2999">39</span> And, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2343"><span id="lf0610_label_3000">40</span> And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2344"><span id="lf0610_label_3001">41</span> And Jesus answering said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? Bring thy son hither.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2345"><span id="lf0610_label_3002">42</span> And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>82<span class="bracket">]</span></span> him down, and tare <span class="ital">him.</span> And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2346"><span id="lf0610_label_3003">43</span> &#xB6; And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2347"><span id="lf0610_label_3004">44</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt726" id="lf0610_footnote_nt726_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2348"><span id="lf0610_label_3006">45</span> But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2349"><span id="lf0610_label_3007">46</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt727" id="lf0610_footnote_nt727_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2350"><span id="lf0610_label_3009">47</span> And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2351"><span id="lf0610_label_3010">48</span> And said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2352"><span id="lf0610_label_3011">49</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt728" id="lf0610_footnote_nt728_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2353"><span id="lf0610_label_3013">50</span> And Jesus said unto him, Forbid <span class="ital">him</span> not: for he that is not against us is for us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2354"><span id="lf0610_label_3014">51</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2355"><span id="lf0610_label_3015">52</span> And sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2356"><span id="lf0610_label_3016">53</span> And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2357"><span id="lf0610_label_3017">54</span> And when his disciples James and John saw <span class="ital">this,</span> they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt729" id="lf0610_footnote_nt729_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Elias did?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2358"><span id="lf0610_label_3019">55</span> But he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2359"><span id="lf0610_label_3020">56</span> For the Son of man is not come to destroy men&#x2019;s lives, but to save <span class="ital">them.</span> And they went to another village.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2360"><span id="lf0610_label_3021">57</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt730" id="lf0610_footnote_nt730_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain <span class="ital">man</span> said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2361"><span id="lf0610_label_3023">58</span> And Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air <span class="ital">have</span> nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay <span class="ital">his</span> head.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2362"><span id="lf0610_label_3024">59</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt731" id="lf0610_footnote_nt731_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he said unto another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2363"><span id="lf0610_label_3026">60</span> Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2364"><span id="lf0610_label_3027">61</span> And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2365"><span id="lf0610_label_3028">62</span> And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_071" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_3029">10</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2366"><span id="lf0610_label_3030">1</span> After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt732" id="lf0610_footnote_nt732_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2367"><span id="lf0610_label_3032">2</span> Therefore said he unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt733" id="lf0610_footnote_nt733_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The harvest truly <span class="ital">is</span> great, but the labourers <span class="ital">are</span> few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2368"><span id="lf0610_label_3034">3</span> Go your ways: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt734" id="lf0610_footnote_nt734_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2369"><span id="lf0610_label_3036">4</span> Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2370"><span id="lf0610_label_3037">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt735" id="lf0610_footnote_nt735_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace <span class="ital">be</span> to this house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2371"><span id="lf0610_label_3039">6</span> And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2372"><span id="lf0610_label_3040">7</span> And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>83<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2373"><span id="lf0610_label_3041">8</span> And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2374"><span id="lf0610_label_3042">9</span> And heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2375"><span id="lf0610_label_3043">10</span> But into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2376"><span id="lf0610_label_3044">11</span> Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2377"><span id="lf0610_label_3045">12</span> But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2378"><span id="lf0610_label_3046">13</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt736" id="lf0610_footnote_nt736_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2379"><span id="lf0610_label_3048">14</span> But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2380"><span id="lf0610_label_3049">15</span> And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2381"><span id="lf0610_label_3050">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt737" id="lf0610_footnote_nt737_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2382"><span id="lf0610_label_3052">17</span> &#xB6; And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2383"><span id="lf0610_label_3053">18</span> And he said unto them, I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2384"><span id="lf0610_label_3054">19</span> Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2385"><span id="lf0610_label_3055">20</span> Notwithstanding in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2386"><span id="lf0610_label_3056">21</span> &#xB6; In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes: even so, Father; for so it seemed good in thy sight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2387"><span id="lf0610_label_3057">22</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt738" id="lf0610_footnote_nt738_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and <span class="ital">he</span> to whom the Son will reveal <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2388"><span id="lf0610_label_3059">23</span> &#xB6; And he turned him unto <span class="ital">his</span> disciples, and said privately, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt739" id="lf0610_footnote_nt739_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Blessed <span class="ital">are</span> the eyes which see the things that ye see:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2389"><span id="lf0610_label_3061">24</span> For I tell you, that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen <span class="ital">them;</span> and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2390"><span id="lf0610_label_3062">25</span> &#xB6; And, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt740" id="lf0610_footnote_nt740_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2391"><span id="lf0610_label_3064">26</span> He said unto him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2392"><span id="lf0610_label_3065">27</span> And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2393"><span id="lf0610_label_3066">28</span> And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2394"><span id="lf0610_label_3067">29</span> But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2395"><span id="lf0610_label_3068">30</span> And Jesus answering said, A certain <span class="ital">man</span> went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded <span class="ital">him,</span> and departed, leaving <span class="ital">him</span> half dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2396"><span id="lf0610_label_3069">31</span> And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2397"><span id="lf0610_label_3070">32</span> And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and looked <span class="ital">on him,</span> and passed by on the other side.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2398"><span id="lf0610_label_3071">33</span> But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion <span class="ital">on him,</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2399"><span id="lf0610_label_3072">34</span> And went to <span class="ital">him,</span> and bound up his wounds, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>84<span class="bracket">]</span></span> pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2400"><span id="lf0610_label_3073">35</span> And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt741" id="lf0610_footnote_nt741_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>pence, and gave <span class="ital">them</span> to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2401"><span id="lf0610_label_3075">36</span> Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2402"><span id="lf0610_label_3076">37</span> And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2403"><span id="lf0610_label_3077">38</span> &#xB6; Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2404"><span id="lf0610_label_3078">39</span> And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus&#x2019; feet, and heard his word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2405"><span id="lf0610_label_3079">40</span> But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2406"><span id="lf0610_label_3080">41</span> And Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha. Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2407"><span id="lf0610_label_3081">42</span> But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_072" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_3082">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2408"><span id="lf0610_label_3083">1</span> And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2409"><span id="lf0610_label_3084">2</span> And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt742" id="lf0610_footnote_nt742_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2410"><span id="lf0610_label_3086">3</span> Give us <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt743" id="lf0610_footnote_nt743_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>day by day our daily bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2411"><span id="lf0610_label_3088">4</span> And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2412"><span id="lf0610_label_3089">5</span> And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2413"><span id="lf0610_label_3090">6</span> For a friend of mine <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt744" id="lf0610_footnote_nt744_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2414"><span id="lf0610_label_3092">7</span> And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2415"><span id="lf0610_label_3093">8</span> I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2416"><span id="lf0610_label_3094">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt745" id="lf0610_footnote_nt745_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2417"><span id="lf0610_label_3096">10</span> For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2418"><span id="lf0610_label_3097">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt746" id="lf0610_footnote_nt746_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if <span class="ital">he ask</span> a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2419"><span id="lf0610_label_3099">12</span> Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2420"><span id="lf0610_label_3100">13</span> If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall <span class="ital">your</span> heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2421"><span id="lf0610_label_3101">14</span> &#xB6; And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2422"><span id="lf0610_label_3102">15</span> But some of them said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt747" id="lf0610_footnote_nt747_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2423"><span id="lf0610_label_3104">16</span> And others, tempting <span class="ital">him,</span> sought of him a sign from heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2424"><span id="lf0610_label_3105">17</span> But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house <span class="ital">divided</span> against a house falleth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2425"><span id="lf0610_label_3106">18</span> If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>85<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2426"><span id="lf0610_label_3107">19</span> And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast <span class="ital">them</span> out? therefore shall they be your judges.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2427"><span id="lf0610_label_3108">20</span> But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2428"><span id="lf0610_label_3109">21</span> When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2429"><span id="lf0610_label_3110">22</span> But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2430"><span id="lf0610_label_3111">23</span> He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2431"><span id="lf0610_label_3112">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt748" id="lf0610_footnote_nt748_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2432"><span id="lf0610_label_3114">25</span> And when he cometh, he findeth <span class="ital">it</span> swept and garnished.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2433"><span id="lf0610_label_3115">26</span> Then goeth he, and taketh <span class="ital">to him</span> seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last <span class="ital">state</span> of that man is worse than the first.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_2434"><span id="lf0610_label_3116">27</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed <span class="ital">is</span> the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.</p>
