<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3130"><span id="lf0610_label_3998">8</span> The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>110<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3131"><span id="lf0610_label_3999">9</span> Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3132"><span id="lf0610_label_4000">10</span> Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3133"><span id="lf0610_label_4001">11</span> Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3134"><span id="lf0610_label_4002">12</span> If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you <span class="ital">of</span> heavenly things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3135"><span id="lf0610_label_4003">13</span> And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, <span class="ital">even</span> the Son of man which is in heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3136"><span id="lf0610_label_4004">14</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt918" id="lf0610_footnote_nt918_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3137"><span id="lf0610_label_4006">15</span> That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3138"><span id="lf0610_label_4007">16</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt919" id="lf0610_footnote_nt919_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3139"><span id="lf0610_label_4009">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt920" id="lf0610_footnote_nt920_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3140"><span id="lf0610_label_4011">18</span> &#xB6; He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3141"><span id="lf0610_label_4012">19</span> And this is the condemnation, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt921" id="lf0610_footnote_nt921_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3142"><span id="lf0610_label_4014">20</span> For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt922" id="lf0610_footnote_nt922_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>reproved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3143"><span id="lf0610_label_4016">21</span> But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3144"><span id="lf0610_label_4017">22</span> &#xB6; After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Jud&#xE6;a; and there he tarried with them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt923" id="lf0610_footnote_nt923_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and baptized.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3145"><span id="lf0610_label_4019">23</span> &#xB6; And John also was baptizing in &#xC6;non near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3146"><span id="lf0610_label_4020">24</span> For John was not yet cast into prison.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3147"><span id="lf0610_label_4021">25</span> &#xB6; Then there arose a question between <span class="ital">some</span> of John&#x2019;s disciples and the Jews about purifying.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3148"><span id="lf0610_label_4022">26</span> And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt924" id="lf0610_footnote_nt924_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all <span class="ital">men</span> come to him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3149"><span id="lf0610_label_4024">27</span> John answered and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt925" id="lf0610_footnote_nt925_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A man can <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt926" id="lf0610_footnote_nt926_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3150"><span id="lf0610_label_4027">28</span> Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt927" id="lf0610_footnote_nt927_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3151"><span id="lf0610_label_4029">29</span> He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom&#x2019;s voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3152"><span id="lf0610_label_4030">30</span> He must increase, but I <span class="ital">must</span> decrease.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3153"><span id="lf0610_label_4031">31</span> He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3154"><span id="lf0610_label_4032">32</span> And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3155"><span id="lf0610_label_4033">33</span> He that hath received his testimony <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt928" id="lf0610_footnote_nt928_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>hath set to his seal that God is true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3156"><span id="lf0610_label_4035">34</span> For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure <span class="ital">unto him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3157"><span id="lf0610_label_4036">35</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt929" id="lf0610_footnote_nt929_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3158"><span id="lf0610_label_4038">36</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt930" id="lf0610_footnote_nt930_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_090" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4040">4</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3159"><span id="lf0610_label_4041">1</span> When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3160"><span id="lf0610_label_4042">2</span> (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>111<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3161"><span id="lf0610_label_4043">3</span> He left Jud&#xE6;a, and departed again into Galilee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3162"><span id="lf0610_label_4044">4</span> And he must needs go through Samaria.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3163"><span id="lf0610_label_4045">5</span> Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt931" id="lf0610_footnote_nt931_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3164"><span id="lf0610_label_4047">6</span> Now Jacob&#x2019;s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with <span class="ital">his</span> journey, sat thus on the well: <span class="ital">and</span> it was about the sixth hour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3165"><span id="lf0610_label_4048">7</span> There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3166"><span id="lf0610_label_4049">8</span> (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3167"><span id="lf0610_label_4050">9</span> Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3168"><span id="lf0610_label_4051">10</span> Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3169"><span id="lf0610_label_4052">11</span> The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3170"><span id="lf0610_label_4053">12</span> Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3171"><span id="lf0610_label_4054">13</span> Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3172"><span id="lf0610_label_4055">14</span> But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3173"><span id="lf0610_label_4056">15</span> The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3174"><span id="lf0610_label_4057">16</span> Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3175"><span id="lf0610_label_4058">17</span> The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3176"><span id="lf0610_label_4059">18</span> For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3177"><span id="lf0610_label_4060">19</span> The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3178"><span id="lf0610_label_4061">20</span> Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt932" id="lf0610_footnote_nt932_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3179"><span id="lf0610_label_4063">21</span> Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3180"><span id="lf0610_label_4064">22</span> Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3181"><span id="lf0610_label_4065">23</span> But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3182"><span id="lf0610_label_4066">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt933" id="lf0610_footnote_nt933_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>God <span class="ital">is</span> a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship <span class="ital">him</span> in spirit and in truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3183"><span id="lf0610_label_4068">25</span> The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3184"><span id="lf0610_label_4069">26</span> Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am <span class="ital">he.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3185"><span id="lf0610_label_4070">27</span> &#xB6; And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3186"><span id="lf0610_label_4071">28</span> The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3187"><span id="lf0610_label_4072">29</span> Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3188"><span id="lf0610_label_4073">30</span> Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3189"><span id="lf0610_label_4074">31</span> &#xB6; In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3190"><span id="lf0610_label_4075">32</span> But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3191"><span id="lf0610_label_4076">33</span> Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him <span class="ital">ought</span> to eat?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>112<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3192"><span id="lf0610_label_4077">34</span> Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3193"><span id="lf0610_label_4078">35</span> Say not ye, There are yet four months, and <span class="ital">then</span> cometh harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt934" id="lf0610_footnote_nt934_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for they are white already to harvest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3194"><span id="lf0610_label_4080">36</span> And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3195"><span id="lf0610_label_4081">37</span> And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3196"><span id="lf0610_label_4082">38</span> I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3197"><span id="lf0610_label_4083">39</span> &#xB6; And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3198"><span id="lf0610_label_4084">40</span> So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3199"><span id="lf0610_label_4085">41</span> And many more believed because of his own word;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3200"><span id="lf0610_label_4086">42</span> And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard <span class="ital">him</span> ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3201"><span id="lf0610_label_4087">43</span> &#xB6; Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3202"><span id="lf0610_label_4088">44</span> For <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt935" id="lf0610_footnote_nt935_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3203"><span id="lf0610_label_4090">45</span> Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galil&#xE6;ans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3204"><span id="lf0610_label_4091">46</span> So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt936" id="lf0610_footnote_nt936_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>where he made the water wine. And there was a certain <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt937" id="lf0610_footnote_nt937_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3205"><span id="lf0610_label_4094">47</span> When he heard that Jesus was come out of Jud&#xE6;a into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3206"><span id="lf0610_label_4095">48</span> Then said Jesus unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3207"><span id="lf0610_label_4096">49</span> The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3208"><span id="lf0610_label_4097">50</span> Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3209"><span id="lf0610_label_4098">51</span> And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told <span class="ital">him,</span> saying, Thy son liveth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3210"><span id="lf0610_label_4099">52</span> Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3211"><span id="lf0610_label_4100">53</span> So the father knew that <span class="ital">it was</span> at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3212"><span id="lf0610_label_4101">54</span> This <span class="ital">is</span> again the second miracle <span class="ital">that</span> Jesus did, when he was come out of Jud&#xE6;a into Galilee.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_091" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4102">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3213"><span id="lf0610_label_4103">1</span> After <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt938" id="lf0610_footnote_nt938_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3214"><span id="lf0610_label_4105">2</span> Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt939" id="lf0610_footnote_nt939_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a><span class="ital">market</span> a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3215"><span id="lf0610_label_4107">3</span> In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3216"><span id="lf0610_label_4108">4</span> For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3217"><span id="lf0610_label_4109">5</span> And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3218"><span id="lf0610_label_4110">6</span> When Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time <span class="ital">in that case,</span> he saith unto him, Wilt thou be made whole?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3219"><span id="lf0610_label_4111">7</span> The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>113<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3220"><span id="lf0610_label_4112">8</span> Jesus saith unto him, Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3221"><span id="lf0610_label_4113">9</span> And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3222"><span id="lf0610_label_4114">10</span> &#xB6; The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt940" id="lf0610_footnote_nt940_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>it is not lawful for thee to carry <span class="ital">thy</span> bed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3223"><span id="lf0610_label_4116">11</span> He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3224"><span id="lf0610_label_4117">12</span> Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3225"><span id="lf0610_label_4118">13</span> And he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt941" id="lf0610_footnote_nt941_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>a multitude being in <span class="ital">that</span> place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3226"><span id="lf0610_label_4120">14</span> Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3227"><span id="lf0610_label_4121">15</span> The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3228"><span id="lf0610_label_4122">16</span> And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3229"><span id="lf0610_label_4123">17</span> &#xB6; But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3230"><span id="lf0610_label_4124">18</span> Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt942" id="lf0610_footnote_nt942_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3231"><span id="lf0610_label_4126">19</span> Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3232"><span id="lf0610_label_4127">20</span> For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3233"><span id="lf0610_label_4128">21</span> For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth <span class="ital">them;</span> even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3234"><span id="lf0610_label_4129">22</span> For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3235"><span id="lf0610_label_4130">23</span> That all <span class="ital">men</span> should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3236"><span id="lf0610_label_4131">24</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3237"><span id="lf0610_label_4132">25</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3238"><span id="lf0610_label_4133">26</span> For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3239"><span id="lf0610_label_4134">27</span> And hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3240"><span id="lf0610_label_4135">28</span> Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3241"><span id="lf0610_label_4136">29</span> And shall come forth; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt943" id="lf0610_footnote_nt943_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3242"><span id="lf0610_label_4138">30</span> I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3243"><span id="lf0610_label_4139">31</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt944" id="lf0610_footnote_nt944_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3244"><span id="lf0610_label_4141">32</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt945" id="lf0610_footnote_nt945_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3245"><span id="lf0610_label_4143">33</span> Ye sent unto John, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt946" id="lf0610_footnote_nt946_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and he bare witness unto the truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3246"><span id="lf0610_label_4145">34</span> But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3247"><span id="lf0610_label_4146">35</span> He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3248"><span id="lf0610_label_4147">36</span> &#xB6; But I have greater witness than <span class="ital">that</span> of <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>114<span class="bracket">]</span></span> John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3249"><span id="lf0610_label_4148">37</span> And the Father himself, which hath sent me, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt947" id="lf0610_footnote_nt947_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt948" id="lf0610_footnote_nt948_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>nor seen his shape.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3250"><span id="lf0610_label_4151">38</span> And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3251"><span id="lf0610_label_4152">39</span> &#xB6; Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3252"><span id="lf0610_label_4153">40</span> And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3253"><span id="lf0610_label_4154">41</span> I receive not honour from men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3254"><span id="lf0610_label_4155">42</span> But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3255"><span id="lf0610_label_4156">43</span> I am come in my Father&#x2019;s name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3256"><span id="lf0610_label_4157">44</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt949" id="lf0610_footnote_nt949_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that <span class="ital">cometh</span> from God only?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3257"><span id="lf0610_label_4159">45</span> Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is <span class="ital">one</span> that accuseth you, <span class="ital">even</span> Moses, in whom ye trust.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3258"><span id="lf0610_label_4160">46</span> For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt950" id="lf0610_footnote_nt950_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for he wrote of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3259"><span id="lf0610_label_4162">47</span> But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_092" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4163">6</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3260"><span id="lf0610_label_4164">1</span> After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is <span class="ital">the sea</span> of Tiberias.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3261"><span id="lf0610_label_4165">2</span> And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3262"><span id="lf0610_label_4166">3</span> And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3263"><span id="lf0610_label_4167">4</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt951" id="lf0610_footnote_nt951_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3264"><span id="lf0610_label_4169">5</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt952" id="lf0610_footnote_nt952_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When Jesus then lifted up <span class="ital">his</span> eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3265"><span id="lf0610_label_4171">6</span> And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3266"><span id="lf0610_label_4172">7</span> Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3267"><span id="lf0610_label_4173">8</span> One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter&#x2019;s brother, saith unto him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3268"><span id="lf0610_label_4174">9</span> There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3269"><span id="lf0610_label_4175">10</span> And Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3270"><span id="lf0610_label_4176">11</span> And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3271"><span id="lf0610_label_4177">12</span> When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3272"><span id="lf0610_label_4178">13</span> Therefore they gathered <span class="ital">them</span> together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3273"><span id="lf0610_label_4179">14</span> Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3274"><span id="lf0610_label_4180">15</span> &#xB6; When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3275"><span id="lf0610_label_4181">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt953" id="lf0610_footnote_nt953_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when even was <span class="ital">now</span> come, his disciples went down unto the sea,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3276"><span id="lf0610_label_4183">17</span> And entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3277"><span id="lf0610_label_4184">18</span> And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3278"><span id="lf0610_label_4185">19</span> So when they had rowed about five and <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>115<span class="bracket">]</span></span> twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3279"><span id="lf0610_label_4186">20</span> But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3280"><span id="lf0610_label_4187">21</span> Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3281"><span id="lf0610_label_4188">22</span> &#xB6; The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but <span class="ital">that</span> his disciples were gone away alone;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3282"><span id="lf0610_label_4189">23</span> (Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3283"><span id="lf0610_label_4190">24</span> When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3284"><span id="lf0610_label_4191">25</span> And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3285"><span id="lf0610_label_4192">26</span> Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3286"><span id="lf0610_label_4193">27</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt954" id="lf0610_footnote_nt954_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt955" id="lf0610_footnote_nt955_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for him hath God the Father sealed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3287"><span id="lf0610_label_4196">28</span> Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3288"><span id="lf0610_label_4197">29</span> Jesus answered and said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt956" id="lf0610_footnote_nt956_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3289"><span id="lf0610_label_4199">30</span> They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3290"><span id="lf0610_label_4200">31</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt957" id="lf0610_footnote_nt957_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt958" id="lf0610_footnote_nt958_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He gave them bread from heaven to eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3291"><span id="lf0610_label_4203">32</span> Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3292"><span id="lf0610_label_4204">33</span> For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3293"><span id="lf0610_label_4205">34</span> Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3294"><span id="lf0610_label_4206">35</span> And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3295"><span id="lf0610_label_4207">36</span> But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3296"><span id="lf0610_label_4208">37</span> All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3297"><span id="lf0610_label_4209">38</span> For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3298"><span id="lf0610_label_4210">39</span> And this is the Father&#x2019;s will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3299"><span id="lf0610_label_4211">40</span> And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3300"><span id="lf0610_label_4212">41</span> The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3301"><span id="lf0610_label_4213">42</span> And they said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt959" id="lf0610_footnote_nt959_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3302"><span id="lf0610_label_4215">43</span> Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3303"><span id="lf0610_label_4216">44</span> No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3304"><span id="lf0610_label_4217">45</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt960" id="lf0610_footnote_nt960_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God. Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>116<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3305"><span id="lf0610_label_4219">46</span> Not that any man hath seen the Father, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt961" id="lf0610_footnote_nt961_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3306"><span id="lf0610_label_4221">47</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3307"><span id="lf0610_label_4222">48</span> I am that bread of life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3308"><span id="lf0610_label_4223">49</span> Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3309"><span id="lf0610_label_4224">50</span> This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3310"><span id="lf0610_label_4225">51</span> I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3311"><span id="lf0610_label_4226">52</span> The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us <span class="ital">his</span> flesh to eat?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3312"><span id="lf0610_label_4227">53</span> Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3313"><span id="lf0610_label_4228">54</span> Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3314"><span id="lf0610_label_4229">55</span> For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3315"><span id="lf0610_label_4230">56</span> He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3316"><span id="lf0610_label_4231">57</span> As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3317"><span id="lf0610_label_4232">58</span> This is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3318"><span id="lf0610_label_4233">59</span> These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3319"><span id="lf0610_label_4234">60</span> Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard <span class="ital">this,</span> said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3320"><span id="lf0610_label_4235">61</span> When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth this offend you?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3321"><span id="lf0610_label_4236">62</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt962" id="lf0610_footnote_nt962_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a><span class="ital">What</span> and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3322"><span id="lf0610_label_4238">63</span> It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you, <span class="ital">they</span> are spirit, and <span class="ital">they</span> are life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3323"><span id="lf0610_label_4239">64</span> But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3324"><span id="lf0610_label_4240">65</span> And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3325"><span id="lf0610_label_4241">66</span> &#xB6; From that <span class="ital">time</span> many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3326"><span id="lf0610_label_4242">67</span> Then said Jesus unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3327"><span id="lf0610_label_4243">68</span> Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3328"><span id="lf0610_label_4244">69</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt963" id="lf0610_footnote_nt963_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3329"><span id="lf0610_label_4246">70</span> Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3330"><span id="lf0610_label_4247">71</span> He spake of Judas Iscariot <span class="ital">the son</span> of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_093" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4248">7</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3331"><span id="lf0610_label_4249">1</span> After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3332"><span id="lf0610_label_4250">2</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt964" id="lf0610_footnote_nt964_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now the Jews&#x2019; feast of tabernacles was at hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3333"><span id="lf0610_label_4252">3</span> His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Jud&#xE6;a, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3334"><span id="lf0610_label_4253">4</span> For <span class="ital">there is</span> no man <span class="ital">that</span> doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3335"><span id="lf0610_label_4254">5</span> For neither did his brethren believe in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3336"><span id="lf0610_label_4255">6</span> Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>117<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3337"><span id="lf0610_label_4256">7</span> The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3338"><span id="lf0610_label_4257">8</span> Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt965" id="lf0610_footnote_nt965_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>for my time is not yet full come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3339"><span id="lf0610_label_4259">9</span> When he had said these words unto them, he abode <span class="ital">still</span> in Galilee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3340"><span id="lf0610_label_4260">10</span> &#xB6; But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3341"><span id="lf0610_label_4261">11</span> Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3342"><span id="lf0610_label_4262">12</span> And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3343"><span id="lf0610_label_4263">13</span> Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3344"><span id="lf0610_label_4264">14</span> &#xB6; Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3345"><span id="lf0610_label_4265">15</span> And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt966" id="lf0610_footnote_nt966_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>letters, having never learned?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3346"><span id="lf0610_label_4267">16</span> Jesus answered them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt967" id="lf0610_footnote_nt967_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3347"><span id="lf0610_label_4269">17</span> If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or <span class="ital">whether</span> I speak of myself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3348"><span id="lf0610_label_4270">18</span> He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3349"><span id="lf0610_label_4271">19</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt968" id="lf0610_footnote_nt968_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Did not Moses give you the law, and <span class="ital">yet</span> none of you keepeth the law? <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt969" id="lf0610_footnote_nt969_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Why go ye about to kill me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3350"><span id="lf0610_label_4274">20</span> The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3351"><span id="lf0610_label_4275">21</span> Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3352"><span id="lf0610_label_4276">22</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt970" id="lf0610_footnote_nt970_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt971" id="lf0610_footnote_nt971_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3353"><span id="lf0610_label_4279">23</span> If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt972" id="lf0610_footnote_nt972_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>that the law of Moses should not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3354"><span id="lf0610_label_4281">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt973" id="lf0610_footnote_nt973_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3355"><span id="lf0610_label_4283">25</span> Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3356"><span id="lf0610_label_4284">26</span> But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3357"><span id="lf0610_label_4285">27</span> Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3358"><span id="lf0610_label_4286">28</span> Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3359"><span id="lf0610_label_4287">29</span> But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3360"><span id="lf0610_label_4288">30</span> Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3361"><span id="lf0610_label_4289">31</span> And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this <span class="ital">man</span> hath done?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3362"><span id="lf0610_label_4290">32</span> &#xB6; The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3363"><span id="lf0610_label_4291">33</span> Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and <span class="ital">then</span> I go unto him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3364"><span id="lf0610_label_4292">34</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt974" id="lf0610_footnote_nt974_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Ye shall seek me, and shall not find <span class="ital">me:</span> and where I am, <span class="ital">thither</span> ye cannot come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3365"><span id="lf0610_label_4294">35</span> Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt975" id="lf0610_footnote_nt975_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3366"><span id="lf0610_label_4296">36</span> What <span class="ital">manner of</span> saying is this that he said, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>118<span class="bracket">]</span></span> Ye shall seek me, and shall not find <span class="ital">me:</span> and where I am, <span class="ital">thither</span> ye cannot come?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3367"><span id="lf0610_label_4297">37</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt976" id="lf0610_footnote_nt976_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>In the last day, that great <span class="ital">day</span> of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3368"><span id="lf0610_label_4299">38</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt977" id="lf0610_footnote_nt977_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3369"><span id="lf0610_label_4301">39</span> (<a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt978" id="lf0610_footnote_nt978_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet <span class="ital">given;</span> because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3370"><span id="lf0610_label_4303">40</span> &#xB6; Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3371"><span id="lf0610_label_4304">41</span> Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3372"><span id="lf0610_label_4305">42</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt979" id="lf0610_footnote_nt979_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3373"><span id="lf0610_label_4307">43</span> So there was a division among the people because of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3374"><span id="lf0610_label_4308">44</span> And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3375"><span id="lf0610_label_4309">45</span> &#xB6; Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3376"><span id="lf0610_label_4310">46</span> The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3377"><span id="lf0610_label_4311">47</span> Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3378"><span id="lf0610_label_4312">48</span> Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3379"><span id="lf0610_label_4313">49</span> But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3380"><span id="lf0610_label_4314">50</span> Nicodemus saith unto them, (<a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt980" id="lf0610_footnote_nt980_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3381"><span id="lf0610_label_4316">51</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt981" id="lf0610_footnote_nt981_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Doth our law judge <span class="ital">any</span> man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3382"><span id="lf0610_label_4318">52</span> They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3383"><span id="lf0610_label_4319">53</span> And every man went unto his own house.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_094" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4320">8</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3384"><span id="lf0610_label_4321">1</span> Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3385"><span id="lf0610_label_4322">2</span> And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3386"><span id="lf0610_label_4323">3</span> And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3387"><span id="lf0610_label_4324">4</span> They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3388"><span id="lf0610_label_4325">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt982" id="lf0610_footnote_nt982_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3389"><span id="lf0610_label_4327">6</span> This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with <span class="ital">his</span> finger wrote on the ground, <span class="ital">as though he heard them not.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3390"><span id="lf0610_label_4328">7</span> So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt983" id="lf0610_footnote_nt983_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3391"><span id="lf0610_label_4330">8</span> And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3392"><span id="lf0610_label_4331">9</span> And they which heard <span class="ital">it,</span> being convicted by <span class="ital">their own</span> conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, <span class="ital">even</span> unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3393"><span id="lf0610_label_4332">10</span> When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3394"><span id="lf0610_label_4333">11</span> She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3395"><span id="lf0610_label_4334">12</span> &#xB6; Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt984" id="lf0610_footnote_nt984_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>119<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3396"><span id="lf0610_label_4336">13</span> The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3397"><span id="lf0610_label_4337">14</span> Jesus answered and said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt985" id="lf0610_footnote_nt985_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Though I bear record of myself, <span class="ital">yet</span> my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3398"><span id="lf0610_label_4339">15</span> Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3399"><span id="lf0610_label_4340">16</span> And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3400"><span id="lf0610_label_4341">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt986" id="lf0610_footnote_nt986_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3401"><span id="lf0610_label_4343">18</span> I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3402"><span id="lf0610_label_4344">19</span> Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3403"><span id="lf0610_label_4345">20</span> These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3404"><span id="lf0610_label_4346">21</span> Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3405"><span id="lf0610_label_4347">22</span> Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3406"><span id="lf0610_label_4348">23</span> And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3407"><span id="lf0610_label_4349">24</span> I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am <span class="ital">he,</span> ye shall die in your sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3408"><span id="lf0610_label_4350">25</span> Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even <span class="ital">the same</span> that I said unto you from the beginning.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3409"><span id="lf0610_label_4351">26</span> I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3410"><span id="lf0610_label_4352">27</span> They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3411"><span id="lf0610_label_4353">28</span> Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am <span class="ital">he,</span> and <span class="ital">that</span> I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3412"><span id="lf0610_label_4354">29</span> And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3413"><span id="lf0610_label_4355">30</span> As he spake <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt987" id="lf0610_footnote_nt987_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>these words, many believed on him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3414"><span id="lf0610_label_4357">31</span> Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, <span class="ital">then</span> are ye my disciples indeed;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3415"><span id="lf0610_label_4358">32</span> And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3416"><span id="lf0610_label_4359">33</span> &#xB6; They answered him, We be Abraham&#x2019;s seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3417"><span id="lf0610_label_4360">34</span> Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt988" id="lf0610_footnote_nt988_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3418"><span id="lf0610_label_4362">35</span> And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: <span class="ital">but</span> the Son abideth ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3419"><span id="lf0610_label_4363">36</span> If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3420"><span id="lf0610_label_4364">37</span> I know that ye are Abraham&#x2019;s seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3421"><span id="lf0610_label_4365">38</span> I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3422"><span id="lf0610_label_4366">39</span> They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham&#x2019;s children, ye would do the works of Abraham.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3423"><span id="lf0610_label_4367">40</span> But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3424"><span id="lf0610_label_4368">41</span> Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, <span class="ital">even</span> God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3425"><span id="lf0610_label_4369">42</span> Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>120<span class="bracket">]</span></span> ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3426"><span id="lf0610_label_4370">43</span> Why do ye not understand my speech? <span class="ital">even</span> because ye cannot hear my word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3427"><span id="lf0610_label_4371">44</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt989" id="lf0610_footnote_nt989_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Ye are of <span class="ital">your</span> father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3428"><span id="lf0610_label_4373">45</span> And because I tell <span class="ital">you</span> the truth, ye believe me not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3429"><span id="lf0610_label_4374">46</span> Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3430"><span id="lf0610_label_4375">47</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt990" id="lf0610_footnote_nt990_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that is of God heareth God&#x2019;s words: ye therefore hear <span class="ital">them</span> not, because ye are not of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3431"><span id="lf0610_label_4377">48</span> Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3432"><span id="lf0610_label_4378">49</span> Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3433"><span id="lf0610_label_4379">50</span> And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3434"><span id="lf0610_label_4380">51</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3435"><span id="lf0610_label_4381">52</span> Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3436"><span id="lf0610_label_4382">53</span> Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3437"><span id="lf0610_label_4383">54</span> Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3438"><span id="lf0610_label_4384">55</span> Yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3439"><span id="lf0610_label_4385">56</span> Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he saw <span class="ital">it,</span> and was glad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3440"><span id="lf0610_label_4386">57</span> Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3441"><span id="lf0610_label_4387">58</span> Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3442"><span id="lf0610_label_4388">59</span> Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_095" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4389">9</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3443"><span id="lf0610_label_4390">1</span> And as <span class="ital">Jesus</span> passed by, he saw a man which was blind from <span class="ital">his</span> birth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3444"><span id="lf0610_label_4391">2</span> And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3445"><span id="lf0610_label_4392">3</span> Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3446"><span id="lf0610_label_4393">4</span> I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3447"><span id="lf0610_label_4394">5</span> As long as I am in the world, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt991" id="lf0610_footnote_nt991_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am the light of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3448"><span id="lf0610_label_4396">6</span> When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt992" id="lf0610_footnote_nt992_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3449"><span id="lf0610_label_4398">7</span> And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3450"><span id="lf0610_label_4399">8</span> &#xB6; The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3451"><span id="lf0610_label_4400">9</span> Some said, This is he: others <span class="ital">said,</span> He is like him: <span class="ital">but</span> he said, I am <span class="ital">he.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3452"><span id="lf0610_label_4401">10</span> Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3453"><span id="lf0610_label_4402">11</span> He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>121<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3454"><span id="lf0610_label_4403">12</span> Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3455"><span id="lf0610_label_4404">13</span> &#xB6; They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3456"><span id="lf0610_label_4405">14</span> And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3457"><span id="lf0610_label_4406">15</span> Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3458"><span id="lf0610_label_4407">16</span> Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3459"><span id="lf0610_label_4408">17</span> They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3460"><span id="lf0610_label_4409">18</span> But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3461"><span id="lf0610_label_4410">19</span> And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3462"><span id="lf0610_label_4411">20</span> His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3463"><span id="lf0610_label_4412">21</span> But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3464"><span id="lf0610_label_4413">22</span> These <span class="ital">words</span> spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3465"><span id="lf0610_label_4414">23</span> Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3466"><span id="lf0610_label_4415">24</span> Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3467"><span id="lf0610_label_4416">25</span> He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner <span class="ital">or no,</span> I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3468"><span id="lf0610_label_4417">26</span> Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3469"><span id="lf0610_label_4418">27</span> He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear <span class="ital">it</span> again? will ye also be his disciples?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3470"><span id="lf0610_label_4419">28</span> Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses&#x2019; disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3471"><span id="lf0610_label_4420">29</span> We know that God spake unto Moses: <span class="ital">as for</span> this <span class="ital">fellow,</span> we know not from whence he is.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3472"><span id="lf0610_label_4421">30</span> The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and <span class="ital">yet</span> he hath opened mine eyes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3473"><span id="lf0610_label_4422">31</span> Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3474"><span id="lf0610_label_4423">32</span> Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3475"><span id="lf0610_label_4424">33</span> If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3476"><span id="lf0610_label_4425">34</span> They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt993" id="lf0610_footnote_nt993_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>cast him out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3477"><span id="lf0610_label_4427">35</span> Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3478"><span id="lf0610_label_4428">36</span> He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3479"><span id="lf0610_label_4429">37</span> And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3480"><span id="lf0610_label_4430">38</span> And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3481"><span id="lf0610_label_4431">39</span> &#xB6; And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3482"><span id="lf0610_label_4432">40</span> And <span class="ital">some</span> of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3483"><span id="lf0610_label_4433">41</span> Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_096" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4434">10</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3484"><span id="lf0610_label_4435">1</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3485"><span id="lf0610_label_4436">2</span> But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3486"><span id="lf0610_label_4437">3</span> To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3487"><span id="lf0610_label_4438">4</span> And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3488"><span id="lf0610_label_4439">5</span> And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3489"><span id="lf0610_label_4440">6</span> This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3490"><span id="lf0610_label_4441">7</span> Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3491"><span id="lf0610_label_4442">8</span> All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3492"><span id="lf0610_label_4443">9</span> I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3493"><span id="lf0610_label_4444">10</span> The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have <span class="ital">it</span> more abundantly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3494"><span id="lf0610_label_4445">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt994" id="lf0610_footnote_nt994_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3495"><span id="lf0610_label_4447">12</span> But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3496"><span id="lf0610_label_4448">13</span> The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.</p>
