<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3497"><span id="lf0610_label_4449">14</span> I am the good shepherd, and know my <span class="ital">sheep,</span> and am known of mine.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3498"><span id="lf0610_label_4450">15</span> As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3499"><span id="lf0610_label_4451">16</span> And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt995" id="lf0610_footnote_nt995_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and there shall be one fold, <span class="ital">and</span> one shepherd.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3500"><span id="lf0610_label_4453">17</span> Therefore doth my Father love me, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt996" id="lf0610_footnote_nt996_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3501"><span id="lf0610_label_4455">18</span> No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt997" id="lf0610_footnote_nt997_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This commandment have I received of my Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3502"><span id="lf0610_label_4457">19</span> &#xB6; There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3503"><span id="lf0610_label_4458">20</span> And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3504"><span id="lf0610_label_4459">21</span> Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3505"><span id="lf0610_label_4460">22</span> &#xB6; And it was at Jerusalem the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt998" id="lf0610_footnote_nt998_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>feast of the dedication, and it was winter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3506"><span id="lf0610_label_4462">23</span> And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon&#x2019;s porch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3507"><span id="lf0610_label_4463">24</span> Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt999" id="lf0610_footnote_nt999_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3508"><span id="lf0610_label_4465">25</span> Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father&#x2019;s name, they bear witness of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3509"><span id="lf0610_label_4466">26</span> But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3510"><span id="lf0610_label_4467">27</span> My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3511"><span id="lf0610_label_4468">28</span> And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any <span class="ital">man</span> pluck them out of my hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3512"><span id="lf0610_label_4469">29</span> My Father, which gave <span class="ital">them</span> me, is greater than all; and no <span class="ital">man</span> is able to pluck <span class="ital">them</span> out of my Father&#x2019;s hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3513"><span id="lf0610_label_4470">30</span> I and <span class="ital">my</span> Father are one.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3514"><span id="lf0610_label_4471">31</span> Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3515"><span id="lf0610_label_4472">32</span> Jesus answered them, Many good works have <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>123<span class="bracket">]</span></span> I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3516"><span id="lf0610_label_4473">33</span> The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3517"><span id="lf0610_label_4474">34</span> Jesus answered them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1000" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1000_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3518"><span id="lf0610_label_4476">35</span> If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3519"><span id="lf0610_label_4477">36</span> Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3520"><span id="lf0610_label_4478">37</span> If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3521"><span id="lf0610_label_4479">38</span> But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father <span class="ital">is</span> in me, and I in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3522"><span id="lf0610_label_4480">39</span> Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3523"><span id="lf0610_label_4481">40</span> And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3524"><span id="lf0610_label_4482">41</span> And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3525"><span id="lf0610_label_4483">42</span> And many believed on him there.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_097" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4484">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3526"><span id="lf0610_label_4485">1</span> Now a certain <span class="ital">man</span> was sick, <span class="ital">named</span> Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3527"><span id="lf0610_label_4486">2</span> (<a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1001" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1001_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>It was <span class="ital">that</span> Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3528"><span id="lf0610_label_4488">3</span> Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3529"><span id="lf0610_label_4489">4</span> When Jesus heard <span class="ital">that,</span> he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3530"><span id="lf0610_label_4490">5</span> Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3531"><span id="lf0610_label_4491">6</span> When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he abode two days still in the same place where he was.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3532"><span id="lf0610_label_4492">7</span> Then after that saith he to <span class="ital">his</span> disciples, Let us go into Jud&#xE6;a again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3533"><span id="lf0610_label_4493">8</span> <span class="ital">His</span> disciples say unto him, Master, the Jews of late sought to stone thee; and goest thou thither again?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3534"><span id="lf0610_label_4494">9</span> Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3535"><span id="lf0610_label_4495">10</span> But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3536"><span id="lf0610_label_4496">11</span> These things said he: and after that he saith unto them, Our friend Lazarns sleepeth; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3537"><span id="lf0610_label_4497">12</span> Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3538"><span id="lf0610_label_4498">13</span> Howbeit Jesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3539"><span id="lf0610_label_4499">14</span> Then said Jesus unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3540"><span id="lf0610_label_4500">15</span> And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3541"><span id="lf0610_label_4501">16</span> Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3542"><span id="lf0610_label_4502">17</span> Then when Jesus came, he found that he had <span class="ital">lain</span> in the grave four days already.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3543"><span id="lf0610_label_4503">18</span> Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1002" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1002_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>about fifteen furlongs off:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3544"><span id="lf0610_label_4505">19</span> And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3545"><span id="lf0610_label_4506">20</span> Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary sat <span class="ital">still</span> in the house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3546"><span id="lf0610_label_4507">21</span> Then said Martha unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>124<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3547"><span id="lf0610_label_4508">22</span> But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will give <span class="ital">it</span> thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3548"><span id="lf0610_label_4509">23</span> Jesus saith unto her, Thy brother shall rise again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3549"><span id="lf0610_label_4510">24</span> Martha saith unto him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1003" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1003_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3550"><span id="lf0610_label_4512">25</span> Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1004" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1004_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3551"><span id="lf0610_label_4514">26</span> And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3552"><span id="lf0610_label_4515">27</span> She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, which should come into the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3553"><span id="lf0610_label_4516">28</span> And when she had so said, she went her way, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Master is come, and calleth for thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3554"><span id="lf0610_label_4517">29</span> As soon as she heard <span class="ital">that,</span> she arose quickly, and came unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3555"><span id="lf0610_label_4518">30</span> Now Jesus was not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3556"><span id="lf0610_label_4519">31</span> The Jews then which were with her in the house, and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up hastily and went out, followed her, saying, She goeth unto the grave to weep there.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3557"><span id="lf0610_label_4520">32</span> Then when Mary was come where Jesus was. and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3558"><span id="lf0610_label_4521">33</span> When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping which came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1005" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1005_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>was troubled,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3559"><span id="lf0610_label_4523">34</span> And said, Where have ye laid him? They <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1006" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1006_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>said unto him, Lord, come and see.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3560"><span id="lf0610_label_4525">35</span> Jesus wept.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3561"><span id="lf0610_label_4526">36</span> Then said the Jews, Behold how he loved him!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3562"><span id="lf0610_label_4527">37</span> And some of them said, Could not this man, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1007" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1007_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>which opened the eyes of the blind, have caused that even this man should not have died?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3563"><span id="lf0610_label_4529">38</span> Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave. It was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3564"><span id="lf0610_label_4530">39</span> Jesus said, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath been <span class="ital">dead</span> four days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3565"><span id="lf0610_label_4531">40</span> Jesus saith unto her, Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3566"><span id="lf0610_label_4532">41</span> Then they took away the stone <span class="ital">from the place</span> where the dead was laid. And Jesus lifted up <span class="ital">his</span> eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3567"><span id="lf0610_label_4533">42</span> And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people which stand by I said <span class="ital">it,</span> that they may believe that thou hast sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3568"><span id="lf0610_label_4534">43</span> And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3569"><span id="lf0610_label_4535">44</span> And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes: and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them, Loose him, and let him go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3570"><span id="lf0610_label_4536">45</span> Then many of the Jews which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed on him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3571"><span id="lf0610_label_4537">46</span> But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3572"><span id="lf0610_label_4538">47</span> &#xB6; Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many miracles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3573"><span id="lf0610_label_4539">48</span> If we let him thus alone, all <span class="ital">men</span> will believe on him: and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3574"><span id="lf0610_label_4540">49</span> And one of them, <span class="ital">named</span> Caiaphas, being the high priest that same year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3575"><span id="lf0610_label_4541">50</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1008" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1008_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Nor consider that it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3576"><span id="lf0610_label_4543">51</span> And this spake he not of himself: but being <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>125<span class="bracket">]</span></span> high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3577"><span id="lf0610_label_4544">52</span> And not for that nation only, but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3578"><span id="lf0610_label_4545">53</span> Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3579"><span id="lf0610_label_4546">54</span> Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and there continued with his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3580"><span id="lf0610_label_4547">55</span> &#xB6; And the Jews&#x2019; passover was nigh at hand: and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover, to purify themselves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3581"><span id="lf0610_label_4548">56</span> Then sought they for Jesus, and spake among themselves, as they stood in the temple, What think ye, that he will not come to the feast?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3582"><span id="lf0610_label_4549">57</span> Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment, that, if any man knew where he were, he should shew <span class="ital">it,</span> that they might take him.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_098" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4550">12</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3583"><span id="lf0610_label_4551">1</span> Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3584"><span id="lf0610_label_4552">2</span> There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3585"><span id="lf0610_label_4553">3</span> Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3586"><span id="lf0610_label_4554">4</span> Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon&#x2019;s <span class="ital">son,</span> which should betray him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3587"><span id="lf0610_label_4555">5</span> Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3588"><span id="lf0610_label_4556">6</span> This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1009" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1009_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>had the bag, and bare what was put therein.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3589"><span id="lf0610_label_4558">7</span> Then said Jesus, Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3590"><span id="lf0610_label_4559">8</span> For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3591"><span id="lf0610_label_4560">9</span> Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus&#x2019; sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3592"><span id="lf0610_label_4561">10</span> &#xB6; But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3593"><span id="lf0610_label_4562">11</span> Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3594"><span id="lf0610_label_4563">12</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1010" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1010_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3595"><span id="lf0610_label_4565">13</span> Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed <span class="ital">is</span> the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3596"><span id="lf0610_label_4566">14</span> And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3597"><span id="lf0610_label_4567">15</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1011" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1011_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass&#x2019;s colt.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3598"><span id="lf0610_label_4569">16</span> These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and <span class="ital">that</span> they had done these things unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3599"><span id="lf0610_label_4570">17</span> The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3600"><span id="lf0610_label_4571">18</span> For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3601"><span id="lf0610_label_4572">19</span> The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3602"><span id="lf0610_label_4573">20</span> &#xB6; And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3603"><span id="lf0610_label_4574">21</span> The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3604"><span id="lf0610_label_4575">22</span> Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1012" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1012_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>tell Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3605"><span id="lf0610_label_4577">23</span> &#xB6; And Jesus answered them, saying, The <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>126<span class="bracket">]</span></span> hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3606"><span id="lf0610_label_4578">24</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3607"><span id="lf0610_label_4579">25</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1013" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1013_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3608"><span id="lf0610_label_4581">26</span> If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will <span class="ital">my</span> Father honour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3609"><span id="lf0610_label_4582">27</span> Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour: but for this cause came I unto this hour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3610"><span id="lf0610_label_4583">28</span> Father, glorify thy name. Then came there a voice from heaven, <span class="ital">saying,</span> I have both glorified <span class="ital">it,</span> and will glorify <span class="ital">it</span> again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3611"><span id="lf0610_label_4584">29</span> The people therefore, that stood by, and heard <span class="ital">it,</span> said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3612"><span id="lf0610_label_4585">30</span> Jesus answered and said, This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3613"><span id="lf0610_label_4586">31</span> Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3614"><span id="lf0610_label_4587">32</span> And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all <span class="ital">men</span> unto me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3615"><span id="lf0610_label_4588">33</span> This he said, signifying what death he should die.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3616"><span id="lf0610_label_4589">34</span> The people answered him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1014" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1014_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3617"><span id="lf0610_label_4591">35</span> Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3618"><span id="lf0610_label_4592">36</span> While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3619"><span id="lf0610_label_4593">37</span> &#xB6; But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3620"><span id="lf0610_label_4594">38</span> That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1015" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1015_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3621"><span id="lf0610_label_4596">39</span> Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3622"><span id="lf0610_label_4597">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1016" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1016_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with <span class="ital">their</span> eyes, nor understand with <span class="ital">their</span> heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3623"><span id="lf0610_label_4599">41</span> These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3624"><span id="lf0610_label_4600">42</span> &#xB6; Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess <span class="ital">him,</span> lest they should be put out of the synagogue:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3625"><span id="lf0610_label_4601">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1017" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1017_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3626"><span id="lf0610_label_4603">44</span> &#xB6; Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3627"><span id="lf0610_label_4604">45</span> And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3628"><span id="lf0610_label_4605">46</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1018" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1018_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3629"><span id="lf0610_label_4607">47</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1019" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1019_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3630"><span id="lf0610_label_4609">48</span> He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1020" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1020_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3631"><span id="lf0610_label_4611">49</span> For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3632"><span id="lf0610_label_4612">50</span> And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_099" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4613">13</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3633"><span id="lf0610_label_4614">1</span> Now <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1021" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1021_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>127<span class="bracket">]</span></span> depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3634"><span id="lf0610_label_4616">2</span> And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon&#x2019;s <span class="ital">son,</span> to betray him;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3635"><span id="lf0610_label_4617">3</span> Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3636"><span id="lf0610_label_4618">4</span> He riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3637"><span id="lf0610_label_4619">5</span> After that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the disciples&#x2019; feet, and to wipe <span class="ital">them</span> with the towel wherewith he was girded.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3638"><span id="lf0610_label_4620">6</span> Then cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3639"><span id="lf0610_label_4621">7</span> Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3640"><span id="lf0610_label_4622">8</span> Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3641"><span id="lf0610_label_4623">9</span> Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also <span class="ital">my</span> hands and <span class="ital">my</span> head.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3642"><span id="lf0610_label_4624">10</span> Jesus saith to him, He that is washed needeth not save to wash <span class="ital">his</span> feet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3643"><span id="lf0610_label_4625">11</span> For he knew who should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3644"><span id="lf0610_label_4626">12</span> So after he had washed their feet, and had taken his garments, and was set down again, he said unto them, Know ye what I have done to you?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3645"><span id="lf0610_label_4627">13</span> Ye call me Master and Lord: and ye say well; for <span class="ital">so</span> I am.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3646"><span id="lf0610_label_4628">14</span> If I then, <span class="ital">your</span> Lord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another&#x2019;s feet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3647"><span id="lf0610_label_4629">15</span> For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3648"><span id="lf0610_label_4630">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1022" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1022_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Verily, verily, I say unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3649"><span id="lf0610_label_4632">17</span> If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3650"><span id="lf0610_label_4633">18</span> &#xB6; I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture may be fulfilled, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1023" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1023_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3651"><span id="lf0610_label_4635">19</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1024" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1024_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am <span class="ital">he.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3652"><span id="lf0610_label_4637">20</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1025" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1025_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3653"><span id="lf0610_label_4639">21</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1026" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1026_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3654"><span id="lf0610_label_4641">22</span> Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3655"><span id="lf0610_label_4642">23</span> Now there was leaning on Jesus&#x2019; bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3656"><span id="lf0610_label_4643">24</span> Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3657"><span id="lf0610_label_4644">25</span> He then lying on Jesus&#x2019; breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3658"><span id="lf0610_label_4645">26</span> Jesus answered, He it is, to whom I shall give a <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1027" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1027_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>sop, when I have dipped <span class="ital">it.</span> And when he had dipped the sop, he gave <span class="ital">it</span> to Judas Iscariot, <span class="ital">the son</span> of Simon.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3659"><span id="lf0610_label_4647">27</span> And after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Jesus unto him, That thou doest, do quickly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3660"><span id="lf0610_label_4648">28</span> Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3661"><span id="lf0610_label_4649">29</span> For some <span class="ital">of them</span> thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus had said unto him, Buy <span class="ital">those things</span> that we have need of against the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3662"><span id="lf0610_label_4650">30</span> He then having received the sop went immediately out: and it was night.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3663"><span id="lf0610_label_4651">31</span> &#xB6; Therefore, when he was gone out, Jesus said, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3664"><span id="lf0610_label_4652">32</span> If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorify him in himself, and shall straightway glorify him.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>128<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3665"><span id="lf0610_label_4653">33</span> Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1028" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1028_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; so now I say to you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3666"><span id="lf0610_label_4655">34</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1029" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1029_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3667"><span id="lf0610_label_4657">35</span> By this shall all <span class="ital">men</span> know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3668"><span id="lf0610_label_4658">36</span> &#xB6; Simon Peter said unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered him, Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3669"><span id="lf0610_label_4659">37</span> Peter said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1030" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1030_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>lay down my life for thy sake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3670"><span id="lf0610_label_4661">38</span> Jesus answered him, Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_100" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4662">14</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3671"><span id="lf0610_label_4663">1</span> Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3672"><span id="lf0610_label_4664">2</span> In my Father&#x2019;s house are many mansions: if <span class="ital">it were</span> not <span class="ital">so,</span> I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3673"><span id="lf0610_label_4665">3</span> And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am, <span class="ital">there</span> ye may be also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3674"><span id="lf0610_label_4666">4</span> And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3675"><span id="lf0610_label_4667">5</span> Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3676"><span id="lf0610_label_4668">6</span> Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3677"><span id="lf0610_label_4669">7</span> If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also: and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3678"><span id="lf0610_label_4670">8</span> Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3679"><span id="lf0610_label_4671">9</span> Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou <span class="ital">then,</span> Shew us the Father?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3680"><span id="lf0610_label_4672">10</span> Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3681"><span id="lf0610_label_4673">11</span> Believe me that I <span class="ital">am</span> in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works&#x2019; sake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3682"><span id="lf0610_label_4674">12</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater <span class="ital">works</span> than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3683"><span id="lf0610_label_4675">13</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1031" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1031_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3684"><span id="lf0610_label_4677">14</span> If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3685"><span id="lf0610_label_4678">15</span> &#xB6; If ye love me, keep my commandments.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3686"><span id="lf0610_label_4679">16</span> And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3687"><span id="lf0610_label_4680">17</span> <span class="ital">Even</span> the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3688"><span id="lf0610_label_4681">18</span> I will not leave you <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1032" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1032_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>comfortless: I will come to you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3689"><span id="lf0610_label_4683">19</span> Yet a little while, and the world seeth me no more; but ye see me: because I live, ye shall live also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3690"><span id="lf0610_label_4684">20</span> At that day ye shall know that I <span class="ital">am</span> in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3691"><span id="lf0610_label_4685">21</span> He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3692"><span id="lf0610_label_4686">22</span> Judas saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3693"><span id="lf0610_label_4687">23</span> Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>129<span class="bracket">]</span></span> will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3694"><span id="lf0610_label_4688">24</span> He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father&#x2019;s which sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3695"><span id="lf0610_label_4689">25</span> These things have I spoken unto you, being <span class="ital">yet</span> present with you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3696"><span id="lf0610_label_4690">26</span> But the Comforter, <span class="ital">which is</span> the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3697"><span id="lf0610_label_4691">27</span> Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3698"><span id="lf0610_label_4692">28</span> Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come <span class="ital">again</span> unto you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for my Father is greater than I.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3699"><span id="lf0610_label_4693">29</span> And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3700"><span id="lf0610_label_4694">30</span> Hereafter I will not talk much with you: for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3701"><span id="lf0610_label_4695">31</span> But that the world may know that I love the Father; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_101" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4696">15</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3702"><span id="lf0610_label_4697">1</span> I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3703"><span id="lf0610_label_4698">2</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1033" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1033_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every <span class="ital">branch</span> that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3704"><span id="lf0610_label_4700">3</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1034" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1034_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3705"><span id="lf0610_label_4702">4</span> Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3706"><span id="lf0610_label_4703">5</span> I am the vine, ye <span class="ital">are</span> the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1035" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1035_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>without me ye can do nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3707"><span id="lf0610_label_4705">6</span> If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and cast <span class="ital">them</span> into the fire, and they are burned.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3708"><span id="lf0610_label_4706">7</span> If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3709"><span id="lf0610_label_4707">8</span> Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3710"><span id="lf0610_label_4708">9</span> As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3711"><span id="lf0610_label_4709">10</span> If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father&#x2019;s commandments, and abide in his love.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3712"><span id="lf0610_label_4710">11</span> These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and <span class="ital">that</span> your joy might be full.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3713"><span id="lf0610_label_4711">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1036" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1036_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3714"><span id="lf0610_label_4713">13</span> Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3715"><span id="lf0610_label_4714">14</span> Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3716"><span id="lf0610_label_4715">15</span> Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3717"><span id="lf0610_label_4716">16</span> Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1037" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1037_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and <span class="ital">that</span> your fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3718"><span id="lf0610_label_4718">17</span> These things I command you, that ye love one another.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3719"><span id="lf0610_label_4719">18</span> If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before <span class="ital">it hated</span> you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3720"><span id="lf0610_label_4720">19</span> If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3721"><span id="lf0610_label_4721">20</span> Remember the word that I said unto you, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>130<span class="bracket">]</span></span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1038" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1038_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The servant is not greater than <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1039" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1039_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3722"><span id="lf0610_label_4724">21</span> But all these things will they do unto you for my name&#x2019;s sake, because they know not him that sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3723"><span id="lf0610_label_4725">22</span> If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1040" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1040_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>cloke for their sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3724"><span id="lf0610_label_4727">23</span> He that hateth me hateth my Father also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3725"><span id="lf0610_label_4728">24</span> If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3726"><span id="lf0610_label_4729">25</span> But <span class="ital">this cometh to pass,</span> that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1041" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1041_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>They hated me without a cause.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3727"><span id="lf0610_label_4731">26</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1042" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1042_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, <span class="ital">eren</span> the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3728"><span id="lf0610_label_4733">27</span> And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_102" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4734">16</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3729"><span id="lf0610_label_4735">1</span> These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3730"><span id="lf0610_label_4736">2</span> They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3731"><span id="lf0610_label_4737">3</span> And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3732"><span id="lf0610_label_4738">4</span> But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3733"><span id="lf0610_label_4739">5</span> But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3734"><span id="lf0610_label_4740">6</span> But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3735"><span id="lf0610_label_4741">7</span> Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3736"><span id="lf0610_label_4742">8</span> And when he is come, he will <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1043" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1043_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3737"><span id="lf0610_label_4744">9</span> Of sin, because they believe not on me;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3738"><span id="lf0610_label_4745">10</span> Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3739"><span id="lf0610_label_4746">11</span> Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3740"><span id="lf0610_label_4747">12</span> I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3741"><span id="lf0610_label_4748">13</span> Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, <span class="ital">that</span> shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3742"><span id="lf0610_label_4749">14</span> He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew <span class="ital">it</span> unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3743"><span id="lf0610_label_4750">15</span> All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shew <span class="ital">it</span> unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3744"><span id="lf0610_label_4751">16</span> A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3745"><span id="lf0610_label_4752">17</span> Then said <span class="ital">some</span> of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3746"><span id="lf0610_label_4753">18</span> They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? we cannot tell what he saith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3747"><span id="lf0610_label_4754">19</span> Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them, Do ye enquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3748"><span id="lf0610_label_4755">20</span> Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>131<span class="bracket">]</span></span> ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3749"><span id="lf0610_label_4756">21</span> A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3750"><span id="lf0610_label_4757">22</span> And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3751"><span id="lf0610_label_4758">23</span> And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1044" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1044_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give <span class="ital">it</span> you</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3752"><span id="lf0610_label_4760">24</span> Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3753"><span id="lf0610_label_4761">25</span> These things have I spoken unto you in <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1045" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1045_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>proverbs: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1046" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1046_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1047" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1047_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3754"><span id="lf0610_label_4765">26</span> At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3755"><span id="lf0610_label_4766">27</span> For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have beheved that I came out from God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3756"><span id="lf0610_label_4767">28</span> I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3757"><span id="lf0610_label_4768">29</span> His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1048" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1048_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>proverb.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3758"><span id="lf0610_label_4770">30</span> Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3759"><span id="lf0610_label_4771">31</span> Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3760"><span id="lf0610_label_4772">32</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1049" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1049_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1050" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1050_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3761"><span id="lf0610_label_4775">33</span> These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_103" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4776">17</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3762"><span id="lf0610_label_4777">1</span> These words spake Jesus, and lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said, Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3763"><span id="lf0610_label_4778">2</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1051" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1051_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3764"><span id="lf0610_label_4780">3</span> And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3765"><span id="lf0610_label_4781">4</span> I have glorified thee on the earth: I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3766"><span id="lf0610_label_4782">5</span> And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3767"><span id="lf0610_label_4783">6</span> I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them me; and they have kept thy word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3768"><span id="lf0610_label_4784">7</span> Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3769"><span id="lf0610_label_4785">8</span> For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have received <span class="ital">them,</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1052" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1052_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3770"><span id="lf0610_label_4787">9</span> I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for them which thou hast given me; for they are thine.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3771"><span id="lf0610_label_4788">10</span> And all mine are thine, and thine are mine; and I am glorified in them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3772"><span id="lf0610_label_4789">11</span> And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we <span class="ital">are.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3773"><span id="lf0610_label_4790">12</span> While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name: those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1053" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1053_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that the scripture might be fulfilled.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>132<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3774"><span id="lf0610_label_4792">13</span> And now come I to thee; and these things I speak in the world, that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3775"><span id="lf0610_label_4793">14</span> I have given them thy word; and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3776"><span id="lf0610_label_4794">15</span> I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3777"><span id="lf0610_label_4795">16</span> They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3778"><span id="lf0610_label_4796">17</span> Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3779"><span id="lf0610_label_4797">18</span> As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3780"><span id="lf0610_label_4798">19</span> And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1054" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1054_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>sanctified through the truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3781"><span id="lf0610_label_4800">20</span> Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall believe on me through their word;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3782"><span id="lf0610_label_4801">21</span> That they all may be one; as thou, Father, <span class="ital">art</span> in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3783"><span id="lf0610_label_4802">22</span> And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them; that they may be one, even as we are one:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3784"><span id="lf0610_label_4803">23</span> I in them, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3785"><span id="lf0610_label_4804">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1055" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1055_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3786"><span id="lf0610_label_4806">25</span> O righteous Father, the world hath not known thee: but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3787"><span id="lf0610_label_4807">26</span> And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declare <span class="ital">it:</span> that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_104" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4808">18</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3788"><span id="lf0610_label_4809">1</span> When Jesus had spoken these words, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1056" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1056_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3789"><span id="lf0610_label_4811">2</span> And Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3790"><span id="lf0610_label_4812">3</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1057" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1057_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Judas then, having received a band <span class="ital">of men</span> and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3791"><span id="lf0610_label_4814">4</span> Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3792"><span id="lf0610_label_4815">5</span> They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I am <span class="ital">he.</span> And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3793"><span id="lf0610_label_4816">6</span> As soon then as he had said unto them, I am <span class="ital">he,</span> they went backward, and fell to the ground.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3794"><span id="lf0610_label_4817">7</span> Then asked he them again, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3795"><span id="lf0610_label_4818">8</span> Jesus answered, I have told you that I am <span class="ital">he:</span> if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3796"><span id="lf0610_label_4819">9</span> That the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1058" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1058_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3797"><span id="lf0610_label_4821">10</span> Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest&#x2019;s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant&#x2019;s name was Malchus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3798"><span id="lf0610_label_4822">11</span> Then said Jesus unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3799"><span id="lf0610_label_4823">12</span> Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3800"><span id="lf0610_label_4824">13</span> And led him away to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.<a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1059" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1059_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3801"><span id="lf0610_label_4826">14</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1060" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1060_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>133<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3802"><span id="lf0610_label_4828">15</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1061" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1061_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and <span class="ital">so did</span> another disciple: that disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3803"><span id="lf0610_label_4830">16</span> But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3804"><span id="lf0610_label_4831">17</span> Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou also <span class="ital">one</span> of this man&#x2019;s disciples? He saith, I am not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3805"><span id="lf0610_label_4832">18</span> And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals; for it was cold: and they warmed themselves: and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3806"><span id="lf0610_label_4833">19</span> &#xB6; The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3807"><span id="lf0610_label_4834">20</span> Jesus answered him, I spake openly to the world; I ever taught in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the Jews always resort; and in secret have I said nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3808"><span id="lf0610_label_4835">21</span> Why askest thou me? ask them which heard me, what I have said unto them: behold, they know what I said.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3809"><span id="lf0610_label_4836">22</span> And when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1062" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1062_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3810"><span id="lf0610_label_4838">23</span> Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3811"><span id="lf0610_label_4839">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1063" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1063_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3812"><span id="lf0610_label_4841">25</span> And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1064" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1064_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>They said therefore unto him, Art not thou also <span class="ital">one</span> of his disciples? He denied <span class="ital">it,</span> and said, I am not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3813"><span id="lf0610_label_4843">26</span> One of the servants of the high priest, being <span class="ital">his</span> kinsman whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3814"><span id="lf0610_label_4844">27</span> Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3815"><span id="lf0610_label_4845">28</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1065" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1065_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1066" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1066_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the hall of judgment: and it was early; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1067" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1067_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3816"><span id="lf0610_label_4849">29</span> Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3817"><span id="lf0610_label_4850">30</span> They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3818"><span id="lf0610_label_4851">31</span> Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3819"><span id="lf0610_label_4852">32</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1068" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1068_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3820"><span id="lf0610_label_4854">33</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1069" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1069_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3821"><span id="lf0610_label_4856">34</span> Jesus answered him, Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3822"><span id="lf0610_label_4857">35</span> Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3823"><span id="lf0610_label_4858">36</span> Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3824"><span id="lf0610_label_4859">37</span> Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3825"><span id="lf0610_label_4860">38</span> Pilate saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>134<span class="bracket">]</span></span> unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no fault <span class="ital">at all.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3826"><span id="lf0610_label_4861">39</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1070" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1070_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3827"><span id="lf0610_label_4863">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1071" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1071_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_105" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4865">19</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3828"><span id="lf0610_label_4866">1</span> Then <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1072" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1072_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourged <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3829"><span id="lf0610_label_4868">2</span> And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put <span class="ital">it</span> on his head, and they put on him a purple robe,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3830"><span id="lf0610_label_4869">3</span> And said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3831"><span id="lf0610_label_4870">4</span> Pilate therefore went forth again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3832"><span id="lf0610_label_4871">5</span> Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe. And <span class="ital">Pilate</span> saith unto them, Behold the man!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3833"><span id="lf0610_label_4872">6</span> When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify <span class="ital">him,</span> crucify <span class="ital">him.</span> Pilate saith unto them, Take ye him, and crucify <span class="ital">him:</span> for I find no fault in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3834"><span id="lf0610_label_4873">7</span> The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3835"><span id="lf0610_label_4874">8</span> &#xB6; When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3836"><span id="lf0610_label_4875">9</span> And went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3837"><span id="lf0610_label_4876">10</span> Then saith Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3838"><span id="lf0610_label_4877">11</span> Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power <span class="ital">at all</span> against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3839"><span id="lf0610_label_4878">12</span> And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not C&#xE6;sar&#x2019;s friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against C&#xE6;sar.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3840"><span id="lf0610_label_4879">13</span> &#xB6; When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth, and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3841"><span id="lf0610_label_4880">14</span> And it was the preparation of the passover, and about the sixth hour: and he saith unto the Jews, Behold your King!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3842"><span id="lf0610_label_4881">15</span> But they cried out, Away with <span class="ital">him,</span> away with <span class="ital">him,</span> crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but C&#xE6;sar.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3843"><span id="lf0610_label_4882">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1073" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1073_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified. And they took Jesus, and led <span class="ital">him</span> away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3844"><span id="lf0610_label_4884">17</span> And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called <span class="ital">the place</span> of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3845"><span id="lf0610_label_4885">18</span> Where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3846"><span id="lf0610_label_4886">19</span> &#xB6; And Pilate wrote a title, and put <span class="ital">it</span> on the cross. And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.</p>
