<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3847"><span id="lf0610_label_4887">20</span> This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city: and it was written in Hebrew, <span class="ital">and</span> Greek, <span class="ital">and</span> Latin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3848"><span id="lf0610_label_4888">21</span> Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3849"><span id="lf0610_label_4889">22</span> Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3850"><span id="lf0610_label_4890">23</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1074" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1074_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also <span class="ital">his</span> coat: now the coat was without seam, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1075" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1075_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>woven from the top throughout.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>135<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3851"><span id="lf0610_label_4893">24</span> They said therefore among themselves, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1076" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1076_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be: that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1077" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1077_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>They parted my raiment among them, and for my vesture they did cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3852"><span id="lf0610_label_4896">25</span> &#xB6; Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother&#x2019;s sister, Mary the <span class="ital">wife</span> of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1078" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1078_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3853"><span id="lf0610_label_4898">26</span> When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3854"><span id="lf0610_label_4899">27</span> Then saith he to the disciple, Behold thy mother! And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own <span class="ital">home.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3855"><span id="lf0610_label_4900">28</span> &#xB6; After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1079" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1079_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3856"><span id="lf0610_label_4902">29</span> Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar: and they filled a spunge with vinegar, and put <span class="ital">it</span> upon hyssop, and put <span class="ital">it</span> to his mouth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3857"><span id="lf0610_label_4903">30</span> When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3858"><span id="lf0610_label_4904">31</span> The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and <span class="ital">that</span> they might be taken away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3859"><span id="lf0610_label_4905">32</span> Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3860"><span id="lf0610_label_4906">33</span> But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3861"><span id="lf0610_label_4907">34</span> But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3862"><span id="lf0610_label_4908">35</span> And he that saw <span class="ital">it</span> bare record, and his record is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3863"><span id="lf0610_label_4909">36</span> For these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1080" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1080_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A bone of him shall not be broken.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3864"><span id="lf0610_label_4911">37</span> And again another scripture saith, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1081" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1081_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>They shall look on him whom they pierced.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3865"><span id="lf0610_label_4913">38</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1082" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1082_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And after this Joseph of Arimath&#xE6;a, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gave <span class="ital">him</span> leave. He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3866"><span id="lf0610_label_4915">39</span> And there came also Nicodemus, which at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred pound <span class="ital">weight.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3867"><span id="lf0610_label_4916">40</span> Then took they the body of Jesus, and wound it in linen clothes with the spices, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3868"><span id="lf0610_label_4917">41</span> Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3869"><span id="lf0610_label_4918">42</span> There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews&#x2019; preparation <span class="ital">day;</span> for the sepulchre was nigh at hand.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_106" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4919">20</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3870"><span id="lf0610_label_4920">1</span> The <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1083" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1083_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>first <span class="ital">day</span> of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3871"><span id="lf0610_label_4922">2</span> Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1084" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1084_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3872"><span id="lf0610_label_4924">3</span> Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3873"><span id="lf0610_label_4925">4</span> So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3874"><span id="lf0610_label_4926">5</span> And he stooping down, <span class="ital">and looking in,</span> saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>136<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3875"><span id="lf0610_label_4927">6</span> Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3876"><span id="lf0610_label_4928">7</span> And the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3877"><span id="lf0610_label_4929">8</span> Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3878"><span id="lf0610_label_4930">9</span> For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3879"><span id="lf0610_label_4931">10</span> Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3880"><span id="lf0610_label_4932">11</span> &#xB6; But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down, <span class="ital">and looked</span> into the sepulchre,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3881"><span id="lf0610_label_4933">12</span> And seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3882"><span id="lf0610_label_4934">13</span> And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3883"><span id="lf0610_label_4935">14</span> And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3884"><span id="lf0610_label_4936">15</span> Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3885"><span id="lf0610_label_4937">16</span> Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3886"><span id="lf0610_label_4938">17</span> Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and <span class="ital">to</span> my God, and your God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3887"><span id="lf0610_label_4939">18</span> Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and <span class="ital">that</span> he had spoken these things unto her.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3888"><span id="lf0610_label_4940">19</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1085" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1085_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Then the same day at evening, being the first <span class="ital">day</span> of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace <span class="ital">be</span> unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3889"><span id="lf0610_label_4942">20</span> And when he had so said, he shewed unto them <span class="ital">his</span> hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3890"><span id="lf0610_label_4943">21</span> Then said Jesus to them again, Peace <span class="ital">be</span> unto you: as <span class="ital">my</span> Father hath sent me, even so send I you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3891"><span id="lf0610_label_4944">22</span> And when he had said this, he breathed on <span class="ital">them,</span> and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3892"><span id="lf0610_label_4945">23</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1086" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1086_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; <span class="ital">and</span> whose soever <span class="ital">sins</span> ye retain, they are retained.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3893"><span id="lf0610_label_4947">24</span> &#xB6; But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3894"><span id="lf0610_label_4948">25</span> The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3895"><span id="lf0610_label_4949">26</span> &#xB6; And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them: <span class="ital">then</span> came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace <span class="ital">be</span> unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3896"><span id="lf0610_label_4950">27</span> Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and thrust <span class="ital">it</span> into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3897"><span id="lf0610_label_4951">28</span> And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3898"><span id="lf0610_label_4952">29</span> Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed <span class="ital">are</span> they that have not seen, and <span class="ital">yet</span> have believed.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>137<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3899"><span id="lf0610_label_4953">30</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1087" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1087_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3900"><span id="lf0610_label_4955">31</span> But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_107" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4956">21</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3901"><span id="lf0610_label_4957">1</span> After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he <span class="ital">himself.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3902"><span id="lf0610_label_4958">2</span> There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the <span class="ital">sons</span> of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3903"><span id="lf0610_label_4959">3</span> Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3904"><span id="lf0610_label_4960">4</span> But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3905"><span id="lf0610_label_4961">5</span> Then Jesus saith unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1088" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1088_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Children, have ye any meat? They answered him, No.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3906"><span id="lf0610_label_4963">6</span> And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3907"><span id="lf0610_label_4964">7</span> Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt <span class="ital">his</span> fisher&#x2019;s coat <span class="ital">unto him,</span> (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3908"><span id="lf0610_label_4965">8</span> And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3909"><span id="lf0610_label_4966">9</span> As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3910"><span id="lf0610_label_4967">10</span> Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3911"><span id="lf0610_label_4968">11</span> Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3912"><span id="lf0610_label_4969">12</span> Jesus saith unto them, Come <span class="ital">and</span> dine. And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3913"><span id="lf0610_label_4970">13</span> Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3914"><span id="lf0610_label_4971">14</span> This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3915"><span id="lf0610_label_4972">15</span> &#xB6; So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, <span class="ital">son</span> of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3916"><span id="lf0610_label_4973">16</span> He saith to him again the second time, Simon, <span class="ital">son</span> of Jonas, lovest thou me? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3917"><span id="lf0610_label_4974">17</span> He <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1089" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1089_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>saith unto him the third time, Simon, <span class="ital">son</span> of Jonas, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3918"><span id="lf0610_label_4976">18</span> Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry <span class="ital">thee</span> whither thou wouldest not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3919"><span id="lf0610_label_4977">19</span> This spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3920"><span id="lf0610_label_4978">20</span> Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1090" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1090_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3921"><span id="lf0610_label_4980">21</span> Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what <span class="ital">shall</span> this man <span class="ital">do?</span></p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>138<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3922"><span id="lf0610_label_4981">22</span> Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what <span class="ital">is that</span> to thee? follow thou me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3923"><span id="lf0610_label_4982">23</span> Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what <span class="ital">is that</span> to thee?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3924"><span id="lf0610_label_4983">24</span> This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3925"><span id="lf0610_label_4984">25</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1091" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1091_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_108" class="type-part The_Acts">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_015">THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLES.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_109" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_4986">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3926"><span id="lf0610_label_4987">1</span> <span class="csc">The</span> former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3927"><span id="lf0610_label_4988">2</span> Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3928"><span id="lf0610_label_4989">3</span> To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3929"><span id="lf0610_label_4990">4</span> And, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1092" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1092_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>being assembled together with <span class="ital">them,</span> commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1093" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1093_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>which, <span class="ital">saith he,</span> ye have heard of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3930"><span id="lf0610_label_4993">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1094" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1094_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For John truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3931"><span id="lf0610_label_4995">6</span> When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3932"><span id="lf0610_label_4996">7</span> And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3933"><span id="lf0610_label_4997">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1095" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1095_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But ye shall receive <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1096" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1096_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Jud&#xE6;a, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3934"><span id="lf0610_label_5000">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1097" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1097_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3935"><span id="lf0610_label_5002">10</span> And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3936"><span id="lf0610_label_5003">11</span> Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3937"><span id="lf0610_label_5004">12</span> Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day&#x2019;s journey.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3938"><span id="lf0610_label_5005">13</span> And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James <span class="ital">the son</span> of Alph&#xE6;us, and Simon Zelotes, and Judas <span class="ital">the brother</span> of James.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3939"><span id="lf0610_label_5006">14</span> These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3940"><span id="lf0610_label_5007">15</span> &#xB6; And in those days Peter stood up in the <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>139<span class="bracket">]</span></span> midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3941"><span id="lf0610_label_5008">16</span> Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1098" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1098_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3942"><span id="lf0610_label_5010">17</span> For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3943"><span id="lf0610_label_5011">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1099" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1099_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3944"><span id="lf0610_label_5013">19</span> And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3945"><span id="lf0610_label_5014">20</span> For it is written in the book of Psalms, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1100" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1100_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein: and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1101" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1101_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>his <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1102" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1102_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>bishoprick let another take.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3946"><span id="lf0610_label_5018">21</span> Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3947"><span id="lf0610_label_5019">22</span> Beginning from the baptism of John, unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3948"><span id="lf0610_label_5020">23</span> And they appointed two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3949"><span id="lf0610_label_5021">24</span> And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all <span class="ital">men,</span> shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3950"><span id="lf0610_label_5022">25</span> That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3951"><span id="lf0610_label_5023">26</span> And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_110" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5024">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3952"><span id="lf0610_label_5025">1</span> And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3953"><span id="lf0610_label_5026">2</span> And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3954"><span id="lf0610_label_5027">3</span> And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3955"><span id="lf0610_label_5028">4</span> And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3956"><span id="lf0610_label_5029">5</span> And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3957"><span id="lf0610_label_5030">6</span> Now <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1103" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1103_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1104" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1104_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3958"><span id="lf0610_label_5033">7</span> And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Gali&#xE6;ans?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3959"><span id="lf0610_label_5034">8</span> And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3960"><span id="lf0610_label_5035">9</span> Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Jud&#xE6;a, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3961"><span id="lf0610_label_5036">10</span> Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3962"><span id="lf0610_label_5037">11</span> Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3963"><span id="lf0610_label_5038">12</span> And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3964"><span id="lf0610_label_5039">13</span> Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3965"><span id="lf0610_label_5040">14</span> &#xB6; But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Jud&#xE6;a, and all <span class="ital">ye</span> that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3966"><span id="lf0610_label_5041">15</span> For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is <span class="ital">but</span> the third hour of the day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3967"><span id="lf0610_label_5042">16</span> But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3968"><span id="lf0610_label_5043">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1105" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1105_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>140<span class="bracket">]</span></span> and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3969"><span id="lf0610_label_5045">18</span> And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3970"><span id="lf0610_label_5046">19</span> And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3971"><span id="lf0610_label_5047">20</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1106" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1106_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3972"><span id="lf0610_label_5049">21</span> And it shall come to pass, <span class="ital">that</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1107" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1107_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3973"><span id="lf0610_label_5051">22</span> Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1108" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1108_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3974"><span id="lf0610_label_5053">23</span> Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3975"><span id="lf0610_label_5054">24</span> Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3976"><span id="lf0610_label_5055">25</span> For David speaketh concerning him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1109" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1109_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3977"><span id="lf0610_label_5057">26</span> Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3978"><span id="lf0610_label_5058">27</span> Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3979"><span id="lf0610_label_5059">28</span> Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3980"><span id="lf0610_label_5060">29</span> Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1110" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1110_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>let me freely speak unto you <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1111" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1111_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3981"><span id="lf0610_label_5063">30</span> Therefore being a prophet, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1112" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1112_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3982"><span id="lf0610_label_5065">31</span> He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1113" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1113_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3983"><span id="lf0610_label_5067">32</span> This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3984"><span id="lf0610_label_5068">33</span> Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3985"><span id="lf0610_label_5069">34</span> For David is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1114" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1114_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The <span class="csc">Lord</span> said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3986"><span id="lf0610_label_5071">35</span> Until I make thy foes thy footstool.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3987"><span id="lf0610_label_5072">36</span> Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3988"><span id="lf0610_label_5073">37</span> &#xB6; Now when they heard <span class="ital">this,</span> they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, what shall we do?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3989"><span id="lf0610_label_5074">38</span> Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3990"><span id="lf0610_label_5075">39</span> For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, <span class="ital">even</span> as many as the Lord our God shall call.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3991"><span id="lf0610_label_5076">40</span> And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3992"><span id="lf0610_label_5077">41</span> &#xB6; Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were added <span class="ital">unto them</span> about three thousand souls.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3993"><span id="lf0610_label_5078">42</span> And they continued stedfastly in the apostles&#x2019; <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>141<span class="bracket">]</span></span> doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3994"><span id="lf0610_label_5079">43</span> And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3995"><span id="lf0610_label_5080">44</span> And all that believed were together, and had all things common;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3996"><span id="lf0610_label_5081">45</span> And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all <span class="ital">men,</span> as every man had need.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3997"><span id="lf0610_label_5082">46</span> And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1115" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1115_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3998"><span id="lf0610_label_5084">47</span> Praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_111" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5085">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_3999"><span id="lf0610_label_5086">1</span> Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, <span class="ital">being</span> the ninth <span class="ital">hour.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4000"><span id="lf0610_label_5087">2</span> And a certain man lame from his mother&#x2019;s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4001"><span id="lf0610_label_5088">3</span> Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4002"><span id="lf0610_label_5089">4</span> And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4003"><span id="lf0610_label_5090">5</span> And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4004"><span id="lf0610_label_5091">6</span> Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4005"><span id="lf0610_label_5092">7</span> And he took him by the right hand, and lifted <span class="ital">him</span> up: and immediately his feet and ancle bones received strength.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4006"><span id="lf0610_label_5093">8</span> And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4007"><span id="lf0610_label_5094">9</span> And all the people saw him walking and praising God:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4008"><span id="lf0610_label_5095">10</span> And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4009"><span id="lf0610_label_5096">11</span> And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon&#x2019;s, greatly wondering.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4010"><span id="lf0610_label_5097">12</span> &#xB6; And when Peter saw <span class="ital">it,</span> he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4011"><span id="lf0610_label_5098">13</span> The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let <span class="ital">him</span> go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4012"><span id="lf0610_label_5099">14</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1116" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1116_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4013"><span id="lf0610_label_5101">15</span> And killed the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1117" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1117_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4014"><span id="lf0610_label_5103">16</span> And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4015"><span id="lf0610_label_5104">17</span> And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did <span class="ital">it,</span> as <span class="ital">did</span> also your rulers.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4016"><span id="lf0610_label_5105">18</span> But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4017"><span id="lf0610_label_5106">19</span> &#xB6; Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4018"><span id="lf0610_label_5107">20</span> And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4019"><span id="lf0610_label_5108">21</span> Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>142<span class="bracket">]</span></span> spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4020"><span id="lf0610_label_5109">22</span> For Moses truly said unto the fathers, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1118" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1118_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4021"><span id="lf0610_label_5111">23</span> And it shall come to pass, <span class="ital">that</span> every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4022"><span id="lf0610_label_5112">24</span> Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4023"><span id="lf0610_label_5113">25</span> Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1119" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1119_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4024"><span id="lf0610_label_5115">26</span> Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_112" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5116">4</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4025"><span id="lf0610_label_5117">1</span> And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1120" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1120_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4026"><span id="lf0610_label_5119">2</span> Being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4027"><span id="lf0610_label_5120">3</span> And they laid hands on them, and put <span class="ital">them</span> in hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4028"><span id="lf0610_label_5121">4</span> Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4029"><span id="lf0610_label_5122">5</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4030"><span id="lf0610_label_5123">6</span> And Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4031"><span id="lf0610_label_5124">7</span> And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4032"><span id="lf0610_label_5125">8</span> Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4033"><span id="lf0610_label_5126">9</span> If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4034"><span id="lf0610_label_5127">10</span> Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, <span class="ital">even</span> by him doth this man stand here before you whole.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4035"><span id="lf0610_label_5128">11</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1121" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1121_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4036"><span id="lf0610_label_5130">12</span> Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4037"><span id="lf0610_label_5131">13</span> &#xB6; Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4038"><span id="lf0610_label_5132">14</span> And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4039"><span id="lf0610_label_5133">15</span> But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4040"><span id="lf0610_label_5134">16</span> Saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them <span class="ital">is</span> manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot deny <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4041"><span id="lf0610_label_5135">17</span> But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4042"><span id="lf0610_label_5136">18</span> And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4043"><span id="lf0610_label_5137">19</span> But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>143<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4044"><span id="lf0610_label_5138">20</span> For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4045"><span id="lf0610_label_5139">21</span> So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for all <span class="ital">men</span> glorified God for that which was done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4046"><span id="lf0610_label_5140">22</span> For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4047"><span id="lf0610_label_5141">23</span> &#xB6; And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4048"><span id="lf0610_label_5142">24</span> And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, thou <span class="ital">art</span> God, which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4049"><span id="lf0610_label_5143">25</span> Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1122" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1122_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4050"><span id="lf0610_label_5145">26</span> The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord, and against his Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4051"><span id="lf0610_label_5146">27</span> For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, both Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4052"><span id="lf0610_label_5147">28</span> For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4053"><span id="lf0610_label_5148">29</span> And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4054"><span id="lf0610_label_5149">30</span> By stretching forth thine hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4055"><span id="lf0610_label_5150">31</span> &#xB6; And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4056"><span id="lf0610_label_5151">32</span> And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul: neither said any <span class="ital">of them</span> that ought of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4057"><span id="lf0610_label_5152">33</span> And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4058"><span id="lf0610_label_5153">34</span> Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4059"><span id="lf0610_label_5154">35</span> And laid <span class="ital">them</span> down at the apostles&#x2019; feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4060"><span id="lf0610_label_5155">36</span> And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, <span class="ital">and</span> of the country of Cyprus,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4061"><span id="lf0610_label_5156">37</span> Having land, sold <span class="ital">it,</span> and brought the money, and laid <span class="ital">it</span> at the apostles&#x2019; feet.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_113" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5157">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4062"><span id="lf0610_label_5158">1</span> But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4063"><span id="lf0610_label_5159">2</span> And kept back <span class="ital">part</span> of the price, his wife also being privy <span class="ital">to it,</span> and brought a certain part, and laid <span class="ital">it</span> at the apostles&#x2019; feet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4064"><span id="lf0610_label_5160">3</span> But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1123" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1123_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back <span class="ital">part</span> of the price of the land?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4065"><span id="lf0610_label_5162">4</span> Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4066"><span id="lf0610_label_5163">5</span> And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4067"><span id="lf0610_label_5164">6</span> And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried <span class="ital">him</span> out, and buried <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4068"><span id="lf0610_label_5165">7</span> And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4069"><span id="lf0610_label_5166">8</span> And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>144<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4070"><span id="lf0610_label_5167">9</span> Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband <span class="ital">are</span> at the door, and shall carry thee out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4071"><span id="lf0610_label_5168">10</span> Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying <span class="ital">her</span> forth, buried <span class="ital">her</span> by her husband.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4072"><span id="lf0610_label_5169">11</span> And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4073"><span id="lf0610_label_5170">12</span> &#xB6; And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon&#x2019;s porch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4074"><span id="lf0610_label_5171">13</span> And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4075"><span id="lf0610_label_5172">14</span> And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4076"><span id="lf0610_label_5173">15</span> Insomuch that they brought forth the sick <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1124" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1124_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>into the streets, and laid <span class="ital">them</span> on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4077"><span id="lf0610_label_5175">16</span> There came also a multitude <span class="ital">out</span> of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4078"><span id="lf0610_label_5176">17</span> &#xB6; Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1125" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1125_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>indignation,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4079"><span id="lf0610_label_5178">18</span> And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4080"><span id="lf0610_label_5179">19</span> But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4081"><span id="lf0610_label_5180">20</span> Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4082"><span id="lf0610_label_5181">21</span> And when they heard <span class="ital">that,</span> they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4083"><span id="lf0610_label_5182">22</span> But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4084"><span id="lf0610_label_5183">23</span> Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4085"><span id="lf0610_label_5184">24</span> Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4086"><span id="lf0610_label_5185">25</span> Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4087"><span id="lf0610_label_5186">26</span> Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4088"><span id="lf0610_label_5187">27</span> And when they had brought them, they set <span class="ital">them</span> before the council: and the high priest asked them,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4089"><span id="lf0610_label_5188">28</span> Saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1126" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1126_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man&#x2019;s blood upon us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4090"><span id="lf0610_label_5190">29</span> &#xB6; Then Peter and the <span class="ital">other</span> apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4091"><span id="lf0610_label_5191">30</span> The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4092"><span id="lf0610_label_5192">31</span> Him hath God exalted with his right hand <span class="ital">to be</span> a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4093"><span id="lf0610_label_5193">32</span> And we are his witnesses of these things; and <span class="ital">so is</span> also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4094"><span id="lf0610_label_5194">33</span> &#xB6; When they heard <span class="ital">that,</span> they were cut <span class="ital">to the heart,</span> and took counsel to slay them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4095"><span id="lf0610_label_5195">34</span> Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1127" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1127_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4096"><span id="lf0610_label_5197">35</span> And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>145<span class="bracket">]</span></span> heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4097"><span id="lf0610_label_5198">36</span> For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1128" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1128_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4098"><span id="lf0610_label_5200">37</span> After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, <span class="ital">even</span> as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4099"><span id="lf0610_label_5201">38</span> And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4100"><span id="lf0610_label_5202">39</span> But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4101"><span id="lf0610_label_5203">40</span> And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten <span class="ital">them,</span> they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4102"><span id="lf0610_label_5204">41</span> &#xB6; And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4103"><span id="lf0610_label_5205">42</span> And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_114" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5206">6</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4104"><span id="lf0610_label_5207">1</span> And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4105"><span id="lf0610_label_5208">2</span> Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples <span class="ital">unto them,</span> and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4106"><span id="lf0610_label_5209">3</span> Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4107"><span id="lf0610_label_5210">4</span> But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4108"><span id="lf0610_label_5211">5</span> &#xB6; And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4109"><span id="lf0610_label_5212">6</span> Whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid <span class="ital">their</span> hands on them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4110"><span id="lf0610_label_5213">7</span> And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4111"><span id="lf0610_label_5214">8</span> And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4112"><span id="lf0610_label_5215">9</span> &#xB6; Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called <span class="ital">the synagogue</span> of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4113"><span id="lf0610_label_5216">10</span> And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4114"><span id="lf0610_label_5217">11</span> Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and <span class="ital">against</span> God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4115"><span id="lf0610_label_5218">12</span> And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon <span class="ital">him,</span> and caught him, and brought <span class="ital">him</span> to the council,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4116"><span id="lf0610_label_5219">13</span> And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4117"><span id="lf0610_label_5220">14</span> For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1129" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1129_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>customs which Moses delivered us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4118"><span id="lf0610_label_5222">15</span> And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_115" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5223">7</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4119"><span id="lf0610_label_5224">1</span> Then said the high priest, Are these things so?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4120"><span id="lf0610_label_5225">2</span> And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4121"><span id="lf0610_label_5226">3</span> And said unto him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1130" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1130_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Get thee out of thy <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>146<span class="bracket">]</span></span> country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4122"><span id="lf0610_label_5228">4</span> Then came he out of the land of the Chald&#xE6;ans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4123"><span id="lf0610_label_5229">5</span> And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not <span class="ital">so much as</span> to set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when <span class="ital">as yet</span> he had no child.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4124"><span id="lf0610_label_5230">6</span> And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat <span class="ital">them</span> evil four hundred years.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4125"><span id="lf0610_label_5231">7</span> And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4126"><span id="lf0610_label_5232">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1131" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1131_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1132" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1132_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and so <span class="ital">Abraham</span> begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1133" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1133_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and Isaac <span class="ital">begat</span> Jacob; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1134" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1134_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and Jacob <span class="ital">begat</span> the twelve patriarchs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4127"><span id="lf0610_label_5237">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1135" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1135_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4128"><span id="lf0610_label_5239">10</span> And delivered him out of all his afflictions, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1136" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1136_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4129"><span id="lf0610_label_5241">11</span> Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4130"><span id="lf0610_label_5242">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1137" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1137_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4131"><span id="lf0610_label_5244">13</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1138" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1138_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And at the second <span class="ital">time</span> Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph&#x2019;s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4132"><span id="lf0610_label_5246">14</span> Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob to <span class="ital">him,</span> and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4133"><span id="lf0610_label_5247">15</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1139" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1139_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>So Jacob went down into Egypt, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1140" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1140_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and died, he, and our fathers,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4134"><span id="lf0610_label_5250">16</span> And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor <span class="ital">the father</span> of Sychem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4135"><span id="lf0610_label_5251">17</span> But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4136"><span id="lf0610_label_5252">18</span> Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4137"><span id="lf0610_label_5253">19</span> The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4138"><span id="lf0610_label_5254">20</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1141" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1141_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>In which time Moses was born, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1142" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1142_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>was <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1143" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1143_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father&#x2019;s house three months:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4139"><span id="lf0610_label_5258">21</span> And when he was cast out, Pharaoh&#x2019;s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4140"><span id="lf0610_label_5259">22</span> And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4141"><span id="lf0610_label_5260">23</span> And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4142"><span id="lf0610_label_5261">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1144" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1144_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And seeing one <span class="ital">of them</span> suffer wrong, he defended <span class="ital">him,</span> and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4143"><span id="lf0610_label_5263">25</span> For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4144"><span id="lf0610_label_5264">26</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1145" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1145_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4145"><span id="lf0610_label_5266">27</span> But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4146"><span id="lf0610_label_5267">28</span> Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4147"><span id="lf0610_label_5268">29</span> Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>147<span class="bracket">]</span></span> stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4148"><span id="lf0610_label_5269">30</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1146" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1146_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4149"><span id="lf0610_label_5271">31</span> When Moses saw <span class="ital">it,</span> he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold <span class="ital">it,</span> the voice of the Lord came unto him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4150"><span id="lf0610_label_5272">32</span> <span class="ital">Saying,</span> I <span class="ital">am</span> the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4151"><span id="lf0610_label_5273">33</span> Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4152"><span id="lf0610_label_5274">34</span> I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4153"><span id="lf0610_label_5275">35</span> This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? the same did God send <span class="ital">to be</span> a ruler and a deliverer by the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1147" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1147_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4154"><span id="lf0610_label_5277">36</span> He brought them out, after that he had <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1148" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1148_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1149" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1149_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and in the wilderness forty years.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4155"><span id="lf0610_label_5280">37</span> &#xB6; This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1150" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1150_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1151" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1151_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>like unto me; him shall ye hear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4156"><span id="lf0610_label_5283">38</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1152" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1152_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina, and <span class="ital">with</span> our fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4157"><span id="lf0610_label_5285">39</span> To whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust <span class="ital">him</span> from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4158"><span id="lf0610_label_5286">40</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1153" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1153_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: for <span class="ital">as for</span> this Moses, which brought us out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4159"><span id="lf0610_label_5288">41</span> And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4160"><span id="lf0610_label_5289">42</span> Then God turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1154" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1154_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices <span class="ital">by the space of</span> forty years in the wilderness?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4161"><span id="lf0610_label_5291">43</span> Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them: and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4162"><span id="lf0610_label_5292">44</span> Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1155" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1155_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.</p>
