<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4163"><span id="lf0610_label_5294">45</span> Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4164"><span id="lf0610_label_5295">46</span> Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4165"><span id="lf0610_label_5296">47</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1156" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1156_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But Solomon built him an house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4166"><span id="lf0610_label_5298">48</span> Howbeit <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1157" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1157_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4167"><span id="lf0610_label_5300">49</span> Heaven <span class="ital">is</span> my throne, and earth <span class="ital">is</span> my footstool: what house will ye build me? saith the Lord: or what <span class="ital">is</span> the place of my rest?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4168"><span id="lf0610_label_5301">50</span> Hath not my hand made all these things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4169"><span id="lf0610_label_5302">51</span> &#xB6; Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers <span class="ital">did,</span> so <span class="ital">do</span> ye.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4170"><span id="lf0610_label_5303">52</span> Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4171"><span id="lf0610_label_5304">53</span> Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4172"><span id="lf0610_label_5305">54</span> &#xB6; When they heard these things, they were <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>148<span class="bracket">]</span></span> cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with <span class="ital">their</span> teeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4173"><span id="lf0610_label_5306">55</span> But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4174"><span id="lf0610_label_5307">56</span> And said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4175"><span id="lf0610_label_5308">57</span> Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4176"><span id="lf0610_label_5309">58</span> And cast <span class="ital">him</span> out of the city, and stoned <span class="ital">him:</span> and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man&#x2019;s feet, whose name was Saul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4177"><span id="lf0610_label_5310">59</span> And they stoned Stephen, calling upon <span class="ital">God,</span> and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4178"><span id="lf0610_label_5311">60</span> And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_116" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5312">8</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4179"><span id="lf0610_label_5313">1</span> And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Jud&#xE6;a and Samaria, except the apostles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4180"><span id="lf0610_label_5314">2</span> And devout men carried Stephen <span class="ital">to his burial,</span> and made great lamentation over him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4181"><span id="lf0610_label_5315">3</span> As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed <span class="ital">them</span> to prison.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4182"><span id="lf0610_label_5316">4</span> Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4183"><span id="lf0610_label_5317">5</span> Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4184"><span id="lf0610_label_5318">6</span> And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4185"><span id="lf0610_label_5319">7</span> For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed <span class="ital">with them:</span> and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4186"><span id="lf0610_label_5320">8</span> And there was great joy in that city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4187"><span id="lf0610_label_5321">9</span> But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4188"><span id="lf0610_label_5322">10</span> To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4189"><span id="lf0610_label_5323">11</span> And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4190"><span id="lf0610_label_5324">12</span> But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4191"><span id="lf0610_label_5325">13</span> Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4192"><span id="lf0610_label_5326">14</span> Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4193"><span id="lf0610_label_5327">15</span> Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4194"><span id="lf0610_label_5328">16</span> (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4195"><span id="lf0610_label_5329">17</span> Then laid they <span class="ital">their</span> hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4196"><span id="lf0610_label_5330">18</span> And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles&#x2019; hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4197"><span id="lf0610_label_5331">19</span> Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4198"><span id="lf0610_label_5332">20</span> But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4199"><span id="lf0610_label_5333">21</span> Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>149<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4200"><span id="lf0610_label_5334">22</span> Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4201"><span id="lf0610_label_5335">23</span> For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and <span class="ital">in</span> the bond of iniquity.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4202"><span id="lf0610_label_5336">24</span> Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4203"><span id="lf0610_label_5337">25</span> And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritaus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4204"><span id="lf0610_label_5338">26</span> And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4205"><span id="lf0610_label_5339">27</span> And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4206"><span id="lf0610_label_5340">28</span> Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4207"><span id="lf0610_label_5341">29</span> Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4208"><span id="lf0610_label_5342">30</span> And Philip ran thither to <span class="ital">him,</span> and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4209"><span id="lf0610_label_5343">31</span> And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4210"><span id="lf0610_label_5344">32</span> The place of the scripture which he read was this, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1158" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1158_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1159" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1159_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4211"><span id="lf0610_label_5347">33</span> In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4212"><span id="lf0610_label_5348">34</span> And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4213"><span id="lf0610_label_5349">35</span> Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4214"><span id="lf0610_label_5350">36</span> And as they went on <span class="ital">their</span> way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, <span class="ital">here is</span> water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4215"><span id="lf0610_label_5351">37</span> And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4216"><span id="lf0610_label_5352">38</span> And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4217"><span id="lf0610_label_5353">39</span> And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4218"><span id="lf0610_label_5354">40</span> But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to C&#xE6;sarea.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_117" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5355">9</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4219"><span id="lf0610_label_5356">1</span> And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4220"><span id="lf0610_label_5357">2</span> And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4221"><span id="lf0610_label_5358">3</span> And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4222"><span id="lf0610_label_5359">4</span> And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4223"><span id="lf0610_label_5360">5</span> And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: <span class="ital">it is</span> hard for thee to kick against the pricks.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4224"><span id="lf0610_label_5361">6</span> And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lord <span class="ital">said</span> unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4225"><span id="lf0610_label_5362">7</span> And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>150<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4226"><span id="lf0610_label_5363">8</span> And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought <span class="ital">him</span> into Damascus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4227"><span id="lf0610_label_5364">9</span> And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4228"><span id="lf0610_label_5365">10</span> &#xB6; And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I <span class="ital">am here,</span> Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4229"><span id="lf0610_label_5366">11</span> And the Lord <span class="ital">said</span> unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and enquire in the house of Judas for <span class="ital">one</span> called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4230"><span id="lf0610_label_5367">12</span> And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and putting <span class="ital">his</span> hand on him, that he might receive his sight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4231"><span id="lf0610_label_5368">13</span> Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4232"><span id="lf0610_label_5369">14</span> And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4233"><span id="lf0610_label_5370">15</span> But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4234"><span id="lf0610_label_5371">16</span> For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name&#x2019;s sake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4235"><span id="lf0610_label_5372">17</span> And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, <span class="ital">even</span> Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4236"><span id="lf0610_label_5373">18</span> And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4237"><span id="lf0610_label_5374">19</span> And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4238"><span id="lf0610_label_5375">20</span> And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4239"><span id="lf0610_label_5376">21</span> But all that heard <span class="ital">him</span> were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4240"><span id="lf0610_label_5377">22</span> But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4241"><span id="lf0610_label_5378">23</span> &#xB6; And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4242"><span id="lf0610_label_5379">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1160" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1160_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4243"><span id="lf0610_label_5381">25</span> Then the disciples took him by night, and let <span class="ital">him</span> down by the wall in a basket.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4244"><span id="lf0610_label_5382">26</span> And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4245"><span id="lf0610_label_5383">27</span> But Barnabas took him, and brought <span class="ital">him</span> to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4246"><span id="lf0610_label_5384">28</span> And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4247"><span id="lf0610_label_5385">29</span> And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4248"><span id="lf0610_label_5386">30</span> <span class="ital">Which</span> when the brethren knew, they brought him down to C&#xE6;sarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4249"><span id="lf0610_label_5387">31</span> Then had the churches rest throughout all Jud&#xE6;a and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4250"><span id="lf0610_label_5388">32</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all <span class="ital">quarters,</span> he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4251"><span id="lf0610_label_5389">33</span> And there he found a certain man named &#xC6;neas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>151<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4252"><span id="lf0610_label_5390">34</span> And Peter said unto him, &#xC6;neas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4253"><span id="lf0610_label_5391">35</span> And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4254"><span id="lf0610_label_5392">36</span> &#xB6; Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4255"><span id="lf0610_label_5393">37</span> And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid <span class="ital">her</span> in an upper chamber.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4256"><span id="lf0610_label_5394">38</span> And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring <span class="ital">him</span> that he would not <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1161" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1161_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>delay to come to them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4257"><span id="lf0610_label_5396">39</span> Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4258"><span id="lf0610_label_5397">40</span> But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning <span class="ital">him</span> to the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4259"><span id="lf0610_label_5398">41</span> And he gave her <span class="ital">his</span> hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4260"><span id="lf0610_label_5399">42</span> And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4261"><span id="lf0610_label_5400">43</span> And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_118" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5401">10</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4262"><span id="lf0610_label_5402">1</span> There was a certain man in C&#xE6;sarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian <span class="ital">band,</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4263"><span id="lf0610_label_5403">2</span> <span class="ital">A</span> devout <span class="ital">man,</span> and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4264"><span id="lf0610_label_5404">3</span> He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4265"><span id="lf0610_label_5405">4</span> And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4266"><span id="lf0610_label_5406">5</span> And now send men to Joppa, and call for <span class="ital">one</span> Simon, whose surname is Peter:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4267"><span id="lf0610_label_5407">6</span> He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4268"><span id="lf0610_label_5408">7</span> And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4269"><span id="lf0610_label_5409">8</span> And when he had declared all <span class="ital">these</span> things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4270"><span id="lf0610_label_5410">9</span> &#xB6; On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1162" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1162_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>housetop to pray about the sixth hour:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4271"><span id="lf0610_label_5412">10</span> And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4272"><span id="lf0610_label_5413">11</span> And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4273"><span id="lf0610_label_5414">12</span> Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4274"><span id="lf0610_label_5415">13</span> And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4275"><span id="lf0610_label_5416">14</span> But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4276"><span id="lf0610_label_5417">15</span> And the voice <span class="ital">spake</span> unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, <span class="ital">that</span> call not thou common.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4277"><span id="lf0610_label_5418">16</span> This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>152<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4278"><span id="lf0610_label_5419">17</span> Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon&#x2019;s house, and stood before the gate,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4279"><span id="lf0610_label_5420">18</span> And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4280"><span id="lf0610_label_5421">19</span> &#xB6; While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4281"><span id="lf0610_label_5422">20</span> Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4282"><span id="lf0610_label_5423">21</span> Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what <span class="ital">is</span> the cause wherefore ye are come?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4283"><span id="lf0610_label_5424">22</span> And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4284"><span id="lf0610_label_5425">23</span> Then called he them in, and lodged <span class="ital">them.</span> And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4285"><span id="lf0610_label_5426">24</span> And the morrow after they entered into C&#xE6;sarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4286"><span id="lf0610_label_5427">25</span> And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4287"><span id="lf0610_label_5428">26</span> But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4288"><span id="lf0610_label_5429">27</span> And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4289"><span id="lf0610_label_5430">28</span> And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4290"><span id="lf0610_label_5431">29</span> Therefore came I <span class="ital">unto you</span> without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4291"><span id="lf0610_label_5432">30</span> And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4292"><span id="lf0610_label_5433">31</span> And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4293"><span id="lf0610_label_5434">32</span> Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of <span class="ital">one</span> Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4294"><span id="lf0610_label_5435">33</span> Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4295"><span id="lf0610_label_5436">34</span> &#xB6; Then Peter opened <span class="ital">his</span> mouth, and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1163" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1163_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4296"><span id="lf0610_label_5438">35</span> But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4297"><span id="lf0610_label_5439">36</span> The word which <span class="ital">God</span> sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4298"><span id="lf0610_label_5440">37</span> That word, <span class="ital">I say,</span> ye know, which was published throughout all Jud&#xE6;a, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4299"><span id="lf0610_label_5441">38</span> How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4300"><span id="lf0610_label_5442">39</span> And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4301"><span id="lf0610_label_5443">40</span> Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4302"><span id="lf0610_label_5444">41</span> Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, <span class="ital">even</span> to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4303"><span id="lf0610_label_5445">42</span> And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God <span class="ital">to be</span> the Judge of quick and dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4304"><span id="lf0610_label_5446">43</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1164" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1164_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>To him give all the prophets witness, that <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>153<span class="bracket">]</span></span> through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4305"><span id="lf0610_label_5448">44</span> &#xB6; While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4306"><span id="lf0610_label_5449">45</span> And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4307"><span id="lf0610_label_5450">46</span> For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4308"><span id="lf0610_label_5451">47</span> Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4309"><span id="lf0610_label_5452">48</span> And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_119" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5453">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4310"><span id="lf0610_label_5454">1</span> And the apostles and brethren that were in Jud&#xE6;a heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4311"><span id="lf0610_label_5455">2</span> And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4312"><span id="lf0610_label_5456">3</span> Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4313"><span id="lf0610_label_5457">4</span> But Peter rehearsed <span class="ital">the matter</span> from the beginning, and expounded <span class="ital">it</span> by order unto them, saying,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4314"><span id="lf0610_label_5458">5</span> I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4315"><span id="lf0610_label_5459">6</span> Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4316"><span id="lf0610_label_5460">7</span> And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4317"><span id="lf0610_label_5461">8</span> But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4318"><span id="lf0610_label_5462">9</span> But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, <span class="ital">that</span> call not thou common.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4319"><span id="lf0610_label_5463">10</span> And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4320"><span id="lf0610_label_5464">11</span> And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from C&#xE6;sarea unto me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4321"><span id="lf0610_label_5465">12</span> And the spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man&#x2019;s house:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4322"><span id="lf0610_label_5466">13</span> And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4323"><span id="lf0610_label_5467">14</span> Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4324"><span id="lf0610_label_5468">15</span> And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1165" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1165_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>as on us at the beginning.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4325"><span id="lf0610_label_5470">16</span> Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1166" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1166_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4326"><span id="lf0610_label_5472">17</span> Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as <span class="ital">he did</span> unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4327"><span id="lf0610_label_5473">18</span> When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4328"><span id="lf0610_label_5474">19</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1167" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1167_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4329"><span id="lf0610_label_5476">20</span> And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4330"><span id="lf0610_label_5477">21</span> And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4331"><span id="lf0610_label_5478">22</span> &#xB6; Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>154<span class="bracket">]</span></span> they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4332"><span id="lf0610_label_5479">23</span> Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4333"><span id="lf0610_label_5480">24</span> For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4334"><span id="lf0610_label_5481">25</span> Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4335"><span id="lf0610_label_5482">26</span> And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1168" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1168_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4336"><span id="lf0610_label_5484">27</span> &#xB6; And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4337"><span id="lf0610_label_5485">28</span> And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius C&#xE6;sar.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4338"><span id="lf0610_label_5486">29</span> Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Jud&#xE6;a:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4339"><span id="lf0610_label_5487">30</span> Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_120" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5488">12</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4340"><span id="lf0610_label_5489">1</span> Now about that time Herod the king <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1169" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1169_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>stretched forth <span class="ital">his</span> hands to vex certain of the church.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4341"><span id="lf0610_label_5491">2</span> And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4342"><span id="lf0610_label_5492">3</span> And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4343"><span id="lf0610_label_5493">4</span> And when he had apprehended him, he put <span class="ital">him</span> in prison, and delivered <span class="ital">him</span> to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4344"><span id="lf0610_label_5494">5</span> Peter therefore was kept in prison: but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1170" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1170_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4345"><span id="lf0610_label_5496">6</span> And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4346"><span id="lf0610_label_5497">7</span> And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon <span class="ital">him,</span> and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from <span class="ital">his</span> hands.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4347"><span id="lf0610_label_5498">8</span> And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4348"><span id="lf0610_label_5499">9</span> And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4349"><span id="lf0610_label_5500">10</span> When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4350"><span id="lf0610_label_5501">11</span> And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and <span class="ital">from</span> all the expectation of the people of the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4351"><span id="lf0610_label_5502">12</span> And when he had considered <span class="ital">the thing,</span> he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4352"><span id="lf0610_label_5503">13</span> And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1171" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1171_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>to hearken, named Rhoda.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4353"><span id="lf0610_label_5505">14</span> And when she knew Peter&#x2019;s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4354"><span id="lf0610_label_5506">15</span> And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4355"><span id="lf0610_label_5507">16</span> But Peter continued knocking: and when they <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>155<span class="bracket">]</span></span> had opened <span class="ital">the door,</span> and saw him, they were astonished.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4356"><span id="lf0610_label_5508">17</span> But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4357"><span id="lf0610_label_5509">18</span> Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4358"><span id="lf0610_label_5510">19</span> And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that <span class="ital">they</span> should be put to death. And he went down from Jud&#xE6;a to C&#xE6;sarea, and <span class="ital">there</span> abode.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4359"><span id="lf0610_label_5511">20</span> &#xB6; And Herod <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1172" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1172_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1173" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1173_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>the king&#x2019;s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king&#x2019;s <span class="ital">country.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4360"><span id="lf0610_label_5514">21</span> And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4361"><span id="lf0610_label_5515">22</span> And the people gave a shout, <span class="ital">saying, It is</span> the voice of a god, and not of a man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4362"><span id="lf0610_label_5516">23</span> And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4363"><span id="lf0610_label_5517">24</span> &#xB6; But the word of God grew and multiplied.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4364"><span id="lf0610_label_5518">25</span> And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled <span class="ital">their</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1174" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1174_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_121" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5520">13</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4365"><span id="lf0610_label_5521">1</span> Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1175" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1175_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4366"><span id="lf0610_label_5523">2</span> As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4367"><span id="lf0610_label_5524">3</span> And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid <span class="ital">their</span> hands on them, they sent <span class="ital">them</span> away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4368"><span id="lf0610_label_5525">4</span> &#xB6; So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4369"><span id="lf0610_label_5526">5</span> And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to <span class="ital">their</span> minister.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4370"><span id="lf0610_label_5527">6</span> And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name <span class="ital">was</span> Bar-jesus:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4371"><span id="lf0610_label_5528">7</span> Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4372"><span id="lf0610_label_5529">8</span> But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4373"><span id="lf0610_label_5530">9</span> Then Saul, (who also <span class="ital">is called</span> Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4374"><span id="lf0610_label_5531">10</span> And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, <span class="ital">thou</span> child of the devil, <span class="ital">thou</span> enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4375"><span id="lf0610_label_5532">11</span> And now, behold, the hand of the Lord <span class="ital">is</span> upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4376"><span id="lf0610_label_5533">12</span> Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4377"><span id="lf0610_label_5534">13</span> Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4378"><span id="lf0610_label_5535">14</span> &#xB6; But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4379"><span id="lf0610_label_5536">15</span> And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, <span class="ital">Ye</span> men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>156<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4380"><span id="lf0610_label_5537">16</span> Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with <span class="ital">his</span> hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4381"><span id="lf0610_label_5538">17</span> The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1176" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1176_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1177" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1177_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and with an high arm brought he them out of it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4382"><span id="lf0610_label_5541">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1178" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1178_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And about the time of forty years <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1179" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1179_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>suffered he their manners in the wilderness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4383"><span id="lf0610_label_5544">19</span> And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1180" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1180_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he divided their land to them by lot.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4384"><span id="lf0610_label_5546">20</span> And after that <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1181" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1181_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he gave <span class="ital">unto them</span> judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4385"><span id="lf0610_label_5548">21</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1182" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1182_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4386"><span id="lf0610_label_5550">22</span> And when he had removed him, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1183" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1183_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1184" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1184_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I have found David the <span class="ital">son</span> of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4387"><span id="lf0610_label_5553">23</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1185" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1185_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Of this man&#x2019;s seed hath God according to <span class="ital">his</span> promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4388"><span id="lf0610_label_5555">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1186" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1186_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4389"><span id="lf0610_label_5557">25</span> And as John fulfilled his course, he said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1187" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1187_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whom think ye that I am? I am not <span class="ital">he.</span> But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of <span class="ital">his</span> feet I am not worthy to loose.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4390"><span id="lf0610_label_5559">26</span> Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4391"><span id="lf0610_label_5560">27</span> For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled <span class="ital">them</span> in condemning <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4392"><span id="lf0610_label_5561">28</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1188" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1188_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And though they found no cause of death <span class="ital">in him,</span> yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4393"><span id="lf0610_label_5563">29</span> And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took <span class="ital">him</span> down from the tree, and laid <span class="ital">him</span> in a sepulchre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4394"><span id="lf0610_label_5564">30</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1189" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1189_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But God raised him from the dead:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4395"><span id="lf0610_label_5566">31</span> And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4396"><span id="lf0610_label_5567">32</span> And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4397"><span id="lf0610_label_5568">33</span> God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1190" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1190_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4398"><span id="lf0610_label_5570">34</span> And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, <span class="ital">now</span> no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1191" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1191_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I will give you the sure <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1192" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1192_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>mercies of David.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4399"><span id="lf0610_label_5573">35</span> Wherefore he saith also in another <span class="ital">psalm,</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1193" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1193_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4400"><span id="lf0610_label_5575">36</span> For David, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1194" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1194_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>after he had served his own generation by the will of God, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1195" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1195_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4401"><span id="lf0610_label_5578">37</span> But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4402"><span id="lf0610_label_5579">38</span> &#xB6; Be it known unto you therefore, men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4403"><span id="lf0610_label_5580">39</span> And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4404"><span id="lf0610_label_5581">40</span> Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1196" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1196_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>in the prophets;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4405"><span id="lf0610_label_5583">41</span> Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4406"><span id="lf0610_label_5584">42</span> And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1197" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1197_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the next sabbath.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>157<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4407"><span id="lf0610_label_5586">43</span> Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4408"><span id="lf0610_label_5587">44</span> &#xB6; And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4409"><span id="lf0610_label_5588">45</span> But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4410"><span id="lf0610_label_5589">46</span> Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4411"><span id="lf0610_label_5590">47</span> For so hath the Lord commanded us, <span class="ital">saying,</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1198" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1198_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4412"><span id="lf0610_label_5592">48</span> And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4413"><span id="lf0610_label_5593">49</span> And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4414"><span id="lf0610_label_5594">50</span> But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4415"><span id="lf0610_label_5595">51</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1199" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1199_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4416"><span id="lf0610_label_5597">52</span> And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_122" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5598">14</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4417"><span id="lf0610_label_5599">1</span> And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4418"><span id="lf0610_label_5600">2</span> But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4419"><span id="lf0610_label_5601">3</span> Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4420"><span id="lf0610_label_5602">4</span> But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4421"><span id="lf0610_label_5603">5</span> And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use <span class="ital">them</span> despitefully, and to stone them,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4422"><span id="lf0610_label_5604">6</span> They were ware of <span class="ital">it,</span> and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4423"><span id="lf0610_label_5605">7</span> And there they preached the gospel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4424"><span id="lf0610_label_5606">8</span> &#xB6; And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother&#x2019;s womb, who never had walked:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4425"><span id="lf0610_label_5607">9</span> The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4426"><span id="lf0610_label_5608">10</span> Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4427"><span id="lf0610_label_5609">11</span> And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4428"><span id="lf0610_label_5610">12</span> And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4429"><span id="lf0610_label_5611">13</span> Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4430"><span id="lf0610_label_5612">14</span> <span class="ital">Which</span> when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard <span class="ital">of,</span> they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4431"><span id="lf0610_label_5613">15</span> And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1200" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1200_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>158<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4432"><span id="lf0610_label_5615">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1201" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1201_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4433"><span id="lf0610_label_5617">17</span> Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4434"><span id="lf0610_label_5618">18</span> And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4435"><span id="lf0610_label_5619">19</span> &#xB6; And there came thither <span class="ital">certain</span> Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1202" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1202_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and, having stoned Paul, drew <span class="ital">him</span> out of the city, supposing he had been dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4436"><span id="lf0610_label_5621">20</span> Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4437"><span id="lf0610_label_5622">21</span> And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and <span class="ital">to</span> Iconium, and Antioch,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4438"><span id="lf0610_label_5623">22</span> Confirming the souls of the disciples, <span class="ital">and</span> exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4439"><span id="lf0610_label_5624">23</span> And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4440"><span id="lf0610_label_5625">24</span> And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4441"><span id="lf0610_label_5626">25</span> And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4442"><span id="lf0610_label_5627">26</span> And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4443"><span id="lf0610_label_5628">27</span> And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4444"><span id="lf0610_label_5629">28</span> And there they abode long time with the disciples.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_123" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5630">15</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4445"><span id="lf0610_label_5631">1</span> And certain men which came down from Jud&#xE6;a taught the brethren, <span class="ital">and said,</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1203" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1203_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4446"><span id="lf0610_label_5633">2</span> When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4447"><span id="lf0610_label_5634">3</span> And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4448"><span id="lf0610_label_5635">4</span> And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and <span class="ital">of</span> the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4449"><span id="lf0610_label_5636">5</span> But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command <span class="ital">them</span> to keep the law of Moses.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4450"><span id="lf0610_label_5637">6</span> &#xB6; And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4451"><span id="lf0610_label_5638">7</span> And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1204" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1204_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4452"><span id="lf0610_label_5640">8</span> And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as <span class="ital">he did</span> unto us;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4453"><span id="lf0610_label_5641">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1205" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1205_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4454"><span id="lf0610_label_5643">10</span> Now therefore why tempt ye God, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1206" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1206_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4455"><span id="lf0610_label_5645">11</span> But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>159<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4456"><span id="lf0610_label_5646">12</span> &#xB6; Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4457"><span id="lf0610_label_5647">13</span> &#xB6; And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, hearken unto me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4458"><span id="lf0610_label_5648">14</span> Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4459"><span id="lf0610_label_5649">15</span> And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4460"><span id="lf0610_label_5650">16</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1207" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1207_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4461"><span id="lf0610_label_5652">17</span> That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4462"><span id="lf0610_label_5653">18</span> Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4463"><span id="lf0610_label_5654">19</span> Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4464"><span id="lf0610_label_5655">20</span> But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and <span class="ital">from</span> fornication, and <span class="ital">from</span> things strangled, and <span class="ital">from</span> blood.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4465"><span id="lf0610_label_5656">21</span> For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4466"><span id="lf0610_label_5657">22</span> Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; <span class="ital">namely,</span> Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4467"><span id="lf0610_label_5658">23</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1208" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1208_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>they wrote <span class="ital">letters</span> by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren <span class="ital">send</span> greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4468"><span id="lf0610_label_5660">24</span> Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, <span class="ital">Ye must</span> be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no <span class="ital">such</span> commandment:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4469"><span id="lf0610_label_5661">25</span> It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4470"><span id="lf0610_label_5662">26</span> Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4471"><span id="lf0610_label_5663">27</span> We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell <span class="ital">you</span> the same things by mouth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4472"><span id="lf0610_label_5664">28</span> For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4473"><span id="lf0610_label_5665">29</span> That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4474"><span id="lf0610_label_5666">30</span> So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4475"><span id="lf0610_label_5667">31</span> <span class="ital">Which</span> when they had read, they rejoiced for the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1209" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1209_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>consolation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4476"><span id="lf0610_label_5669">32</span> And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4477"><span id="lf0610_label_5670">33</span> And after they had tarried <span class="ital">there</span> a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4478"><span id="lf0610_label_5671">34</span> Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4479"><span id="lf0610_label_5672">35</span> Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4480"><span id="lf0610_label_5673">36</span> &#xB6; And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, <span class="ital">and see</span> how they do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4481"><span id="lf0610_label_5674">37</span> And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4482"><span id="lf0610_label_5675">38</span> But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>160<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4483"><span id="lf0610_label_5676">39</span> And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4484"><span id="lf0610_label_5677">40</span> And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4485"><span id="lf0610_label_5678">41</span> And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_124" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5679">16</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4486"><span id="lf0610_label_5680">1</span> Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1210" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1210_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father <span class="ital">was</span> a Greek:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4487"><span id="lf0610_label_5682">2</span> Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4488"><span id="lf0610_label_5683">3</span> Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4489"><span id="lf0610_label_5684">4</span> And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1211" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1211_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4490"><span id="lf0610_label_5686">5</span> And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4491"><span id="lf0610_label_5687">6</span> Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4492"><span id="lf0610_label_5688">7</span> After they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4493"><span id="lf0610_label_5689">8</span> And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4494"><span id="lf0610_label_5690">9</span> And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4495"><span id="lf0610_label_5691">10</span> And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4496"><span id="lf0610_label_5692">11</span> Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next <span class="ital">day</span> to Neapolis;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4497"><span id="lf0610_label_5693">12</span> And from thence to Philippi, which is <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1212" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1212_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the chief city of that part of Macedonia, <span class="ital">and</span> a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4498"><span id="lf0610_label_5695">13</span> And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted <span class="ital">thither.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4499"><span id="lf0610_label_5696">14</span> &#xB6; And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard <span class="ital">us:</span> whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.</p>
