<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4500"><span id="lf0610_label_5697">15</span> And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought <span class="ital">us,</span> saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide <span class="ital">there.</span> And she constrained us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4501"><span id="lf0610_label_5698">16</span> &#xB6; And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1213" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1213_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4502"><span id="lf0610_label_5700">17</span> The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4503"><span id="lf0610_label_5701">18</span> And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4504"><span id="lf0610_label_5702">19</span> &#xB6; And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew <span class="ital">them</span> into the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1214" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1214_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>marketplace unto the rulers,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4505"><span id="lf0610_label_5704">20</span> And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4506"><span id="lf0610_label_5705">21</span> And teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4507"><span id="lf0610_label_5706">22</span> And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1215" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1215_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and commanded to beat <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4508"><span id="lf0610_label_5708">23</span> And when they had laid many stripes upon <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>161<span class="bracket">]</span></span> them, they cast <span class="ital">them</span> into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4509"><span id="lf0610_label_5709">24</span> Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4510"><span id="lf0610_label_5710">25</span> &#xB6; And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4511"><span id="lf0610_label_5711">26</span> And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one&#x2019;s bands were loosed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4512"><span id="lf0610_label_5712">27</span> And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4513"><span id="lf0610_label_5713">28</span> But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4514"><span id="lf0610_label_5714">29</span> Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4515"><span id="lf0610_label_5715">30</span> And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4516"><span id="lf0610_label_5716">31</span> And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4517"><span id="lf0610_label_5717">32</span> And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4518"><span id="lf0610_label_5718">33</span> And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed <span class="ital">their</span> stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4519"><span id="lf0610_label_5719">34</span> And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4520"><span id="lf0610_label_5720">35</span> And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4521"><span id="lf0610_label_5721">36</span> And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4522"><span id="lf0610_label_5722">37</span> But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast <span class="ital">us</span> into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4523"><span id="lf0610_label_5723">38</span> And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4524"><span id="lf0610_label_5724">39</span> And they came and besought them, and brought <span class="ital">them</span> out, and desired <span class="ital">them</span> to depart out of the city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4525"><span id="lf0610_label_5725">40</span> And they went out of the prison, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1216" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1216_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>and entered into <span class="ital">the house of</span> Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_125" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5727">17</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4526"><span id="lf0610_label_5728">1</span> Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4527"><span id="lf0610_label_5729">2</span> And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4528"><span id="lf0610_label_5730">3</span> Opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4529"><span id="lf0610_label_5731">4</span> And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4530"><span id="lf0610_label_5732">5</span> &#xB6; But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4531"><span id="lf0610_label_5733">6</span> And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4532"><span id="lf0610_label_5734">7</span> Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of C&#xE6;sar, saying that there is another king, <span class="ital">one</span> Jesus.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>162<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4533"><span id="lf0610_label_5735">8</span> And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4534"><span id="lf0610_label_5736">9</span> And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4535"><span id="lf0610_label_5737">10</span> &#xB6; And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming <span class="ital">thither</span> went into the synagogue of the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4536"><span id="lf0610_label_5738">11</span> These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4537"><span id="lf0610_label_5739">12</span> Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4538"><span id="lf0610_label_5740">13</span> But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4539"><span id="lf0610_label_5741">14</span> And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4540"><span id="lf0610_label_5742">15</span> And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4541"><span id="lf0610_label_5743">16</span> &#xB6; Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1217" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1217_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>wholly given to idolatry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4542"><span id="lf0610_label_5745">17</span> Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4543"><span id="lf0610_label_5746">18</span> Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1218" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1218_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4544"><span id="lf0610_label_5748">19</span> And they took him, and brought him unto <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1219" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1219_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, <span class="ital">is?</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4545"><span id="lf0610_label_5750">20</span> For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4546"><span id="lf0610_label_5751">21</span> (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4547"><span id="lf0610_label_5752">22</span> &#xB6; Then Paul stood in the midst of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1220" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1220_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Mars&#x2019; hill, and said, <span class="ital">Ye</span> men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4548"><span id="lf0610_label_5754">23</span> For as I passed by, and beheld your <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1221" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1221_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4549"><span id="lf0610_label_5756">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1222" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1222_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4550"><span id="lf0610_label_5758">25</span> Neither is worshipped with men&#x2019;s hands, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1223" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1223_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4551"><span id="lf0610_label_5760">26</span> And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4552"><span id="lf0610_label_5761">27</span> That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4553"><span id="lf0610_label_5762">28</span> For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4554"><span id="lf0610_label_5763">29</span> Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1224" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1224_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man&#x2019;s device.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4555"><span id="lf0610_label_5765">30</span> And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4556"><span id="lf0610_label_5766">31</span> Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by <span class="ital">that</span> man whom he hath ordained; <span class="ital">whereof</span> he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1225" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1225_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>hath given assurance unto all <span class="ital">men,</span> in that he hath raised him from the dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4557"><span id="lf0610_label_5768">32</span> &#xB6; And when they heard of the resurrection of <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>163<span class="bracket">]</span></span> the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this <span class="ital">matter.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4558"><span id="lf0610_label_5769">33</span> So Paul departed from among them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4559"><span id="lf0610_label_5770">34</span> Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which <span class="ital">was</span> Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_126" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5771">18</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4560"><span id="lf0610_label_5772">1</span> After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4561"><span id="lf0610_label_5773">2</span> And found a certain Jew named <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1226" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1226_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4562"><span id="lf0610_label_5775">3</span> And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4563"><span id="lf0610_label_5776">4</span> And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4564"><span id="lf0610_label_5777">5</span> And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1227" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1227_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>in the spirit, and testified to the Jews <span class="ital">that</span> Jesus <span class="ital">was</span> Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4565"><span id="lf0610_label_5779">6</span> And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1228" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1228_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he shook <span class="ital">his</span> raiment, and said unto them, Your blood <span class="ital">be</span> upon your own heads; I <span class="ital">am</span> clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4566"><span id="lf0610_label_5781">7</span> &#xB6; And he departed thence, and entered into a certain <span class="ital">man&#x2019;s</span> house, named Justus, <span class="ital">one</span> that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4567"><span id="lf0610_label_5782">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1229" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1229_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4568"><span id="lf0610_label_5784">9</span> Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4569"><span id="lf0610_label_5785">10</span> For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4570"><span id="lf0610_label_5786">11</span> And he <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1230" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1230_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>continued <span class="ital">there</span> a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4571"><span id="lf0610_label_5788">12</span> &#xB6; And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4572"><span id="lf0610_label_5789">13</span> Saying, This <span class="ital">fellow</span> persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4573"><span id="lf0610_label_5790">14</span> And when Paul was now about to open <span class="ital">his</span> mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O <span class="ital">ye</span> Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4574"><span id="lf0610_label_5791">15</span> But if it be a question of words and names, and <span class="ital">of</span> your law, look ye <span class="ital">to it;</span> for I will be no judge of such <span class="ital">matters.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4575"><span id="lf0610_label_5792">16</span> And he drave them from the judgment seat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4576"><span id="lf0610_label_5793">17</span> Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat <span class="ital">him</span> before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4577"><span id="lf0610_label_5794">18</span> &#xB6; And Paul <span class="ital">after-this</span> tarried <span class="ital">there</span> yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn <span class="ital">his</span> head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4578"><span id="lf0610_label_5795">19</span> And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4579"><span id="lf0610_label_5796">20</span> When they desired <span class="ital">him</span> to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4580"><span id="lf0610_label_5797">21</span> But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1231" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1231_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4581"><span id="lf0610_label_5799">22</span> And when he had landed at C&#xE6;sarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4582"><span id="lf0610_label_5800">23</span> And after he had spent some time <span class="ital">there,</span> he departed, and went over <span class="ital">all</span> the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4583"><span id="lf0610_label_5801">24</span> &#xB6; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1232" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1232_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>164<span class="bracket">]</span></span> Alexandria, an eloquent man, <span class="ital">and</span> mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4584"><span id="lf0610_label_5803">25</span> This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4585"><span id="lf0610_label_5804">26</span> And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto <span class="ital">them,</span> and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4586"><span id="lf0610_label_5805">27</span> And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4587"><span id="lf0610_label_5806">28</span> For he mightily convinced the Jews, <span class="ital">and that</span> publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_127" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5807">19</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4588"><span id="lf0610_label_5808">1</span> And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4589"><span id="lf0610_label_5809">2</span> He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4590"><span id="lf0610_label_5810">3</span> And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John&#x2019;s baptism.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4591"><span id="lf0610_label_5811">4</span> Then said Paul, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1233" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1233_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4592"><span id="lf0610_label_5813">5</span> When they heard <span class="ital">this,</span> they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4593"><span id="lf0610_label_5814">6</span> And when Paul had laid <span class="ital">his</span> hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4594"><span id="lf0610_label_5815">7</span> And all the men were about twelve.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4595"><span id="lf0610_label_5816">8</span> And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4596"><span id="lf0610_label_5817">9</span> But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4597"><span id="lf0610_label_5818">10</span> And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4598"><span id="lf0610_label_5819">11</span> And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4599"><span id="lf0610_label_5820">12</span> So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4600"><span id="lf0610_label_5821">13</span> &#xB6; Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4601"><span id="lf0610_label_5822">14</span> And there were seven sons of <span class="ital">one</span> Sceva, a Jew, <span class="ital">and</span> chief of the priests, which did so.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4602"><span id="lf0610_label_5823">15</span> And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4603"><span id="lf0610_label_5824">16</span> And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4604"><span id="lf0610_label_5825">17</span> And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4605"><span id="lf0610_label_5826">18</span> And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4606"><span id="lf0610_label_5827">19</span> Many <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1234" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1234_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all <span class="ital">men:</span> and they counted the price of them, and found <span class="ital">it</span> fifty thousand <span class="ital">pieces</span> of silver.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4607"><span id="lf0610_label_5829">20</span> So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4608"><span id="lf0610_label_5830">21</span> &#xB6; After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>165<span class="bracket">]</span></span> Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4609"><span id="lf0610_label_5831">22</span> So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4610"><span id="lf0610_label_5832">23</span> And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4611"><span id="lf0610_label_5833">24</span> For a certain <span class="ital">man</span> named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4612"><span id="lf0610_label_5834">25</span> Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4613"><span id="lf0610_label_5835">26</span> Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4614"><span id="lf0610_label_5836">27</span> So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4615"><span id="lf0610_label_5837">28</span> And when they heard <span class="ital">these sayings,</span> they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great <span class="ital">is</span> Diana of the Ephesians.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4616"><span id="lf0610_label_5838">29</span> And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul&#x2019;s companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4617"><span id="lf0610_label_5839">30</span> And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4618"><span id="lf0610_label_5840">31</span> And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring <span class="ital">him</span> that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4619"><span id="lf0610_label_5841">32</span> Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4620"><span id="lf0610_label_5842">33</span> And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4621"><span id="lf0610_label_5843">34</span> But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great <span class="ital">is</span> Diana of the Ephesians.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4622"><span id="lf0610_label_5844">35</span> And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, <span class="ital">Ye</span> men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1235" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1235_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the <span class="ital">image</span> which fell down from Jupiter?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4623"><span id="lf0610_label_5846">36</span> Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4624"><span id="lf0610_label_5847">37</span> For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4625"><span id="lf0610_label_5848">38</span> Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1236" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1236_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4626"><span id="lf0610_label_5850">39</span> But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1237" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1237_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>lawful assembly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4627"><span id="lf0610_label_5852">40</span> For we are in danger to be called in question for this day&#x2019;s uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4628"><span id="lf0610_label_5853">41</span> And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_128" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5854">20</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4629"><span id="lf0610_label_5855">1</span> And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto <span class="ital">him</span> the disciples, and embraced <span class="ital">them,</span> and departed for to go into Macedonia.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4630"><span id="lf0610_label_5856">2</span> And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4631"><span id="lf0610_label_5857">3</span> And <span class="ital">there</span> abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4632"><span id="lf0610_label_5858">4</span> And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>166<span class="bracket">]</span></span> and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4633"><span id="lf0610_label_5859">5</span> These going before tarried for us at Troas.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4634"><span id="lf0610_label_5860">6</span> And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4635"><span id="lf0610_label_5861">7</span> And upon the first <span class="ital">day</span> of the week, when the disciples came together <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1238" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1238_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4636"><span id="lf0610_label_5863">8</span> And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4637"><span id="lf0610_label_5864">9</span> And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4638"><span id="lf0610_label_5865">10</span> And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing <span class="ital">him</span> said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4639"><span id="lf0610_label_5866">11</span> When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4640"><span id="lf0610_label_5867">12</span> And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4641"><span id="lf0610_label_5868">13</span> &#xB6; And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4642"><span id="lf0610_label_5869">14</span> And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4643"><span id="lf0610_label_5870">15</span> And we sailed thence, and came the next <span class="ital">day</span> over against Chios; and the next <span class="ital">day</span> we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next <span class="ital">day</span> we came to Miletus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4644"><span id="lf0610_label_5871">16</span> For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4645"><span id="lf0610_label_5872">17</span> &#xB6; And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4646"><span id="lf0610_label_5873">18</span> And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4647"><span id="lf0610_label_5874">19</span> Serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4648"><span id="lf0610_label_5875">20</span> <span class="ital">And</span> how I kept back nothing that was profitable <span class="ital">unto you,</span> but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4649"><span id="lf0610_label_5876">21</span> Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4650"><span id="lf0610_label_5877">22</span> And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4651"><span id="lf0610_label_5878">23</span> Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1239" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1239_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>abide me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4652"><span id="lf0610_label_5880">24</span> But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4653"><span id="lf0610_label_5881">25</span> And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4654"><span id="lf0610_label_5882">26</span> Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I <span class="ital">am</span> pure from the blood of all <span class="ital">men.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4655"><span id="lf0610_label_5883">27</span> For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4656"><span id="lf0610_label_5884">28</span> &#xB6; Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4657"><span id="lf0610_label_5885">29</span> For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4658"><span id="lf0610_label_5886">30</span> Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4659"><span id="lf0610_label_5887">31</span> Therefore watch, and remember, that by the <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>167<span class="bracket">]</span></span> space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4660"><span id="lf0610_label_5888">32</span> And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4661"><span id="lf0610_label_5889">33</span> I have coveted no man&#x2019;s silver, or gold, or apparel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4662"><span id="lf0610_label_5890">34</span> Yea, ye yourselves know, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1240" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1240_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4663"><span id="lf0610_label_5892">35</span> I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4664"><span id="lf0610_label_5893">36</span> &#xB6; And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4665"><span id="lf0610_label_5894">37</span> And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul&#x2019;s neck, and kissed him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4666"><span id="lf0610_label_5895">38</span> Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_129" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5896">21</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4667"><span id="lf0610_label_5897">1</span> And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the <span class="ital">day</span> following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4668"><span id="lf0610_label_5898">2</span> And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4669"><span id="lf0610_label_5899">3</span> Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and lauded at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4670"><span id="lf0610_label_5900">4</span> And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4671"><span id="lf0610_label_5901">5</span> And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till <span class="ital">we were</span> out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4672"><span id="lf0610_label_5902">6</span> And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4673"><span id="lf0610_label_5903">7</span> And when we had finished <span class="ital">our</span> course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4674"><span id="lf0610_label_5904">8</span> And the next <span class="ital">day</span> we that were of Paul&#x2019;s company departed, and came unto C&#xE6;sarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1241" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1241_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>which was <span class="ital">one</span> of the seven; and abode with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4675"><span id="lf0610_label_5906">9</span> And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4676"><span id="lf0610_label_5907">10</span> And as we tarried <span class="ital">there</span> many days, there came down from Jud&#xE6;a a certain prophet, named Agabus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4677"><span id="lf0610_label_5908">11</span> And when he was come unto us, he took Paul&#x2019;s girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver <span class="ital">him</span> into the hands of the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4678"><span id="lf0610_label_5909">12</span> And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4679"><span id="lf0610_label_5910">13</span> Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4680"><span id="lf0610_label_5911">14</span> And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4681"><span id="lf0610_label_5912">15</span> And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4682"><span id="lf0610_label_5913">16</span> There went with us also <span class="ital">certain</span> of the disciples of C&#xE6;sarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4683"><span id="lf0610_label_5914">17</span> And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4684"><span id="lf0610_label_5915">18</span> And the <span class="ital">day</span> following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4685"><span id="lf0610_label_5916">19</span> And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4686"><span id="lf0610_label_5917">20</span> And when they heard <span class="ital">it,</span> they glorified the Lord, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>168<span class="bracket">]</span></span> and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4687"><span id="lf0610_label_5918">21</span> And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise <span class="ital">their</span> children, neither to walk after the customs.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4688"><span id="lf0610_label_5919">22</span> What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4689"><span id="lf0610_label_5920">23</span> Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4690"><span id="lf0610_label_5921">24</span> Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1242" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1242_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>shave <span class="ital">their</span> heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but <span class="ital">that</span> thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4691"><span id="lf0610_label_5923">25</span> As touching the Gentiles which believe, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1243" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1243_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>we have written <span class="ital">and</span> concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from <span class="ital">things</span> offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4692"><span id="lf0610_label_5925">26</span> Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1244" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1244_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4693"><span id="lf0610_label_5927">27</span> And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4694"><span id="lf0610_label_5928">28</span> Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all <span class="ital">men</span> every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4695"><span id="lf0610_label_5929">29</span> (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4696"><span id="lf0610_label_5930">30</span> And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4697"><span id="lf0610_label_5931">31</span> And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4698"><span id="lf0610_label_5932">32</span> Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4699"><span id="lf0610_label_5933">33</span> Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded <span class="ital">him</span> to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4700"><span id="lf0610_label_5934">34</span> And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4701"><span id="lf0610_label_5935">35</span> And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4702"><span id="lf0610_label_5936">36</span> For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4703"><span id="lf0610_label_5937">37</span> And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4704"><span id="lf0610_label_5938">38</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1245" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1245_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4705"><span id="lf0610_label_5940">39</span> But Paul said, I am a man <span class="ital">which am</span> a Jew of Tarsus, <span class="ital">a city</span> in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city; and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4706"><span id="lf0610_label_5941">40</span> And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto <span class="ital">them</span> in the Hebrew tongue, saying,</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_130" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5942">22</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4707"><span id="lf0610_label_5943">1</span> Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence <span class="ital">which I make</span> now unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4708"><span id="lf0610_label_5944">2</span> (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4709"><span id="lf0610_label_5945">3</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1246" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1246_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am verily a man <span class="ital">which am</span> a Jew, born in Tarsus, <span class="ital">a city</span> in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, <span class="ital">and</span> taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4710"><span id="lf0610_label_5947">4</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1247" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1247_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4711"><span id="lf0610_label_5949">5</span> As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4712"><span id="lf0610_label_5950">6</span> And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4713"><span id="lf0610_label_5951">7</span> And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4714"><span id="lf0610_label_5952">8</span> And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4715"><span id="lf0610_label_5953">9</span> And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4716"><span id="lf0610_label_5954">10</span> And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4717"><span id="lf0610_label_5955">11</span> And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4718"><span id="lf0610_label_5956">12</span> And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt <span class="ital">there,</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4719"><span id="lf0610_label_5957">13</span> Came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4720"><span id="lf0610_label_5958">14</span> And he said, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4721"><span id="lf0610_label_5959">15</span> For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4722"><span id="lf0610_label_5960">16</span> And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4723"><span id="lf0610_label_5961">17</span> And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4724"><span id="lf0610_label_5962">18</span> And saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4725"><span id="lf0610_label_5963">19</span> And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4726"><span id="lf0610_label_5964">20</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1248" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1248_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4727"><span id="lf0610_label_5966">21</span> And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4728"><span id="lf0610_label_5967">22</span> And they gave him audience unto this word, and <span class="ital">then</span> lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a <span class="ital">fellow</span> from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4729"><span id="lf0610_label_5968">23</span> And as they cried out, and cast off <span class="ital">their</span> clothes, and threw dust into the air,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4730"><span id="lf0610_label_5969">24</span> The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4731"><span id="lf0610_label_5970">25</span> And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>170<span class="bracket">]</span></span> for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4732"><span id="lf0610_label_5971">26</span> When the centurion heard <span class="ital">that,</span> he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4733"><span id="lf0610_label_5972">27</span> Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4734"><span id="lf0610_label_5973">28</span> And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was <span class="ital">free</span> born.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4735"><span id="lf0610_label_5974">29</span> Then straightway they departed from him which should have <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1249" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1249_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4736"><span id="lf0610_label_5976">30</span> On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from <span class="ital">his</span> bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_131" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_5977">23</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4737"><span id="lf0610_label_5978">1</span> And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4738"><span id="lf0610_label_5979">2</span> And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4739"><span id="lf0610_label_5980">3</span> Then <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1250" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1250_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, <span class="ital">thou</span> whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4740"><span id="lf0610_label_5982">4</span> And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God&#x2019;s high priest?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4741"><span id="lf0610_label_5983">5</span> Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1251" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1251_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4742"><span id="lf0610_label_5985">6</span> But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1252" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1252_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1253" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1253_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4743"><span id="lf0610_label_5988">7</span> And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees: and the multitude was divided.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4744"><span id="lf0610_label_5989">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1254" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1254_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4745"><span id="lf0610_label_5991">9</span> And there arose a great cry: and the scribes <span class="ital">that were</span> of the Pharisees&#x2019; part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4746"><span id="lf0610_label_5992">10</span> And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring <span class="ital">him</span> into the castle.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4747"><span id="lf0610_label_5993">11</span> And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4748"><span id="lf0610_label_5994">12</span> And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1255" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1255_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4749"><span id="lf0610_label_5996">13</span> And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4750"><span id="lf0610_label_5997">14</span> And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4751"><span id="lf0610_label_5998">15</span> Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4752"><span id="lf0610_label_5999">16</span> And when Paul&#x2019;s sister&#x2019;s son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4753"><span id="lf0610_label_6000">17</span> Then Paul called one of the centurions unto <span class="ital">him,</span> and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>171<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4754"><span id="lf0610_label_6001">18</span> So he took him, and brought <span class="ital">him</span> to the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me unto <span class="ital">him,</span> and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4755"><span id="lf0610_label_6002">19</span> Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went <span class="ital">with him</span> aside privately, and asked <span class="ital">him,</span> What is that thou hast to tell me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4756"><span id="lf0610_label_6003">20</span> And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4757"><span id="lf0610_label_6004">21</span> But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4758"><span id="lf0610_label_6005">22</span> So the chief captain <span class="ital">then</span> let the young man depart, and charged <span class="ital">him, See thou</span> tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4759"><span id="lf0610_label_6006">23</span> And he called unto <span class="ital">him</span> two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to C&#xE6;sarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4760"><span id="lf0610_label_6007">24</span> And provide <span class="ital">them</span> beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring <span class="ital">him</span> safe unto Felix the governor.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4761"><span id="lf0610_label_6008">25</span> And he wrote a letter after this manner:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4762"><span id="lf0610_label_6009">26</span> Clandius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix <span class="ital">sendeth</span> greeting.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4763"><span id="lf0610_label_6010">27</span> This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4764"><span id="lf0610_label_6011">28</span> And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4765"><span id="lf0610_label_6012">29</span> Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4766"><span id="lf0610_label_6013">30</span> And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what <span class="ital">they had</span> against him. Farewell.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4767"><span id="lf0610_label_6014">31</span> Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought <span class="ital">him</span> by night to Antipatris.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4768"><span id="lf0610_label_6015">32</span> On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4769"><span id="lf0610_label_6016">33</span> Whe, when they came to C&#xE6;sarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4770"><span id="lf0610_label_6017">34</span> And when the governor had read <span class="ital">the letter,</span> he asked of what province he was. And when he understood that <span class="ital">he was</span> of Cilicia;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4771"><span id="lf0610_label_6018">35</span> I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod&#x2019;s judgment hall.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_132" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6019">24</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4772"><span id="lf0610_label_6020">1</span> And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, and <span class="ital">with</span> a certain orator <span class="ital">named</span> Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4773"><span id="lf0610_label_6021">2</span> And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse <span class="ital">him,</span> saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4774"><span id="lf0610_label_6022">3</span> We accept <span class="ital">it</span> always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4775"><span id="lf0610_label_6023">4</span> Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4776"><span id="lf0610_label_6024">5</span> For we have found this man <span class="ital">a</span> pestilent <span class="ital">fellow,</span> and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4777"><span id="lf0610_label_6025">6</span> Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4778"><span id="lf0610_label_6026">7</span> But the chief captain Lysias came <span class="ital">upon us,</span> and with great violence took <span class="ital">him</span> away out of our hands,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4779"><span id="lf0610_label_6027">8</span> Commanding his accusers to come unto thee: <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>172<span class="bracket">]</span></span> by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4780"><span id="lf0610_label_6028">9</span> And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4781"><span id="lf0610_label_6029">10</span> Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4782"><span id="lf0610_label_6030">11</span> Because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4783"><span id="lf0610_label_6031">12</span> And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4784"><span id="lf0610_label_6032">13</span> Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4785"><span id="lf0610_label_6033">14</span> But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1256" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1256_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>in the prophets:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4786"><span id="lf0610_label_6035">15</span> And have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4787"><span id="lf0610_label_6036">16</span> And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, and <span class="ital">toward</span> men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4788"><span id="lf0610_label_6037">17</span> Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4789"><span id="lf0610_label_6038">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1257" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1257_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4790"><span id="lf0610_label_6040">19</span> Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4791"><span id="lf0610_label_6041">20</span> Or else let these same <span class="ital">here</span> say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4792"><span id="lf0610_label_6042">21</span> Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1258" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1258_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4793"><span id="lf0610_label_6044">22</span> And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of <span class="ital">that</span> way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4794"><span id="lf0610_label_6045">23</span> And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, and to let <span class="ital">him</span> have liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4795"><span id="lf0610_label_6046">24</span> And after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4796"><span id="lf0610_label_6047">25</span> And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4797"><span id="lf0610_label_6048">26</span> He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4798"><span id="lf0610_label_6049">27</span> But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix&#x2019; room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_133" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6050">25</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4799"><span id="lf0610_label_6051">1</span> Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from C&#xE6;sarea to Jerusalem.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4800"><span id="lf0610_label_6052">2</span> Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4801"><span id="lf0610_label_6053">3</span> And desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way to kill him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4802"><span id="lf0610_label_6054">4</span> But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at C&#xE6;sarea, and that he himself would depart shortly <span class="ital">thither.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4803"><span id="lf0610_label_6055">5</span> Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with <span class="ital">me,</span> and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>173<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4804"><span id="lf0610_label_6056">6</span> And when he had tarried among them <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1259" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1259_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>more than ten days, he went down unto C&#xE6;sarea; and the next day sitting <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1260" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1260_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4805"><span id="lf0610_label_6059">7</span> And when he was come, the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4806"><span id="lf0610_label_6060">8</span> While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against C&#xE6;sar, have I offended any thing at all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4807"><span id="lf0610_label_6061">9</span> But Festus, willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4808"><span id="lf0610_label_6062">10</span> Then said Paul, I stand at C&#xE6;sar&#x2019;s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4809"><span id="lf0610_label_6063">11</span> For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them I appeal unto C&#xE6;sar.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4810"><span id="lf0610_label_6064">12</span> Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto C&#xE6;sar? unto C&#xE6;sar shalt thou go.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4811"><span id="lf0610_label_6065">13</span> And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto C&#xE6;sarea to salute Festus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4812"><span id="lf0610_label_6066">14</span> And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul&#x2019;s cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4813"><span id="lf0610_label_6067">15</span> About whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed <span class="ital">me,</span> desiring <span class="ital">to have</span> judgment against him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4814"><span id="lf0610_label_6068">16</span> To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4815"><span id="lf0610_label_6069">17</span> Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4816"><span id="lf0610_label_6070">18</span> Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4817"><span id="lf0610_label_6071">19</span> But had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one Jesus, which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4818"><span id="lf0610_label_6072">20</span> And because <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1261" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1261_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked <span class="ital">him</span> whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4819"><span id="lf0610_label_6074">21</span> But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1262" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1262_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to C&#xE6;sar.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4820"><span id="lf0610_label_6076">22</span> Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4821"><span id="lf0610_label_6077">23</span> And on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus&#x2019; commandment Paul was brought forth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4822"><span id="lf0610_label_6078">24</span> And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Jerusalem, and <span class="ital">also</span> here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4823"><span id="lf0610_label_6079">25</span> But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4824"><span id="lf0610_label_6080">26</span> Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.</p>
