<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4825"><span id="lf0610_label_6081">27</span> For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimes <span class="ital">laid</span> against him.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_134" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6082">26</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4826"><span id="lf0610_label_6083">1</span> Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4827"><span id="lf0610_label_6084">2</span> I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4828"><span id="lf0610_label_6085">3</span> Especially <span class="ital">because I know</span> thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4829"><span id="lf0610_label_6086">4</span> My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4830"><span id="lf0610_label_6087">5</span> Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4831"><span id="lf0610_label_6088">6</span> And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4832"><span id="lf0610_label_6089">7</span> Unto which <span class="ital">promise</span> our twelve tribes, instantly serving <span class="ital">God</span> day and night, hope to come. For which hope&#x2019;s sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4833"><span id="lf0610_label_6090">8</span> Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4834"><span id="lf0610_label_6091">9</span> I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4835"><span id="lf0610_label_6092">10</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1263" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1263_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against <span class="ital">them.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4836"><span id="lf0610_label_6094">11</span> And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled <span class="ital">them</span> to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted <span class="ital">them</span> even unto strange cities.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4837"><span id="lf0610_label_6095">12</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1264" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1264_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4838"><span id="lf0610_label_6097">13</span> At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4839"><span id="lf0610_label_6098">14</span> And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? <span class="ital">it is</span> hard for thee to kick against the pricks.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4840"><span id="lf0610_label_6099">15</span> And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4841"><span id="lf0610_label_6100">16</span> But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4842"><span id="lf0610_label_6101">17</span> Delivering thee from the people, and <span class="ital">from</span> the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4843"><span id="lf0610_label_6102">18</span> To open their eyes, <span class="ital">and</span> to turn <span class="ital">them</span> from darkness to light, and <span class="ital">from</span> the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4844"><span id="lf0610_label_6103">19</span> Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4845"><span id="lf0610_label_6104">20</span> But shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Jud&#xE6;a, and <span class="ital">then</span> to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4846"><span id="lf0610_label_6105">21</span> For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill <span class="ital">me.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4847"><span id="lf0610_label_6106">22</span> Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4848"><span id="lf0610_label_6107">23</span> That Christ should suffer, <span class="ital">and</span> that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4849"><span id="lf0610_label_6108">24</span> And as he thus spake for himself, Festus <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>175<span class="bracket">]</span></span> said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4850"><span id="lf0610_label_6109">25</span> But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4851"><span id="lf0610_label_6110">26</span> For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4852"><span id="lf0610_label_6111">27</span> King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4853"><span id="lf0610_label_6112">28</span> Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4854"><span id="lf0610_label_6113">29</span> And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4855"><span id="lf0610_label_6114">30</span> And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4856"><span id="lf0610_label_6115">31</span> And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4857"><span id="lf0610_label_6116">32</span> Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto C&#xE6;sar.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_135" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6117">27</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4858"><span id="lf0610_label_6118">1</span> And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto <span class="ital">one</span> named Julius, a centurion of Augustus&#x2019; band.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4859"><span id="lf0610_label_6119">2</span> And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; <span class="ital">one</span> Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4860"><span id="lf0610_label_6120">3</span> And the next <span class="ital">day</span> we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave <span class="ital">him</span> liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4861"><span id="lf0610_label_6121">4</span> And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4862"><span id="lf0610_label_6122">5</span> And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, <span class="ital">a city</span> of Lycia.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4863"><span id="lf0610_label_6123">6</span> And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4864"><span id="lf0610_label_6124">7</span> And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1265" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1265_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Crete, over against Salmone;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4865"><span id="lf0610_label_6126">8</span> And, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city <span class="ital">of</span> Lasea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4866"><span id="lf0610_label_6127">9</span> Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonished <span class="ital">them,</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4867"><span id="lf0610_label_6128">10</span> And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1266" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1266_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4868"><span id="lf0610_label_6130">11</span> Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4869"><span id="lf0610_label_6131">12</span> And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, <span class="ital">and there</span> to winter; <span class="ital">which is</span> an haven of Crete, and heth toward the south west and north west.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4870"><span id="lf0610_label_6132">13</span> And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained <span class="ital">their</span> purpose, loosing <span class="ital">thence,</span> they sailed close by Crete.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4871"><span id="lf0610_label_6133">14</span> But not long after there <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1267" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1267_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4872"><span id="lf0610_label_6135">15</span> And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let <span class="ital">her</span> drive.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4873"><span id="lf0610_label_6136">16</span> And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4874"><span id="lf0610_label_6137">17</span> Which when they had taken up, they used <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>176<span class="bracket">]</span></span> helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4875"><span id="lf0610_label_6138">18</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1268" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1268_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next <span class="ital">day</span> they lightened the ship;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4876"><span id="lf0610_label_6140">19</span> And the third <span class="ital">day</span> we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4877"><span id="lf0610_label_6141">20</span> And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on <span class="ital">us,</span> all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4878"><span id="lf0610_label_6142">21</span> But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4879"><span id="lf0610_label_6143">22</span> And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of <span class="ital">any man&#x2019;s</span> life among you, but of the ship.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4880"><span id="lf0610_label_6144">23</span> For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4881"><span id="lf0610_label_6145">24</span> Saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before C&#xE6;sar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4882"><span id="lf0610_label_6146">25</span> Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4883"><span id="lf0610_label_6147">26</span> Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4884"><span id="lf0610_label_6148">27</span> But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4885"><span id="lf0610_label_6149">28</span> And sounded, and found <span class="ital">it</span> twenty fathoms: and when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, and found <span class="ital">it</span> fifteen fathoms.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4886"><span id="lf0610_label_6150">29</span> Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4887"><span id="lf0610_label_6151">30</span> And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4888"><span id="lf0610_label_6152">31</span> Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4889"><span id="lf0610_label_6153">32</span> Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4890"><span id="lf0610_label_6154">33</span> And while the day was coming on, Paul besought <span class="ital">them</span> all to take meat, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting, having taken nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4891"><span id="lf0610_label_6155">34</span> Wherefore I pray you to take <span class="ital">some</span> meat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4892"><span id="lf0610_label_6156">35</span> And when he had thus spoken, he took bread, and gave thanks to God in presence of them all: and when he had broken <span class="ital">it,</span> he began to eat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4893"><span id="lf0610_label_6157">36</span> Then were they all of good cheer, and they also took <span class="ital">some</span> meat.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4894"><span id="lf0610_label_6158">37</span> And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4895"><span id="lf0610_label_6159">38</span> And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4896"><span id="lf0610_label_6160">39</span> And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4897"><span id="lf0610_label_6161">40</span> And when they had <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1269" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1269_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>taken up the anchors, they committed <span class="ital">themselves</span> unto the sea, and loosed the rudder bands, and hoised up the mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4898"><span id="lf0610_label_6163">41</span> And falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4899"><span id="lf0610_label_6164">42</span> And the soldiers&#x2019; counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4900"><span id="lf0610_label_6165">43</span> But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them from <span class="ital">their</span> purpose; and commanded that they which could swim should cast <span class="ital">themselves</span> first <span class="ital">into the sea,</span> and get to land:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4901"><span id="lf0610_label_6166">44</span> And the rest, some on boards, and some on <span class="ital">broken pieces</span> of the ship. And so it came to pass, that they escaped all safe to land.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_136" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6167">28</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4902"><span id="lf0610_label_6168">1</span> And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4903"><span id="lf0610_label_6169">2</span> And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4904"><span id="lf0610_label_6170">3</span> And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid <span class="ital">them</span> on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4905"><span id="lf0610_label_6171">4</span> And when the barbarians saw the <span class="ital">venomous</span> beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4906"><span id="lf0610_label_6172">5</span> And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4907"><span id="lf0610_label_6173">6</span> Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4908"><span id="lf0610_label_6174">7</span> In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4909"><span id="lf0610_label_6175">8</span> And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4910"><span id="lf0610_label_6176">9</span> So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4911"><span id="lf0610_label_6177">10</span> Who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded <span class="ital">us</span> with such things as were necessary.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4912"><span id="lf0610_label_6178">11</span> And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4913"><span id="lf0610_label_6179">12</span> And landing at Syracuse, we tarried <span class="ital">there</span> three days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4914"><span id="lf0610_label_6180">13</span> And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4915"><span id="lf0610_label_6181">14</span> Where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4916"><span id="lf0610_label_6182">15</span> And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4917"><span id="lf0610_label_6183">16</span> And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4918"><span id="lf0610_label_6184">17</span> And it came to pass, that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together: and when they were come together, he said unto them, Men <span class="ital">and</span> brethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4919"><span id="lf0610_label_6185">18</span> Who, when they had examined me, would have let <span class="ital">me</span> go, because there was no cause of death in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4920"><span id="lf0610_label_6186">19</span> But when the Jews spake against <span class="ital">it,</span> I was constrained to appeal unto C&#xE6;sar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4921"><span id="lf0610_label_6187">20</span> For this cause therefore have I called for you, to see <span class="ital">you,</span> and to speak with <span class="ital">you:</span> because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4922"><span id="lf0610_label_6188">21</span> And they said unto him, We neither received letters out of Jud&#xE6;a concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4923"><span id="lf0610_label_6189">22</span> But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4924"><span id="lf0610_label_6190">23</span> And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into <span class="ital">his</span> lodging; <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>178<span class="bracket">]</span></span> to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, and <span class="ital">out of</span> the prophets, from morning till evening.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4925"><span id="lf0610_label_6191">24</span> And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4926"><span id="lf0610_label_6192">25</span> And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4927"><span id="lf0610_label_6193">26</span> Saying, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1270" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1270_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4928"><span id="lf0610_label_6195">27</span> For the heart of this people is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes have they closed; lest they should see with <span class="ital">their</span> eyes, and hear with <span class="ital">their</span> ears, and understand with <span class="ital">their</span> heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4929"><span id="lf0610_label_6196">28</span> Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, and <span class="ital">that</span> they will hear it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4930"><span id="lf0610_label_6197">29</span> And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4931"><span id="lf0610_label_6198">30</span> And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4932"><span id="lf0610_label_6199">31</span> Preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_137" class="type-part To_The_Romans">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_017">THE EPISTLE OF PAUL THE APOSTLE TO THE ROMANS.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_138" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6200">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4933"><span id="lf0610_label_6201">1</span> <span class="csc">Paul,</span> a servant of Jesus Christ, called <span class="ital">to be</span> an apostle, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1271" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1271_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>separated unto the gospel of God,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4934"><span id="lf0610_label_6203">2</span> (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4935"><span id="lf0610_label_6204">3</span> Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4936"><span id="lf0610_label_6205">4</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1272" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1272_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>declared <span class="ital">to be</span> the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4937"><span id="lf0610_label_6207">5</span> By whom we have received grace and apostleship, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1273" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1273_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4938"><span id="lf0610_label_6209">6</span> Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4939"><span id="lf0610_label_6210">7</span> To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called <span class="ital">to be</span> saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4940"><span id="lf0610_label_6211">8</span> First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4941"><span id="lf0610_label_6212">9</span> For God is my witness, whom I serve <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1274" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1274_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4942"><span id="lf0610_label_6214">10</span> Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4943"><span id="lf0610_label_6215">11</span> For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4944"><span id="lf0610_label_6216">12</span> That is, that I may be comforted together <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1275" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1275_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4945"><span id="lf0610_label_6218">13</span> Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1276" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1276_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>among you also, even as among other Gentiles.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>179<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4946"><span id="lf0610_label_6220">14</span> I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4947"><span id="lf0610_label_6221">15</span> So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4948"><span id="lf0610_label_6222">16</span> For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4949"><span id="lf0610_label_6223">17</span> For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1277" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1277_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>The just shall live by faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4950"><span id="lf0610_label_6225">18</span> For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4951"><span id="lf0610_label_6226">19</span> Because that which may be known of God is manifest <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1278" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1278_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in them; for God hath shewed <span class="ital">it</span> unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4952"><span id="lf0610_label_6228">20</span> For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, <span class="ital">even</span> his eternal power and Godhead; <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1279" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1279_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>so that they are without excuse:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4953"><span id="lf0610_label_6230">21</span> Because that, when they knew God, they glorified <span class="ital">him</span> not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4954"><span id="lf0610_label_6231">22</span> Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4955"><span id="lf0610_label_6232">23</span> And changed the glory of the uncorruptible <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1280" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1280_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4956"><span id="lf0610_label_6234">24</span> Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4957"><span id="lf0610_label_6235">25</span> Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4958"><span id="lf0610_label_6236">26</span> For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4959"><span id="lf0610_label_6237">27</span> And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4960"><span id="lf0610_label_6238">28</span> And even as they did not like <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1281" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1281_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>to retain God in <span class="ital">their</span> knowledge, God gave them over to <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1282" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1282_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4961"><span id="lf0610_label_6241">29</span> Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4962"><span id="lf0610_label_6242">30</span> Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4963"><span id="lf0610_label_6243">31</span> Without understanding, covenantbreakers, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1283" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1283_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4964"><span id="lf0610_label_6245">32</span> Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1284" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1284_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>have pleasure in them that do them.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_139" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6247">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4965"><span id="lf0610_label_6248">1</span> Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4966"><span id="lf0610_label_6249">2</span> But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4967"><span id="lf0610_label_6250">3</span> And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4968"><span id="lf0610_label_6251">4</span> Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4969"><span id="lf0610_label_6252">5</span> But after thy hardness and impenitent heart <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1285" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1285_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>180<span class="bracket">]</span></span> of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4970"><span id="lf0610_label_6254">6</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1286" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1286_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Who will render to every man according to his deeds:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4971"><span id="lf0610_label_6256">7</span> To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4972"><span id="lf0610_label_6257">8</span> But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4973"><span id="lf0610_label_6258">9</span> Tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1287" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1287_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>Gentile;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4974"><span id="lf0610_label_6260">10</span> But glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1288" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1288_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>Gentile:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4975"><span id="lf0610_label_6262">11</span> For there is no respect of persons with God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4976"><span id="lf0610_label_6263">12</span> For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4977"><span id="lf0610_label_6264">13</span> (For not the hearers of the law <span class="ital">are</span> just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4978"><span id="lf0610_label_6265">14</span> For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4979"><span id="lf0610_label_6266">15</span> Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1289" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1289_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>their conscience also bearing witness, and <span class="ital">their</span> thoughts <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1290" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1290_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4980"><span id="lf0610_label_6269">16</span> In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4981"><span id="lf0610_label_6270">17</span> Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4982"><span id="lf0610_label_6271">18</span> And knowest <span class="ital">his</span> will, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1291" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1291_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4983"><span id="lf0610_label_6273">19</span> And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4984"><span id="lf0610_label_6274">20</span> An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4985"><span id="lf0610_label_6275">21</span> Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4986"><span id="lf0610_label_6276">22</span> Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4987"><span id="lf0610_label_6277">23</span> Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4988"><span id="lf0610_label_6278">24</span> For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1292" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1292_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>written.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4989"><span id="lf0610_label_6280">25</span> For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4990"><span id="lf0610_label_6281">26</span> Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4991"><span id="lf0610_label_6282">27</span> And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4992"><span id="lf0610_label_6283">28</span> For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither <span class="ital">is that</span> circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4993"><span id="lf0610_label_6284">29</span> But he <span class="ital">is</span> a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision <span class="ital">is that</span> of the heart, in the spirit, <span class="ital">and</span> not in the letter; whose praise <span class="ital">is</span> not of men, but of God.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_140" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6285">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4994"><span id="lf0610_label_6286">1</span> What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit <span class="ital">is there</span> of circumcision?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4995"><span id="lf0610_label_6287">2</span> Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4996"><span id="lf0610_label_6288">3</span> For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4997"><span id="lf0610_label_6289">4</span> God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar: as it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1293" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1293_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4998"><span id="lf0610_label_6291">5</span> But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>181<span class="bracket">]</span></span> of God, what shall we say? <span class="ital">Is</span> God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_4999"><span id="lf0610_label_6292">6</span> God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5000"><span id="lf0610_label_6293">7</span> For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5001"><span id="lf0610_label_6294">8</span> And not <span class="ital">rather,</span> (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5002"><span id="lf0610_label_6295">9</span> What then? are we better <span class="ital">than they?</span> No, in no wise: for we have before <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1294" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1294_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5003"><span id="lf0610_label_6297">10</span> As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5004"><span id="lf0610_label_6298">11</span> There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5005"><span id="lf0610_label_6299">12</span> They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5006"><span id="lf0610_label_6300">13</span> Their throat <span class="ital">is</span> an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps <span class="ital">is</span> under their lips:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5007"><span id="lf0610_label_6301">14</span> Whose mouth <span class="ital">is</span> full of cursing and bitterness:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5008"><span id="lf0610_label_6302">15</span> Their feet <span class="ital">are</span> swift to shed blood:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5009"><span id="lf0610_label_6303">16</span> Destruction and misery <span class="ital">are</span> in their ways:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5010"><span id="lf0610_label_6304">17</span> And the way of peace have they not known:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5011"><span id="lf0610_label_6305">18</span> There is no fear of God before their eyes.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5012"><span id="lf0610_label_6306">19</span> Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1295" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1295_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>guilty before God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5013"><span id="lf0610_label_6308">20</span> Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law <span class="ital">is</span> the knowledge of sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5014"><span id="lf0610_label_6309">21</span> But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5015"><span id="lf0610_label_6310">22</span> Even the righteousness of God <span class="ital">which is</span> by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5016"><span id="lf0610_label_6311">23</span> For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5017"><span id="lf0610_label_6312">24</span> Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1296" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1296_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>Christ Jesus:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5018"><span id="lf0610_label_6314">25</span> Whom God hath <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1297" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1297_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>set forth <span class="ital">to be</span> a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1298" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1298_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5019"><span id="lf0610_label_6317">26</span> To declare, <span class="ital">I say,</span> at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5020"><span id="lf0610_label_6318">27</span> Where <span class="ital">is</span> boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5021"><span id="lf0610_label_6319">28</span> Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5022"><span id="lf0610_label_6320">29</span> <span class="ital">Is he</span> the God of the Jews only? <span class="ital">is he</span> not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5023"><span id="lf0610_label_6321">30</span> Seeing <span class="ital">it is</span> one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5024"><span id="lf0610_label_6322">31</span> Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_141" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6323">4</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5025"><span id="lf0610_label_6324">1</span> What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, hath found?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5026"><span id="lf0610_label_6325">2</span> For if Abraham were justified by works, he hath <span class="ital">whereof</span> to glory; but not before God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5027"><span id="lf0610_label_6326">3</span> For what saith the scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5028"><span id="lf0610_label_6327">4</span> Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace, but of debt.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5029"><span id="lf0610_label_6328">5</span> But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is counted for righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5030"><span id="lf0610_label_6329">6</span> Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man, unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5031"><span id="lf0610_label_6330">7</span> <span class="ital">Saying,</span> Blessed <span class="ital">are</span> they whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>182<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5032"><span id="lf0610_label_6331">8</span> Blessed <span class="ital">is</span> the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5033"><span id="lf0610_label_6332">9</span> <span class="ital">Cometh</span> this blessedness then upon the circumcision <span class="ital">only,</span> or upon the uncircumcision also? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5034"><span id="lf0610_label_6333">10</span> How was it then reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5035"><span id="lf0610_label_6334">11</span> And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which <span class="ital">he had yet</span> being uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be not circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5036"><span id="lf0610_label_6335">12</span> And the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only, but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1299" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1299_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which <span class="ital">he had</span> being <span class="ital">yet</span> uncircumcised.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5037"><span id="lf0610_label_6337">13</span> For the promise, that he should be the heir of the world, <span class="ital">was</span> not to Abraham, or to his seed, through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5038"><span id="lf0610_label_6338">14</span> For if they which are of the law <span class="ital">be</span> heirs, faith is made void, and the promise made of none effect:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5039"><span id="lf0610_label_6339">15</span> Because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is, <span class="ital">there is</span> no transgression.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5040"><span id="lf0610_label_6340">16</span> Therefore <span class="ital">it is</span> of faith, that <span class="ital">it might be</span> by grace; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham; who is the father of us all,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5041"><span id="lf0610_label_6341">17</span> (As it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1300" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1300_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I have made thee a father of many nations,) <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1301" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1301_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>before him whom he believed, <span class="ital">even</span> God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5042"><span id="lf0610_label_6344">18</span> Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1302" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1302_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>So shall thy seed be.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5043"><span id="lf0610_label_6346">19</span> And being not weak in faith, he considered not his own body now dead, when he was about an hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sarah&#x2019;s womb:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5044"><span id="lf0610_label_6347">20</span> He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5045"><span id="lf0610_label_6348">21</span> And being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5046"><span id="lf0610_label_6349">22</span> And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5047"><span id="lf0610_label_6350">23</span> Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5048"><span id="lf0610_label_6351">24</span> But for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5049"><span id="lf0610_label_6352">25</span> Who was delivered for our offences, and was raised again for our justification.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_142" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6353">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5050"><span id="lf0610_label_6354">1</span> Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5051"><span id="lf0610_label_6355">2</span> By whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5052"><span id="lf0610_label_6356">3</span> And not only <span class="ital">so,</span> but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation worketh patience;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5053"><span id="lf0610_label_6357">4</span> And patience, experience; and experience, hope:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5054"><span id="lf0610_label_6358">5</span> And hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5055"><span id="lf0610_label_6359">6</span> For when we were yet without strength, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1303" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1303_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in due time Christ died for the ungodly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5056"><span id="lf0610_label_6361">7</span> For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5057"><span id="lf0610_label_6362">8</span> But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5058"><span id="lf0610_label_6363">9</span> Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5059"><span id="lf0610_label_6364">10</span> For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>183<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5060"><span id="lf0610_label_6365">11</span> And not only <span class="ital">so,</span> but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5061"><span id="lf0610_label_6366">12</span> Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1304" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1304_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>for that all have sinned:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5062"><span id="lf0610_label_6368">13</span> (For until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5063"><span id="lf0610_label_6369">14</span> Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam&#x2019;s transgression, who is the figure of him that was to come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5064"><span id="lf0610_label_6370">15</span> But not as the offence, so also <span class="ital">is</span> the free gift. For if through the offence of one many be dead, much more the grace of God, and the gift by grace, <span class="ital">which is</span> by one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5065"><span id="lf0610_label_6371">16</span> And not as <span class="ital">it was</span> by one that sinned, <span class="ital">so is</span> the gift: for the judgment <span class="ital">was</span> by one to condemnation, but the free gift <span class="ital">is</span> of many offences unto justification.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5066"><span id="lf0610_label_6372">17</span> For if <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1305" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1305_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>by one man&#x2019;s offence death reigned by one; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one, Jesus Christ.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5067"><span id="lf0610_label_6374">18</span> Therefore as <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1306" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1306_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>by the offence of one <span class="ital">judgment came</span> upon all men to condemnation; even so <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1307" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1307_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>by the righteousness of one <span class="ital">the free gift came</span> upon all men unto justification of life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5068"><span id="lf0610_label_6377">19</span> For as by one man&#x2019;s disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5069"><span id="lf0610_label_6378">20</span> Moreover the law entered, that the offence might abound. But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5070"><span id="lf0610_label_6379">21</span> That as sin hath reigned unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_143" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6380">6</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5071"><span id="lf0610_label_6381">1</span> What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5072"><span id="lf0610_label_6382">2</span> God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5073"><span id="lf0610_label_6383">3</span> Know ye not, that so many of us as <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1308" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1308_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5074"><span id="lf0610_label_6385">4</span> Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5075"><span id="lf0610_label_6386">5</span> For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also <span class="ital">in the likeness</span> of <span class="ital">his</span> resurrection:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5076"><span id="lf0610_label_6387">6</span> Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with <span class="ital">him,</span> that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5077"><span id="lf0610_label_6388">7</span> For he that is dead is <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1309" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1309_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>freed from sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5078"><span id="lf0610_label_6390">8</span> Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5079"><span id="lf0610_label_6391">9</span> Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5080"><span id="lf0610_label_6392">10</span> For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5081"><span id="lf0610_label_6393">11</span> Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5082"><span id="lf0610_label_6394">12</span> Let not sin <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1310" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1310_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5083"><span id="lf0610_label_6396">13</span> Neither yield ye your members <span class="ital">as</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1311" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1311_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members <span class="ital">as</span> instruments of righteousness unto God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5084"><span id="lf0610_label_6398">14</span> For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5085"><span id="lf0610_label_6399">15</span> What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5086"><span id="lf0610_label_6400">16</span> Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>184<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5087"><span id="lf0610_label_6401">17</span> But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1312" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1312_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>which was delivered you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5088"><span id="lf0610_label_6403">18</span> Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5089"><span id="lf0610_label_6404">19</span> I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5090"><span id="lf0610_label_6405">20</span> For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1313" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1313_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>from righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5091"><span id="lf0610_label_6407">21</span> What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things <span class="ital">is</span> death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5092"><span id="lf0610_label_6408">22</span> But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5093"><span id="lf0610_label_6409">23</span> For the wages of sin <span class="ital">is</span> death; but the gift of God <span class="ital">is</span> eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_144" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6410">7</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5094"><span id="lf0610_label_6411">1</span> Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5095"><span id="lf0610_label_6412">2</span> For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to <span class="ital">her</span> husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1314" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1314_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a><span class="ital">her</span> husband.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5096"><span id="lf0610_label_6414">3</span> So then if, while <span class="ital">her</span> husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5097"><span id="lf0610_label_6415">4</span> Wherefore, my brethren, ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that ye should be married to another, <span class="ital">even</span> to him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5098"><span id="lf0610_label_6416">5</span> For when we were in the flesh, the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1315" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1315_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>motions of sins, which were by the law, did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5099"><span id="lf0610_label_6418">6</span> But now we are delivered from the law, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1316" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1316_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not <span class="ital">in</span> the oldness of the letter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5100"><span id="lf0610_label_6420">7</span> What shall we say then? <span class="ital">Is</span> the law sin? God forbid. Nay, I had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1317" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1317_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>lust, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5101"><span id="lf0610_label_6422">8</span> But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin <span class="ital">was</span> dead.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5102"><span id="lf0610_label_6423">9</span> For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5103"><span id="lf0610_label_6424">10</span> And the commandment, which <span class="ital">was ordained</span> to life, I found <span class="ital">to be</span> unto death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5104"><span id="lf0610_label_6425">11</span> For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew <span class="ital">me.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5105"><span id="lf0610_label_6426">12</span> Wherefore the law <span class="ital">is</span> holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5106"><span id="lf0610_label_6427">13</span> Was <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1318" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1318_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>then that which is good made death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5107"><span id="lf0610_label_6429">14</span> For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5108"><span id="lf0610_label_6430">15</span> For that which I do I <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1319" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1319_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5109"><span id="lf0610_label_6432">16</span> If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that <span class="ital">it is</span> good.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5110"><span id="lf0610_label_6433">17</span> Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5111"><span id="lf0610_label_6434">18</span> For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; but <span class="ital">how</span> to perform that which is good I find not.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>185<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5112"><span id="lf0610_label_6435">19</span> For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5113"><span id="lf0610_label_6436">20</span> Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5114"><span id="lf0610_label_6437">21</span> I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5115"><span id="lf0610_label_6438">22</span> For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5116"><span id="lf0610_label_6439">23</span> But I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5117"><span id="lf0610_label_6440">24</span> O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1320" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1320_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the body of this death?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5118"><span id="lf0610_label_6442">25</span> I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_145" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6443">8</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5119"><span id="lf0610_label_6444">1</span> <span class="ital">There is</span> therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5120"><span id="lf0610_label_6445">2</span> For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5121"><span id="lf0610_label_6446">3</span> For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1321" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1321_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5122"><span id="lf0610_label_6448">4</span> That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5123"><span id="lf0610_label_6449">5</span> For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5124"><span id="lf0610_label_6450">6</span> For <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1322" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1322_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>to be carnally minded <span class="ital">is</span> death; but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1323" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1323_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>to be spiritually minded <span class="ital">is</span> life and peace.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5125"><span id="lf0610_label_6453">7</span> Because <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1324" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1324_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>the carnal mind <span class="ital">is</span> enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5126"><span id="lf0610_label_6455">8</span> So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5127"><span id="lf0610_label_6456">9</span> But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5128"><span id="lf0610_label_6457">10</span> And if Christ <span class="ital">be</span> in you, the body <span class="ital">is</span> dead because of sin; but the Spirit <span class="ital">is</span> life because of righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5129"><span id="lf0610_label_6458">11</span> But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1325" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1325_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5130"><span id="lf0610_label_6460">12</span> Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5131"><span id="lf0610_label_6461">13</span> For if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5132"><span id="lf0610_label_6462">14</span> For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5133"><span id="lf0610_label_6463">15</span> For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5134"><span id="lf0610_label_6464">16</span> The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5135"><span id="lf0610_label_6465">17</span> And if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with <span class="ital">him,</span> that we may be also glorified together.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5136"><span id="lf0610_label_6466">18</span> For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time <span class="ital">are</span> not worthy <span class="ital">to be compared</span> with the glory which shall be revealed in us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5137"><span id="lf0610_label_6467">19</span> For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5138"><span id="lf0610_label_6468">20</span> For the creature was made subject of vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjected <span class="ital">the same</span> in hope,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5139"><span id="lf0610_label_6469">21</span> Because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5140"><span id="lf0610_label_6470">22</span> For we know that <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1326" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1326_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5141"><span id="lf0610_label_6472">23</span> And not only <span class="ital">they,</span> but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>186<span class="bracket">]</span></span> groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, <span class="ital">to wit,</span> the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1327" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1327_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>redemption of our body.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5142"><span id="lf0610_label_6474">24</span> For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for what a man seeth, why doth he yet hope for?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5143"><span id="lf0610_label_6475">25</span> But if we hope for that we see not, <span class="ital">then</span> do we with patience wait for <span class="ital">it.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5144"><span id="lf0610_label_6476">26</span> Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5145"><span id="lf0610_label_6477">27</span> And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what <span class="ital">is</span> the mind of the Spirit, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1328" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1328_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>because he maketh intercession for the saints according to <span class="ital">the will of</span> God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5146"><span id="lf0610_label_6479">28</span> And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to <span class="ital">his</span> purpose.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5147"><span id="lf0610_label_6480">29</span> For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate <span class="ital">to be</span> conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5148"><span id="lf0610_label_6481">30</span> Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5149"><span id="lf0610_label_6482">31</span> What shall we then say to these things? If God <span class="ital">be</span> for us, who <span class="ital">can be</span> against us?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5150"><span id="lf0610_label_6483">32</span> He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5151"><span id="lf0610_label_6484">33</span> Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God&#x2019;s elect? <span class="ital">It is</span> God that justifieth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5152"><span id="lf0610_label_6485">34</span> Who <span class="ital">is</span> he that condemneth? <span class="ital">It is</span> Christ that died, yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5153"><span id="lf0610_label_6486">35</span> Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? <span class="ital">shall</span> tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5154"><span id="lf0610_label_6487">36</span> As it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1329" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1329_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For thy sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5155"><span id="lf0610_label_6489">37</span> Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5156"><span id="lf0610_label_6490">38</span> For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5157"><span id="lf0610_label_6491">39</span> Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_146" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_6492">9</h2>
