<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5800"><span id="lf0610_label_7373">21</span> The salutation of <span class="ital">me</span> Paul with mine own hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5801"><span id="lf0610_label_7374">22</span> If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maran-atha.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5802"><span id="lf0610_label_7375">23</span> The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ <span class="ital">be</span> with you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5803"><span id="lf0610_label_7376">24</span> My love <span class="ital">be</span> with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.</p>
<div class="cit">
<p class="indent-no" id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5804">&#xB6; The first <span class="ital">epistle</span> to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, and Timotheus.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>210<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<div id="lf0610_div_171" class="type-part Corinthians_II">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_021">THE SECOND EPISTLE OF PAUL THE APOSTLE TO THE CORINTHIANS.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_172" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7377">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5805"><span id="lf0610_label_7378">1</span> <span class="csc">Paul,</span> an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy <span class="ital">our</span> brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5806"><span id="lf0610_label_7379">2</span> Grace <span class="ital">be</span> to you and peace from God our Father, and <span class="ital">from</span> the Lord Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5807"><span id="lf0610_label_7380">3</span> Blessed <span class="ital">be</span> God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5808"><span id="lf0610_label_7381">4</span> Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5809"><span id="lf0610_label_7382">5</span> For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5810"><span id="lf0610_label_7383">6</span> And whether we be afflicted, <span class="ital">it is</span> for your consolation and salvation, which <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1546" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1546_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, <span class="ital">it is</span> for your consolation and salvation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5811"><span id="lf0610_label_7385">7</span> And our hope of you <span class="ital">is</span> stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so <span class="ital">shall ye be</span> also of the consolation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5812"><span id="lf0610_label_7386">8</span> For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5813"><span id="lf0610_label_7387">9</span> But we had the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1547" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1547_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5814"><span id="lf0610_label_7389">10</span> Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver <span class="ital">us;</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5815"><span id="lf0610_label_7390">11</span> Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift <span class="ital">bestowed</span> upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5816"><span id="lf0610_label_7391">12</span> For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5817"><span id="lf0610_label_7392">13</span> For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5818"><span id="lf0610_label_7393">14</span> As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also <span class="ital">are</span> ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5819"><span id="lf0610_label_7394">15</span> And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1548" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1548_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>benefit;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5820"><span id="lf0610_label_7396">16</span> And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Jud&#xE6;a.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5821"><span id="lf0610_label_7397">17</span> When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5822"><span id="lf0610_label_7398">18</span> But <span class="ital">as</span> God <span class="ital">is</span> true, our <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1549" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1549_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>word toward you was not yea and nay.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5823"><span id="lf0610_label_7400">19</span> For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, <span class="ital">even</span> by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5824"><span id="lf0610_label_7401">20</span> For all the promises of God in him <span class="ital">are</span> yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>211<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5825"><span id="lf0610_label_7402">21</span> Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, <span class="ital">is</span> God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5826"><span id="lf0610_label_7403">22</span> Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5827"><span id="lf0610_label_7404">23</span> Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5828"><span id="lf0610_label_7405">24</span> Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_173" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7406">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5829"><span id="lf0610_label_7407">1</span> But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5830"><span id="lf0610_label_7408">2</span> For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5831"><span id="lf0610_label_7409">3</span> And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is <span class="ital">the joy</span> of you all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5832"><span id="lf0610_label_7410">4</span> For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5833"><span id="lf0610_label_7411">5</span> But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5834"><span id="lf0610_label_7412">6</span> Sufficient to such a man <span class="ital">is</span> this <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1550" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1550_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>punishment, which <span class="ital">was inflicted</span> of many.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5835"><span id="lf0610_label_7414">7</span> So that contrariwise ye <span class="ital">ought</span> rather to forgive <span class="ital">him,</span> and comfort <span class="ital">him,</span> lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5836"><span id="lf0610_label_7415">8</span> Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm <span class="ital">your</span> love toward him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5837"><span id="lf0610_label_7416">9</span> For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5838"><span id="lf0610_label_7417">10</span> To whom ye forgive any thing, I <span class="ital">forgive</span> also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave <span class="ital">it,</span> for your sakes <span class="ital">forgave I it</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1551" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1551_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in the person of Christ;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5839"><span id="lf0610_label_7419">11</span> Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5840"><span id="lf0610_label_7420">12</span> Furthermore, when I came to Troas to <span class="ital">preach</span> Christ&#x2019;s gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5841"><span id="lf0610_label_7421">13</span> I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5842"><span id="lf0610_label_7422">14</span> Now thanks <span class="ital">be</span> unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5843"><span id="lf0610_label_7423">15</span> For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5844"><span id="lf0610_label_7424">16</span> To the one <span class="ital">we are</span> the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who <span class="ital">is</span> sufficient for these things?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5845"><span id="lf0610_label_7425">17</span> For we are not as many, which <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1552" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1552_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_174" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7427">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5846"><span id="lf0610_label_7428">1</span> Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some <span class="ital">others,</span> epistles of commendation to you, or <span class="ital">letters</span> of commendation from you?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5847"><span id="lf0610_label_7429">2</span> Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5848"><span id="lf0610_label_7430">3</span> <span class="ital">Forasmuch as ye are</span> manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5849"><span id="lf0610_label_7431">4</span> And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5850"><span id="lf0610_label_7432">5</span> Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency <span class="ital">is</span> of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5851"><span id="lf0610_label_7433">6</span> Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1553" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1553_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>giveth life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5852"><span id="lf0610_label_7435">7</span> But if the ministration of death, written <span class="ital">and</span> <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>212<span class="bracket">]</span></span> engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which <span class="ital">glory</span> was to be done away:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5853"><span id="lf0610_label_7436">8</span> How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5854"><span id="lf0610_label_7437">9</span> For if the ministration of condemnation <span class="ital">be</span> glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5855"><span id="lf0610_label_7438">10</span> For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5856"><span id="lf0610_label_7439">11</span> For if that which is done away <span class="ital">was</span> glorious, much more that which remaineth <span class="ital">is</span> glorious.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5857"><span id="lf0610_label_7440">12</span> Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1554" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1554_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>plainness of speech:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5858"><span id="lf0610_label_7442">13</span> And not as Moses, <span class="ital">which</span> put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5859"><span id="lf0610_label_7443">14</span> But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which <span class="ital">vail</span> is done away in Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5860"><span id="lf0610_label_7444">15</span> But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5861"><span id="lf0610_label_7445">16</span> Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5862"><span id="lf0610_label_7446">17</span> Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord <span class="ital">is,</span> there <span class="ital">is</span> liberty.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5863"><span id="lf0610_label_7447">18</span> But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, <span class="ital">even</span> as <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1555" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1555_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>by the Spirit of the Lord.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_175" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7449">4</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5864"><span id="lf0610_label_7450">1</span> Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5865"><span id="lf0610_label_7451">2</span> But have renounced the hidden things of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1556" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1556_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man&#x2019;s conscience in the sight of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5866"><span id="lf0610_label_7453">3</span> But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5867"><span id="lf0610_label_7454">4</span> In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5868"><span id="lf0610_label_7455">5</span> For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus&#x2019; sake.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5869"><span id="lf0610_label_7456">6</span> For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to <span class="ital">give</span> the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5870"><span id="lf0610_label_7457">7</span> But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5871"><span id="lf0610_label_7458">8</span> <span class="ital">We are</span> troubled on every side, yet not distressed; <span class="ital">we are</span> perplexed, but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1557" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1557_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>not in despair;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5872"><span id="lf0610_label_7460">9</span> Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5873"><span id="lf0610_label_7461">10</span> Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5874"><span id="lf0610_label_7462">11</span> For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus&#x2019; sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5875"><span id="lf0610_label_7463">12</span> So then death worketh in us, but life in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5876"><span id="lf0610_label_7464">13</span> We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1558" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1558_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5877"><span id="lf0610_label_7466">14</span> Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present <span class="ital">us</span> with you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5878"><span id="lf0610_label_7467">15</span> For all things <span class="ital">are</span> for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5879"><span id="lf0610_label_7468">16</span> For which cause we faint not; but though our <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>213<span class="bracket">]</span></span> outward man perish, yet the inward <span class="ital">man</span> is renewed day by day.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5880"><span id="lf0610_label_7469">17</span> For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding <span class="ital">and</span> eternal weight of glory;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5881"><span id="lf0610_label_7470">18</span> While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen <span class="ital">are</span> temporal; but the things which are not seen <span class="ital">are</span> eternal.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_176" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7471">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5882"><span id="lf0610_label_7472">1</span> For we know that if our earthly house of <span class="ital">this</span> tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1559" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1559_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>hands, eternal in the heavens.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5883"><span id="lf0610_label_7474">2</span> For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5884"><span id="lf0610_label_7475">3</span> If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5885"><span id="lf0610_label_7476">4</span> For we that are in <span class="ital">this</span> tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5886"><span id="lf0610_label_7477">5</span> Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing <span class="ital">is</span> God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5887"><span id="lf0610_label_7478">6</span> Therefore <span class="ital">we are</span> always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5888"><span id="lf0610_label_7479">7</span> (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5889"><span id="lf0610_label_7480">8</span> We are confident, <span class="ital">I say,</span> and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5890"><span id="lf0610_label_7481">9</span> Wherefore we <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1560" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1560_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5891"><span id="lf0610_label_7483">10</span> For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things <span class="ital">done</span> in <span class="ital">his</span> body, according to that he hath done, whether <span class="ital">it be</span> good or bad.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5892"><span id="lf0610_label_7484">11</span> Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5893"><span id="lf0610_label_7485">12</span> For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to <span class="ital">answer</span> them which glory <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1561" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1561_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>in appearance, and not in heart.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5894"><span id="lf0610_label_7487">13</span> For whether we be beside ourselves, <span class="ital">it is</span> to God: or whether we be sober, <span class="ital">it is</span> for your cause.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5895"><span id="lf0610_label_7488">14</span> For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5896"><span id="lf0610_label_7489">15</span> And <span class="ital">that</span> he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5897"><span id="lf0610_label_7490">16</span> Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we <span class="ital">him</span> no more.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5898"><span id="lf0610_label_7491">17</span> Therefore if any man <span class="ital">be</span> in Christ, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1562" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1562_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a><span class="ital">he is</span> a new creature: <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1563" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1563_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5899"><span id="lf0610_label_7494">18</span> And all things <span class="ital">are</span> of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5900"><span id="lf0610_label_7495">19</span> To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1564" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1564_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>committed unto us the word of reconciliation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5901"><span id="lf0610_label_7497">20</span> Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech <span class="ital">you</span> by us: we pray <span class="ital">you</span> in Christ&#x2019;s stead, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1565" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1565_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>be ye reconciled to God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5902"><span id="lf0610_label_7499">21</span> For he hath made him <span class="ital">to be</span> sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_177" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7500">6</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5903"><span id="lf0610_label_7501">1</span> We then, <span class="ital">as</span> workers together <span class="ital">with him,</span> beseech <span class="ital">you</span> also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>214<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5904"><span id="lf0610_label_7502">2</span> (For he saith, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1566" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1566_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now <span class="ital">is</span> the accepted time; behold, now <span class="ital">is</span> the day of salvation.)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5905"><span id="lf0610_label_7504">3</span> Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5906"><span id="lf0610_label_7505">4</span> But in all <span class="ital">things</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1567" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1567_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5907"><span id="lf0610_label_7507">5</span> In stripes, in imprisonments, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1568" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1568_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5908"><span id="lf0610_label_7509">6</span> By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5909"><span id="lf0610_label_7510">7</span> By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5910"><span id="lf0610_label_7511">8</span> By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and <span class="ital">yet</span> true;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5911"><span id="lf0610_label_7512">9</span> As unknown, and <span class="ital">yet</span> well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5912"><span id="lf0610_label_7513">10</span> As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and <span class="ital">yet</span> possessing all things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5913"><span id="lf0610_label_7514">11</span> O <span class="ital">ye</span> Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5914"><span id="lf0610_label_7515">12</span> Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5915"><span id="lf0610_label_7516">13</span> Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto <span class="ital">my</span> children,) be ye also enlarged.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5916"><span id="lf0610_label_7517">14</span> Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5917"><span id="lf0610_label_7518">15</span> And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5918"><span id="lf0610_label_7519">16</span> And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1569" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1569_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I will dwell in them, and walk in <span class="ital">them;</span> and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5919"><span id="lf0610_label_7521">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1570" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1570_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean <span class="ital">thing;</span> and I will receive you,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5920"><span id="lf0610_label_7523">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1571" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1571_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_178" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7525">7</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5921"><span id="lf0610_label_7526">1</span> Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5922"><span id="lf0610_label_7527">2</span> Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5923"><span id="lf0610_label_7528">3</span> I speak not <span class="ital">this</span> to condemn <span class="ital">you:</span> for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with <span class="ital">you.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5924"><span id="lf0610_label_7529">4</span> Great <span class="ital">is</span> my boldness of speech toward you, great <span class="ital">is</span> my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5925"><span id="lf0610_label_7530">5</span> For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without <span class="ital">were</span> fightings, within <span class="ital">were</span> fears.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5926"><span id="lf0610_label_7531">6</span> Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5927"><span id="lf0610_label_7532">7</span> And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5928"><span id="lf0610_label_7533">8</span> For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though <span class="ital">it were</span> but for a season.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5929"><span id="lf0610_label_7534">9</span> Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1572" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1572_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5930"><span id="lf0610_label_7536">10</span> For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>215<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5931"><span id="lf0610_label_7537">11</span> For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, <span class="ital">what</span> clearing of yourselves, yea, <span class="ital">what</span> indignation, yea, <span class="ital">what</span> fear, yea, <span class="ital">what</span> vehement desire, yea, <span class="ital">what</span> zeal, yea, <span class="ital">what</span> revenge! In all <span class="ital">things</span> ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5932"><span id="lf0610_label_7538">12</span> Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, <span class="ital">I did it</span> not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5933"><span id="lf0610_label_7539">13</span> Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5934"><span id="lf0610_label_7540">14</span> For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which <span class="ital">I made</span> before Titus, is found a truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5935"><span id="lf0610_label_7541">15</span> And his <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1573" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1573_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5936"><span id="lf0610_label_7543">16</span> I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all <span class="ital">things.</span></p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_179" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7544">8</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5937"><span id="lf0610_label_7545">1</span> Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5938"><span id="lf0610_label_7546">2</span> How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5939"><span id="lf0610_label_7547">3</span> For to <span class="ital">their</span> power, I bear record, yea, and beyond <span class="ital">their</span> power <span class="ital">they were</span> willing of themselves;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5940"><span id="lf0610_label_7548">4</span> Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and <span class="ital">take upon us</span> the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5941"><span id="lf0610_label_7549">5</span> And <span class="ital">this they did,</span> not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5942"><span id="lf0610_label_7550">6</span> Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5943"><span id="lf0610_label_7551">7</span> Therefore, as ye abound in every <span class="ital">thing, in</span> faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and <span class="ital">in</span> all diligence, and <span class="ital">in</span> your love to us, <span class="ital">see</span> that ye abound in this grace also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5944"><span id="lf0610_label_7552">8</span> I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5945"><span id="lf0610_label_7553">9</span> For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5946"><span id="lf0610_label_7554">10</span> And herein I give <span class="ital">my</span> advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1574" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1574_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>forward a year ago.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5947"><span id="lf0610_label_7556">11</span> Now therefore perform the doing <span class="ital">of it;</span> that as <span class="ital">there was</span> a readiness to will, so <span class="ital">there may be</span> a performance also out of that which ye have.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5948"><span id="lf0610_label_7557">12</span> For if there be first a willing mind, <span class="ital">it is</span> accepted according to that a man hath, <span class="ital">and</span> not according to that he hath not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5949"><span id="lf0610_label_7558">13</span> For <span class="ital">I mean</span> not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5950"><span id="lf0610_label_7559">14</span> But by an equality, <span class="ital">that</span> now at this time your abundance <span class="ital">may be a supply</span> for their want, that their abundance also may be <span class="ital">a supply</span> for your want: that there may be equality:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5951"><span id="lf0610_label_7560">15</span> As it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1575" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1575_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He that <span class="ital">had gathered</span> much had nothing over; and he that <span class="ital">had gathered</span> little had no lack.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5952"><span id="lf0610_label_7562">16</span> But thanks <span class="ital">be</span> to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5953"><span id="lf0610_label_7563">17</span> For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5954"><span id="lf0610_label_7564">18</span> And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise <span class="ital">is</span> in the gospel throughout all the churches;</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>216<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5955"><span id="lf0610_label_7565">19</span> And not <span class="ital">that</span> only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1576" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1576_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and <span class="ital">declaration of</span> your ready mind:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5956"><span id="lf0610_label_7567">20</span> Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5957"><span id="lf0610_label_7568">21</span> Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1577" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1577_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>also in the sight of men.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5958"><span id="lf0610_label_7570">22</span> And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1578" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1578_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a><span class="ital">I have</span> in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5959"><span id="lf0610_label_7572">23</span> Whether <span class="ital">any do enquire</span> of Titus, <span class="ital">he is</span> my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren <span class="ital">be enquired of, they are</span> the messengers of the churches, <span class="ital">and</span> the glory of Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5960"><span id="lf0610_label_7573">24</span> Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_180" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7574">9</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5961"><span id="lf0610_label_7575">1</span> For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5962"><span id="lf0610_label_7576">2</span> For I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5963"><span id="lf0610_label_7577">3</span> Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5964"><span id="lf0610_label_7578">4</span> Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5965"><span id="lf0610_label_7579">5</span> Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1579" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1579_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>bounty, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1580" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1580_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as <span class="ital">a matter of</span> bounty, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1581" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1581_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>and not as <span class="ital">of</span> covetousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5966"><span id="lf0610_label_7583">6</span> But this <span class="ital">I say,</span> He which soweth sparingly shall <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1582" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1582_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1583" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1583_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>reap also bountifully.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5967"><span id="lf0610_label_7586">7</span> Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, <span class="ital">so let him give;</span> not grudgingly, or of necessity: for <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1584" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1584_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>God loveth a cheerful giver.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5968"><span id="lf0610_label_7588">8</span> And God <span class="ital">is</span> able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all <span class="ital">things,</span> may abound to every good work:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5969"><span id="lf0610_label_7589">9</span> (As it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1585" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1585_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5970"><span id="lf0610_label_7591">10</span> Now he that <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1586" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1586_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for <span class="ital">your</span> food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5971"><span id="lf0610_label_7593">11</span> Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5972"><span id="lf0610_label_7594">12</span> For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5973"><span id="lf0610_label_7595">13</span> Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for <span class="ital">your</span> liberal distribution unto them, and unto all <span class="ital">men;</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5974"><span id="lf0610_label_7596">14</span> And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5975"><span id="lf0610_label_7597">15</span> Thanks <span class="ital">be</span> unto God for his unspeakable gift.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_181" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7598">10</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5976"><span id="lf0610_label_7599">1</span> Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1587" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1587_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in presence <span class="ital">am</span> base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5977"><span id="lf0610_label_7601">2</span> But I beseech <span class="ital">you,</span> that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1588" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1588_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5978"><span id="lf0610_label_7603">3</span> For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5979"><span id="lf0610_label_7604">4</span> (For the weapons of our warfare <span class="ital">are</span> not carnal, but mighty <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1589" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1589_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>217<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5980"><span id="lf0610_label_7606">5</span> Casting down <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1590" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1590_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5981"><span id="lf0610_label_7608">6</span> And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5982"><span id="lf0610_label_7609">7</span> Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ&#x2019;s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he <span class="ital">is</span> Christ&#x2019;s, even so <span class="ital">are</span> we Christ&#x2019;s.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5983"><span id="lf0610_label_7610">8</span> For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5984"><span id="lf0610_label_7611">9</span> That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5985"><span id="lf0610_label_7612">10</span> For <span class="ital">his</span> letters, say they, <span class="ital">are</span> weighty and powerful; but <span class="ital">his</span> bodily presence <span class="ital">is</span> weak, and <span class="ital">his</span> speech contemptible.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5986"><span id="lf0610_label_7613">11</span> Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such <span class="ital">will we be</span> also in deed when we are present.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5987"><span id="lf0610_label_7614">12</span> For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1591" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1591_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>are not wise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5988"><span id="lf0610_label_7616">13</span> But we will not boast of things without <span class="ital">our</span> measure, but according to the measure of the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1592" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1592_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5989"><span id="lf0610_label_7618">14</span> For we stretch not ourselves beyond <span class="ital">our measure,</span> as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in <span class="ital">preaching</span> the gospel of Christ:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5990"><span id="lf0610_label_7619">15</span> Not boasting of things without <span class="ital">our</span> measure, <span class="ital">that is,</span> of other men&#x2019;s labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1593" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1593_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5991"><span id="lf0610_label_7621">16</span> To preach the gospel in the <span class="ital">regions</span> beyond you, <span class="ital">and</span> not to boast in another man&#x2019;s <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1594" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1594_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>line of things made ready to our hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5992"><span id="lf0610_label_7623">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1595" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1595_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5993"><span id="lf0610_label_7625">18</span> For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_182" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7626">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5994"><span id="lf0610_label_7627">1</span> Would to God ye could bear with me a little in <span class="ital">my</span> folly: and indeed <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1596" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1596_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>bear with me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5995"><span id="lf0610_label_7629">2</span> For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present <span class="ital">you as</span> a chaste virgin to Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5996"><span id="lf0610_label_7630">3</span> But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5997"><span id="lf0610_label_7631">4</span> For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or <span class="ital">if</span> ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with <span class="ital">him.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5998"><span id="lf0610_label_7632">5</span> For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_5999"><span id="lf0610_label_7633">6</span> But though <span class="ital">I be</span> rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6000"><span id="lf0610_label_7634">7</span> Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6001"><span id="lf0610_label_7635">8</span> I robbed other churches, taking wages <span class="ital">of them,</span> to do you service.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6002"><span id="lf0610_label_7636">9</span> And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all <span class="ital">things</span> I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and <span class="ital">so</span> will I keep <span class="ital">myself.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6003"><span id="lf0610_label_7637">10</span> As the truth of Christ is in me, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1597" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1597_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>218<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6004"><span id="lf0610_label_7639">11</span> Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6005"><span id="lf0610_label_7640">12</span> But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6006"><span id="lf0610_label_7641">13</span> For such <span class="ital">are</span> false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6007"><span id="lf0610_label_7642">14</span> And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6008"><span id="lf0610_label_7643">15</span> Therefore <span class="ital">it is</span> no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6009"><span id="lf0610_label_7644">16</span> I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1598" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1598_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>receive me, that I may boast myself a little.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6010"><span id="lf0610_label_7646">17</span> That which I speak, I speak <span class="ital">it</span> not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6011"><span id="lf0610_label_7647">18</span> Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6012"><span id="lf0610_label_7648">19</span> For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye <span class="ital">yourselves</span> are wise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6013"><span id="lf0610_label_7649">20</span> For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour <span class="ital">you,</span> if a man take <span class="ital">of you,</span> if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6014"><span id="lf0610_label_7650">21</span> I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6015"><span id="lf0610_label_7651">22</span> Are they Hebrews? so <span class="ital">am</span> I. Are they Israelites? so <span class="ital">am</span> I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so <span class="ital">am</span> I.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6016"><span id="lf0610_label_7652">23</span> Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I <span class="ital">am</span> more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6017"><span id="lf0610_label_7653">24</span> Of the Jews five times received I <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1599" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1599_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>forty <span class="ital">stripes</span> save one.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6018"><span id="lf0610_label_7655">25</span> Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6019"><span id="lf0610_label_7656">26</span> <span class="ital">In</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1600" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1600_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>journeyings often, <span class="ital">in</span> perils of waters, <span class="ital">in</span> perils of robbers, <span class="ital">in</span> perils by <span class="ital">mine own</span> countrymen, <span class="ital">in</span> perils by the heathen, <span class="ital">in</span> perils in the city, <span class="ital">in</span> perils in the wilderness, <span class="ital">in</span> perils in the sea, <span class="ital">in</span> perils among false brethren;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6020"><span id="lf0610_label_7658">27</span> In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6021"><span id="lf0610_label_7659">28</span> Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6022"><span id="lf0610_label_7660">29</span> Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6023"><span id="lf0610_label_7661">30</span> If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6024"><span id="lf0610_label_7662">31</span> The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6025"><span id="lf0610_label_7663">32</span> In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1601" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1601_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6026"><span id="lf0610_label_7665">33</span> And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_183" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7666">12</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6027"><span id="lf0610_label_7667">1</span> It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6028"><span id="lf0610_label_7668">2</span> I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6029"><span id="lf0610_label_7669">3</span> And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6030"><span id="lf0610_label_7670">4</span> How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1602" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1602_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>lawful for a man to utter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6031"><span id="lf0610_label_7672">5</span> Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6032"><span id="lf0610_label_7673">6</span> For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but <span class="ital">now</span> I <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>219<span class="bracket">]</span></span> forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me <span class="ital">to be,</span> or <span class="ital">that</span> he heareth of me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6033"><span id="lf0610_label_7674">7</span> And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1603" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1603_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6034"><span id="lf0610_label_7676">8</span> For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6035"><span id="lf0610_label_7677">9</span> And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6036"><span id="lf0610_label_7678">10</span> Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ&#x2019;s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6037"><span id="lf0610_label_7679">11</span> I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6038"><span id="lf0610_label_7680">12</span> Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6039"><span id="lf0610_label_7681">13</span> For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except <span class="ital">it be</span> that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6040"><span id="lf0610_label_7682">14</span> Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6041"><span id="lf0610_label_7683">15</span> And I will very gladly spend and be spent for <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1604" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1604_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6042"><span id="lf0610_label_7685">16</span> But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6043"><span id="lf0610_label_7686">17</span> Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6044"><span id="lf0610_label_7687">18</span> I desired Titus, and with <span class="ital">him</span> I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? <span class="ital">walked we</span> not in the same steps?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6045"><span id="lf0610_label_7688">19</span> Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but <span class="ital">we do</span> all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6046"><span id="lf0610_label_7689">20</span> For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and <span class="ital">that</span> I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest <span class="ital">there be</span> debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6047"><span id="lf0610_label_7690">21</span> <span class="ital">And</span> lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and <span class="ital">that</span> I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_184" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7691">13</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6048"><span id="lf0610_label_7692">1</span> This <span class="ital">is</span> the third <span class="ital">time</span> I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6049"><span id="lf0610_label_7693">2</span> I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6050"><span id="lf0610_label_7694">3</span> Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6051"><span id="lf0610_label_7695">4</span> For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. For we also are weak <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1605" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1605_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6052"><span id="lf0610_label_7697">5</span> Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6053"><span id="lf0610_label_7698">6</span> But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6054"><span id="lf0610_label_7699">7</span> Now I pray to God that ye do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as reprobates.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>220<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6055"><span id="lf0610_label_7700">8</span> For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6056"><span id="lf0610_label_7701">9</span> For we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this also we wish, <span class="ital">even</span> your perfection.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6057"><span id="lf0610_label_7702">10</span> Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the power which the Lord hath given me to edification, and not to destruction.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6058"><span id="lf0610_label_7703">11</span> Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6059"><span id="lf0610_label_7704">12</span> Greet one another with an holy kiss.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6060"><span id="lf0610_label_7705">13</span> All the saints salute you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6061"><span id="lf0610_label_7706">14</span> The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, <span class="ital">be</span> with you all. Amen.</p>
<div class="cit">
<p class="indent-no" id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6062">&#xB6; The second <span class="ital">epistle</span> to the Corinthians was written from Philippi, <span class="ital">a city</span> of Macedonia, by Titus and Lucas.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_185" class="type-part Galatians">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_023">THE EPISTLE OF PAUL TO THE GALATIANS.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_186" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7707">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6063"><span id="lf0610_label_7708">1</span> <span class="csc">Paul,</span> an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6064"><span id="lf0610_label_7709">2</span> And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6065"><span id="lf0610_label_7710">3</span> Grace <span class="ital">be</span> to you and peace from God the Father, and <span class="ital">from</span> our Lord Jesus Christ,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6066"><span id="lf0610_label_7711">4</span> Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6067"><span id="lf0610_label_7712">5</span> To whom <span class="ital">be</span> glory for ever and ever. Amen.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6068"><span id="lf0610_label_7713">6</span> I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6069"><span id="lf0610_label_7714">7</span> Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6070"><span id="lf0610_label_7715">8</span> But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6071"><span id="lf0610_label_7716">9</span> As we said before, so say I now again, If any <span class="ital">man</span> preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6072"><span id="lf0610_label_7717">10</span> For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6073"><span id="lf0610_label_7718">11</span> But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6074"><span id="lf0610_label_7719">12</span> For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught <span class="ital">it,</span> but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6075"><span id="lf0610_label_7720">13</span> For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews&#x2019; religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6076"><span id="lf0610_label_7721">14</span> And profited in the Jews&#x2019; religion above many my <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1606" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1606_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6077"><span id="lf0610_label_7723">15</span> But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother&#x2019;s womb, and called <span class="ital">me</span> by his grace,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6078"><span id="lf0610_label_7724">16</span> To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6079"><span id="lf0610_label_7725">17</span> Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>221<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6080"><span id="lf0610_label_7726">18</span> Then after three years I <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1607" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1607_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6081"><span id="lf0610_label_7728">19</span> But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord&#x2019;s brother.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6082"><span id="lf0610_label_7729">20</span> Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6083"><span id="lf0610_label_7730">21</span> Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6084"><span id="lf0610_label_7731">22</span> And was unknown by face unto the churches of Jud&#xE6;a which were in Christ:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6085"><span id="lf0610_label_7732">23</span> But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6086"><span id="lf0610_label_7733">24</span> And they glorified God in me.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_187" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7734">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6087"><span id="lf0610_label_7735">1</span> Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with <span class="ital">me</span> also.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6088"><span id="lf0610_label_7736">2</span> And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1608" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1608_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6089"><span id="lf0610_label_7738">3</span> But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6090"><span id="lf0610_label_7739">4</span> And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6091"><span id="lf0610_label_7740">5</span> To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6092"><span id="lf0610_label_7741">6</span> But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no man&#x2019;s person:) for they who seemed <span class="ital">to be somewhat</span> in conference added nothing to me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6093"><span id="lf0610_label_7742">7</span> But contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as <span class="ital">the gospel</span> of the circumcision <span class="ital">was</span> unto Peter;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6094"><span id="lf0610_label_7743">8</span> (For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6095"><span id="lf0610_label_7744">9</span> And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we <span class="ital">should go</span> unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6096"><span id="lf0610_label_7745">10</span> Only <span class="ital">they would</span> that we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6097"><span id="lf0610_label_7746">11</span> But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6098"><span id="lf0610_label_7747">12</span> For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6099"><span id="lf0610_label_7748">13</span> And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6100"><span id="lf0610_label_7749">14</span> But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter before <span class="ital">them</span> all, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6101"><span id="lf0610_label_7750">15</span> We <span class="ital">who are</span> Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6102"><span id="lf0610_label_7751">16</span> Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6103"><span id="lf0610_label_7752">17</span> But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, <span class="ital">is</span> therefore Christ the minister of sin? God forbid.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6104"><span id="lf0610_label_7753">18</span> For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>222<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6105"><span id="lf0610_label_7754">19</span> For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6106"><span id="lf0610_label_7755">20</span> I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6107"><span id="lf0610_label_7756">21</span> I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness <span class="ital">come</span> by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_188" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_7757">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6108"><span id="lf0610_label_7758">1</span> O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6109"><span id="lf0610_label_7759">2</span> This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6110"><span id="lf0610_label_7760">3</span> Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6111"><span id="lf0610_label_7761">4</span> Have ye suffered <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1609" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1609_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>so many things in vain? if <span class="ital">it be</span> yet in vain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6112"><span id="lf0610_label_7763">5</span> He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, <span class="ital">doeth he it</span> by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6113"><span id="lf0610_label_7764">6</span> Even as Abraham believed God, and it was <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1610" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1610_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>accounted to him for righteousness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6114"><span id="lf0610_label_7766">7</span> Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6115"><span id="lf0610_label_7767">8</span> And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham, <span class="ital">saying,</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1611" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1611_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>In thee shall all nations be blessed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_6116"><span id="lf0610_label_7769">9</span> So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.</p>
