<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7134"><span id="lf0610_label_9070">14</span> How much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1857" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1857_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7135"><span id="lf0610_label_9072">15</span> And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions <span class="ital">that were</span> under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7136"><span id="lf0610_label_9073">16</span> For where a testament <span class="ital">is,</span> there must also of necessity <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1858" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1858_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>be the death of the testator.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7137"><span id="lf0610_label_9075">17</span> For a testament <span class="ital">is</span> of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7138"><span id="lf0610_label_9076">18</span> Whereupon neither the first <span class="ital">testament</span> was <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1859" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1859_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>dedicated without blood.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7139"><span id="lf0610_label_9078">19</span> For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1860" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1860_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7140"><span id="lf0610_label_9080">20</span> Saying, This <span class="ital">is</span> the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7141"><span id="lf0610_label_9081">21</span> Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7142"><span id="lf0610_label_9082">22</span> And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7143"><span id="lf0610_label_9083">23</span> <span class="ital">It was</span> therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7144"><span id="lf0610_label_9084">24</span> For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, <span class="ital">which are</span> the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7145"><span id="lf0610_label_9085">25</span> Nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7146"><span id="lf0610_label_9086">26</span> For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7147"><span id="lf0610_label_9087">27</span> And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>261<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7148"><span id="lf0610_label_9088">28</span> So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_247" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9089">10</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7149"><span id="lf0610_label_9090">1</span> For the law having a shadow of good things to come, <span class="ital">and</span> not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7150"><span id="lf0610_label_9091">2</span> For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7151"><span id="lf0610_label_9092">3</span> But in those <span class="ital">sacrifices there is</span> a remembrance again <span class="ital">made</span> of sins every year.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7152"><span id="lf0610_label_9093">4</span> For <span class="ital">it is</span> not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7153"><span id="lf0610_label_9094">5</span> Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1861" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1861_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>hast thou prepared me:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7154"><span id="lf0610_label_9096">6</span> In burnt offerings and <span class="ital">sacrifices</span> for sin thou hast had no pleasure.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7155"><span id="lf0610_label_9097">7</span> Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7156"><span id="lf0610_label_9098">8</span> Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and <span class="ital">offering</span> for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure <span class="ital">therein;</span> which are offered by the law;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7157"><span id="lf0610_label_9099">9</span> Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7158"><span id="lf0610_label_9100">10</span> By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once <span class="ital">for all.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7159"><span id="lf0610_label_9101">11</span> And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7160"><span id="lf0610_label_9102">12</span> But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7161"><span id="lf0610_label_9103">13</span> From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7162"><span id="lf0610_label_9104">14</span> For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7163"><span id="lf0610_label_9105">15</span> <span class="ital">Whereof</span> the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7164"><span id="lf0610_label_9106">16</span> This <span class="ital">is</span> the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1862" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1862_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7165"><span id="lf0610_label_9108">17</span> And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7166"><span id="lf0610_label_9109">18</span> Now where remission of these <span class="ital">is, there is</span> no more offering for sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7167"><span id="lf0610_label_9110">19</span> Having therefore, brethren, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1863" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1863_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7168"><span id="lf0610_label_9112">20</span> By a new and living way, which he hath <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1864" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1864_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7169"><span id="lf0610_label_9114">21</span> And <span class="ital">having</span> an high priest over the house of God;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7170"><span id="lf0610_label_9115">22</span> Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7171"><span id="lf0610_label_9116">23</span> Let us hold fast the profession of <span class="ital">our</span> faith without wavering; (for he <span class="ital">is</span> faithful that promised;)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7172"><span id="lf0610_label_9117">24</span> And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7173"><span id="lf0610_label_9118">25</span> Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some <span class="ital">is;</span> but exhorting <span class="ital">one another:</span> and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7174"><span id="lf0610_label_9119">26</span> For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7175"><span id="lf0610_label_9120">27</span> But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7176"><span id="lf0610_label_9121">28</span> He that despised Moses&#x2019; law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7177"><span id="lf0610_label_9122">29</span> Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>262<span class="bracket">]</span></span> shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7178"><span id="lf0610_label_9123">30</span> For we know him that hath said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1865" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1865_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Vengeance <span class="ital">belongeth</span> unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7179"><span id="lf0610_label_9125">31</span> <span class="ital">It is</span> a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7180"><span id="lf0610_label_9126">32</span> But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7181"><span id="lf0610_label_9127">33</span> Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7182"><span id="lf0610_label_9128">34</span> For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7183"><span id="lf0610_label_9129">35</span> Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7184"><span id="lf0610_label_9130">36</span> For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7185"><span id="lf0610_label_9131">37</span> For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7186"><span id="lf0610_label_9132">38</span> Now the just shall live by faith: but if <span class="ital">any man</span> draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7187"><span id="lf0610_label_9133">39</span> But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_248" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9134">11</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7188"><span id="lf0610_label_9135">1</span> Now faith is the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1866" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1866_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7189"><span id="lf0610_label_9137">2</span> For by it the elders obtained a good report.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7190"><span id="lf0610_label_9138">3</span> Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7191"><span id="lf0610_label_9139">4</span> By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1867" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1867_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>yet speaketh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7192"><span id="lf0610_label_9141">5</span> By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7193"><span id="lf0610_label_9142">6</span> But without faith <span class="ital">it is</span> impossible to please <span class="ital">him:</span> for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and <span class="ital">that</span> he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7194"><span id="lf0610_label_9143">7</span> By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1868" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1868_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7195"><span id="lf0610_label_9145">8</span> By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7196"><span id="lf0610_label_9146">9</span> By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as <span class="ital">in</span> a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7197"><span id="lf0610_label_9147">10</span> For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker <span class="ital">is</span> God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7198"><span id="lf0610_label_9148">11</span> Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7199"><span id="lf0610_label_9149">12</span> Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, <span class="ital">so many</span> as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7200"><span id="lf0610_label_9150">13</span> These all died <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1869" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1869_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of <span class="ital">them,</span> and embraced <span class="ital">them,</span> and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7201"><span id="lf0610_label_9152">14</span> For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>263<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7202"><span id="lf0610_label_9153">15</span> And truly, if they had been mindful of that <span class="ital">country</span> from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7203"><span id="lf0610_label_9154">16</span> But now they desire a better <span class="ital">country,</span> that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7204"><span id="lf0610_label_9155">17</span> By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten <span class="ital">son,</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7205"><span id="lf0610_label_9156">18</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1870" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1870_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7206"><span id="lf0610_label_9158">19</span> Accounting that God <span class="ital">was</span> able to raise <span class="ital">him</span> up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7207"><span id="lf0610_label_9159">20</span> By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7208"><span id="lf0610_label_9160">21</span> By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, <span class="ital">leaning</span> upon the top of his staff.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7209"><span id="lf0610_label_9161">22</span> By faith Joseph, when he died, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1871" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1871_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7210"><span id="lf0610_label_9163">23</span> By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw <span class="ital">he was</span> a proper child; and they <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1872" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1872_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>were not afraid of the king&#x2019;s commandment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7211"><span id="lf0610_label_9165">24</span> By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh&#x2019;s daughter;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7212"><span id="lf0610_label_9166">25</span> Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7213"><span id="lf0610_label_9167">26</span> Esteeming the reproach <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1873" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1873_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7214"><span id="lf0610_label_9169">27</span> By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7215"><span id="lf0610_label_9170">28</span> Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7216"><span id="lf0610_label_9171">29</span> By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry <span class="ital">land:</span> which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7217"><span id="lf0610_label_9172">30</span> By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7218"><span id="lf0610_label_9173">31</span> By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1874" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1874_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7219"><span id="lf0610_label_9175">32</span> And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and <span class="ital">of</span> Barak, and <span class="ital">of</span> Samson, and <span class="ital">of</span> Jephthae; <span class="ital">of</span> David also, and Samuel, and <span class="ital">of</span> the prophets:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7220"><span id="lf0610_label_9176">33</span> Who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7221"><span id="lf0610_label_9177">34</span> Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7222"><span id="lf0610_label_9178">35</span> Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1875" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1875_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7223"><span id="lf0610_label_9180">36</span> And others had trial of <span class="ital">cruel</span> mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7224"><span id="lf0610_label_9181">37</span> They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7225"><span id="lf0610_label_9182">38</span> (Of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and <span class="ital">in</span> mountains, and <span class="ital">in</span> dens and caves of the earth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7226"><span id="lf0610_label_9183">39</span> And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7227"><span id="lf0610_label_9184">40</span> God having <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1876" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1876_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_249" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9186">12</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7228"><span id="lf0610_label_9187">1</span> Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>264<span class="bracket">]</span></span> doth so easily beset <span class="ital">us,</span> and let us run with patience <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1877" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1877_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>the race that is set before us,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7229"><span id="lf0610_label_9189">2</span> Looking unto Jesus the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1878" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1878_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>author and finisher of <span class="ital">our</span> faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7230"><span id="lf0610_label_9191">3</span> For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7231"><span id="lf0610_label_9192">4</span> Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7232"><span id="lf0610_label_9193">5</span> And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7233"><span id="lf0610_label_9194">6</span> For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7234"><span id="lf0610_label_9195">7</span> If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7235"><span id="lf0610_label_9196">8</span> But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7236"><span id="lf0610_label_9197">9</span> Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected <span class="ital">us,</span> and we gave <span class="ital">them</span> reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7237"><span id="lf0610_label_9198">10</span> For they verily for a few days chastened <span class="ital">us</span> after their own pleasure; but he for <span class="ital">our</span> profit, that <span class="ital">we</span> might be partakers of his holiness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7238"><span id="lf0610_label_9199">11</span> Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7239"><span id="lf0610_label_9200">12</span> Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7240"><span id="lf0610_label_9201">13</span> And make <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1879" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1879_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7241"><span id="lf0610_label_9203">14</span> Follow peace with all <span class="ital">men,</span> and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7242"><span id="lf0610_label_9204">15</span> Looking diligently lest any man <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1880" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1880_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble <span class="ital">you,</span> and thereby many be defiled:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7243"><span id="lf0610_label_9206">16</span> Lest there <span class="ital">be</span> any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7244"><span id="lf0610_label_9207">17</span> For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1881" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1881_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7245"><span id="lf0610_label_9209">18</span> For ye are not come unto the mount that might he touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7246"><span id="lf0610_label_9210">19</span> And the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which <span class="ital">voice</span> they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7247"><span id="lf0610_label_9211">20</span> (For they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7248"><span id="lf0610_label_9212">21</span> And so terrible was the sight, <span class="ital">that</span> Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7249"><span id="lf0610_label_9213">22</span> But ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7250"><span id="lf0610_label_9214">23</span> To the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1882" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1882_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7251"><span id="lf0610_label_9216">24</span> And to Jesus the mediator of the new <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1883" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1883_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than <span class="ital">that of</span> Abel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7252"><span id="lf0610_label_9218">25</span> See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more <span class="ital">shall not</span> we <span class="ital">escape,</span> if we turn away from him that <span class="ital">speaketh</span> from heaven:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7253"><span id="lf0610_label_9219">26</span> Whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7254"><span id="lf0610_label_9220">27</span> And this <span class="ital">word,</span> Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1884" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1884_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>are shaken, as of <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>265<span class="bracket">]</span></span> things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7255"><span id="lf0610_label_9222">28</span> Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1885" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1885_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7256"><span id="lf0610_label_9224">29</span> For our God <span class="ital">is</span> a consuming fire.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_250" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9225">13</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7257"><span id="lf0610_label_9226">1</span> Let brotherly love continue.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7258"><span id="lf0610_label_9227">2</span> Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7259"><span id="lf0610_label_9228">3</span> Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; <span class="ital">and</span> them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7260"><span id="lf0610_label_9229">4</span> Marriage <span class="ital">is</span> honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7261"><span id="lf0610_label_9230">5</span> <span class="ital">Let your</span> conversation <span class="ital">be</span> without covetousness; <span class="ital">and be</span> content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1886" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1886_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7262"><span id="lf0610_label_9232">6</span> So that we may boldly say, The Lord <span class="ital">is</span> my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7263"><span id="lf0610_label_9233">7</span> Remember them which <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1887" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1887_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of <span class="ital">their</span> conversation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7264"><span id="lf0610_label_9235">8</span> Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7265"><span id="lf0610_label_9236">9</span> Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For <span class="ital">it is</span> a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7266"><span id="lf0610_label_9237">10</span> We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7267"><span id="lf0610_label_9238">11</span> For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7268"><span id="lf0610_label_9239">12</span> Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7269"><span id="lf0610_label_9240">13</span> Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7270"><span id="lf0610_label_9241">14</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1888" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1888_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7271"><span id="lf0610_label_9243">15</span> By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of <span class="ital">our</span> lips <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1889" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1889_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>giving thanks to his name.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7272"><span id="lf0610_label_9245">16</span> But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7273"><span id="lf0610_label_9246">17</span> Obey them that <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1890" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1890_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that <span class="ital">is</span> unprofitable for you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7274"><span id="lf0610_label_9248">18</span> Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7275"><span id="lf0610_label_9249">19</span> But I beseech <span class="ital">you</span> the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7276"><span id="lf0610_label_9250">20</span> Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1891" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1891_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>covenant,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7277"><span id="lf0610_label_9252">21</span> Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1892" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1892_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom <span class="ital">be</span> glory for ever and ever. Amen.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7278"><span id="lf0610_label_9254">22</span> And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7279"><span id="lf0610_label_9255">23</span> Know ye that <span class="ital">our</span> brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7280"><span id="lf0610_label_9256">24</span> Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7281"><span id="lf0610_label_9257">25</span> Grace <span class="ital">be</span> with you all. Amen.</p>
<div class="cit">
<p class="indent-no" id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7282">&#xB6; Written to the Hebrews from Italy by Timothy</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>266<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<div id="lf0610_div_251" class="type-part James">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_045">THE GENERAL EPISTLE OF JAMES.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_252" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9258">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7283"><span id="lf0610_label_9259">1</span> <span class="csc">James,</span> a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7284"><span id="lf0610_label_9260">2</span> My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7285"><span id="lf0610_label_9261">3</span> Knowing <span class="ital">this,</span> that the trying of your faith worketh patience.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7286"><span id="lf0610_label_9262">4</span> But let patience have <span class="ital">her</span> perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7287"><span id="lf0610_label_9263">5</span> If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all <span class="ital">men</span> liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7288"><span id="lf0610_label_9264">6</span> But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7289"><span id="lf0610_label_9265">7</span> For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7290"><span id="lf0610_label_9266">8</span> A double minded man <span class="ital">is</span> unstable in all his ways.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7291"><span id="lf0610_label_9267">9</span> Let the brother of low degree <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1893" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1893_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>rejoice in that he is exalted:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7292"><span id="lf0610_label_9269">10</span> But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7293"><span id="lf0610_label_9270">11</span> For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7294"><span id="lf0610_label_9271">12</span> Blessed <span class="ital">is</span> the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7295"><span id="lf0610_label_9272">13</span> Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1894" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1894_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>evil, neither tempteth he any man:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7296"><span id="lf0610_label_9274">14</span> But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7297"><span id="lf0610_label_9275">15</span> Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7298"><span id="lf0610_label_9276">16</span> Do not err, my beloved brethren.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7299"><span id="lf0610_label_9277">17</span> Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7300"><span id="lf0610_label_9278">18</span> Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7301"><span id="lf0610_label_9279">19</span> Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7302"><span id="lf0610_label_9280">20</span> For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7303"><span id="lf0610_label_9281">21</span> Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7304"><span id="lf0610_label_9282">22</span> But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7305"><span id="lf0610_label_9283">23</span> For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7306"><span id="lf0610_label_9284">24</span> For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7307"><span id="lf0610_label_9285">25</span> But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth <span class="ital">therein,</span> he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1895" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1895_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>deed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7308"><span id="lf0610_label_9287">26</span> If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man&#x2019;s religion <span class="ital">is</span> vain.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>267<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7309"><span id="lf0610_label_9288">27</span> Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, <span class="ital">and</span> to keep himself unspotted from the world.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_253" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9289">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7310"><span id="lf0610_label_9290">1</span> My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, <span class="ital">the Lord</span> of glory, with respect of persons.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7311"><span id="lf0610_label_9291">2</span> For if there come unto your <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1896" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1896_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7312"><span id="lf0610_label_9293">3</span> And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1897" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1897_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7313"><span id="lf0610_label_9295">4</span> Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7314"><span id="lf0610_label_9296">5</span> Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1898" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1898_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7315"><span id="lf0610_label_9298">6</span> But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7316"><span id="lf0610_label_9299">7</span> Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7317"><span id="lf0610_label_9300">8</span> If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7318"><span id="lf0610_label_9301">9</span> But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7319"><span id="lf0610_label_9302">10</span> For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one <span class="ital">point,</span> he is guilty of all.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7320"><span id="lf0610_label_9303">11</span> For <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1899" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1899_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7321"><span id="lf0610_label_9305">12</span> So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7322"><span id="lf0610_label_9306">13</span> For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1900" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1900_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>rejoiceth against judgment.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7323"><span id="lf0610_label_9308">14</span> What <span class="ital">doth it</span> profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7324"><span id="lf0610_label_9309">15</span> If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7325"><span id="lf0610_label_9310">16</span> And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be <span class="ital">ye</span> warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what <span class="ital">doth it</span> profit?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7326"><span id="lf0610_label_9311">17</span> Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1901" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1901_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>alone.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7327"><span id="lf0610_label_9313">18</span> Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1902" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1902_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7328"><span id="lf0610_label_9315">19</span> Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7329"><span id="lf0610_label_9316">20</span> But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7330"><span id="lf0610_label_9317">21</span> Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7331"><span id="lf0610_label_9318">22</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1903" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1903_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7332"><span id="lf0610_label_9320">23</span> And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1904" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1904_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7333"><span id="lf0610_label_9322">24</span> Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7334"><span id="lf0610_label_9323">25</span> Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent <span class="ital">them</span> out another way?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7335"><span id="lf0610_label_9324">26</span> For as the body without the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1905" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1905_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_254" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9326">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7336"><span id="lf0610_label_9327">1</span> My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1906" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1906_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>condemnation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7337"><span id="lf0610_label_9329">2</span> For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same <span class="ital">is</span> a perfect man, <span class="ital">and</span> able also to bridle the whole body.</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>268<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7338"><span id="lf0610_label_9330">3</span> Behold, we put bits in the horses&#x2019; mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7339"><span id="lf0610_label_9331">4</span> Behold also the ships, which though <span class="ital">they be</span> so great, and <span class="ital">are</span> driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7340"><span id="lf0610_label_9332">5</span> Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1907" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1907_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>a matter a little fire kindleth!</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7341"><span id="lf0610_label_9334">6</span> And the tongue <span class="ital">is</span> a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7342"><span id="lf0610_label_9335">7</span> For every <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1908" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1908_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1909" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1909_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1910" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1910_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>mankind:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7343"><span id="lf0610_label_9339">8</span> But the tongue can no man tame; <span class="ital">it is</span> an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7344"><span id="lf0610_label_9340">9</span> Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7345"><span id="lf0610_label_9341">10</span> Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7346"><span id="lf0610_label_9342">11</span> Doth a fountain send forth at the same <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1911" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1911_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>place sweet <span class="ital">water</span> and bitter?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7347"><span id="lf0610_label_9344">12</span> Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so <span class="ital">can</span> no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7348"><span id="lf0610_label_9345">13</span> Who <span class="ital">is</span> a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7349"><span id="lf0610_label_9346">14</span> But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7350"><span id="lf0610_label_9347">15</span> This wisdom descendeth not from above, but <span class="ital">is</span> earthly, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1912" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1912_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>sensual, devilish.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7351"><span id="lf0610_label_9349">16</span> For where envying and strife <span class="ital">is,</span> there <span class="ital">is</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1913" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1913_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>confusion and every evil work.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7352"><span id="lf0610_label_9351">17</span> But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, <span class="ital">and</span> easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1914" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1914_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>without partiality, and without hypocrisy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7353"><span id="lf0610_label_9353">18</span> And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_255" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9354">4</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7354"><span id="lf0610_label_9355">1</span> From whence <span class="ital">come</span> wars and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1915" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1915_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>fightings among you? <span class="ital">come they</span> not hence, <span class="ital">even</span> of your <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1916" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1916_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>lusts that war in your members?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7355"><span id="lf0610_label_9358">2</span> Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7356"><span id="lf0610_label_9359">3</span> Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume <span class="ital">it</span> upon your <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1917" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1917_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>lusts.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7357"><span id="lf0610_label_9361">4</span> Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7358"><span id="lf0610_label_9362">5</span> Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1918" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1918_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>to envy?</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7359"><span id="lf0610_label_9364">6</span> But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1919" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1919_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7360"><span id="lf0610_label_9366">7</span> Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7361"><span id="lf0610_label_9367">8</span> Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse <span class="ital">your</span> hands, <span class="ital">ye</span> sinners; and purify <span class="ital">your</span> hearts, <span class="ital">ye</span> double minded.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7362"><span id="lf0610_label_9368">9</span> Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and <span class="ital">your</span> joy to heaviness.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7363"><span id="lf0610_label_9369">10</span> Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7364"><span id="lf0610_label_9370">11</span> Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of <span class="ital">his</span> brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7365"><span id="lf0610_label_9371">12</span> There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?</p>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>269<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7366"><span id="lf0610_label_9372">13</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1920" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1920_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7367"><span id="lf0610_label_9374">14</span> Whereas ye know not what <span class="ital">shall be</span> on the morrow. For what <span class="ital">is</span> your life? <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1921" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1921_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7368"><span id="lf0610_label_9376">15</span> For that ye <span class="ital">ought</span> to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7369"><span id="lf0610_label_9377">16</span> But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7370"><span id="lf0610_label_9378">17</span> Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth <span class="ital">it</span> not, to him it is sin.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_256" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9379">5</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7371"><span id="lf0610_label_9380">1</span> Go to now, <span class="ital">ye</span> rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon <span class="ital">you.</span></p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7372"><span id="lf0610_label_9381">2</span> Your riches are corrupted, and your garments <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1922" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1922_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>are motheaten.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7373"><span id="lf0610_label_9383">3</span> Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7374"><span id="lf0610_label_9384">4</span> Behold, the hire of the labourers <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1923" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1923_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7375"><span id="lf0610_label_9386">5</span> Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7376"><span id="lf0610_label_9387">6</span> Ye have condemned <span class="ital">and</span> killed the just; <span class="ital">and</span> he doth not resist you.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7377"><span id="lf0610_label_9388">7</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1924" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1924_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7378"><span id="lf0610_label_9390">8</span> Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7379"><span id="lf0610_label_9391">9</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1925" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1925_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7380"><span id="lf0610_label_9393">10</span> Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7381"><span id="lf0610_label_9394">11</span> Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7382"><span id="lf0610_label_9395">12</span> But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and <span class="ital">your</span> nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7383"><span id="lf0610_label_9396">13</span> Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7384"><span id="lf0610_label_9397">14</span> Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7385"><span id="lf0610_label_9398">15</span> And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7386"><span id="lf0610_label_9399">16</span> Confess <span class="ital">your</span> faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7387"><span id="lf0610_label_9400">17</span> Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1926" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1926_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7388"><span id="lf0610_label_9402">18</span> And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7389"><span id="lf0610_label_9403">19</span> Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7390"><span id="lf0610_label_9404">20</span> Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.</p>
</div>
</div>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>270<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<div id="lf0610_div_257" class="type-part Peter_I">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_047">THE FIRST EPISTLE GENERAL OF PETER.</h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_258" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9405">1</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7391"><span id="lf0610_label_9406">1</span> <span class="csc">Peter,</span> an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7392"><span id="lf0610_label_9407">2</span> Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7393"><span id="lf0610_label_9408">3</span> Blessed <span class="ital">be</span> the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1927" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1927_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7394"><span id="lf0610_label_9410">4</span> To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1928" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1928_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>for you,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7395"><span id="lf0610_label_9412">5</span> Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7396"><span id="lf0610_label_9413">6</span> Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7397"><span id="lf0610_label_9414">7</span> That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7398"><span id="lf0610_label_9415">8</span> Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see <span class="ital">him</span> not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7399"><span id="lf0610_label_9416">9</span> Receiving the end of your faith, <span class="ital">even</span> the salvation of <span class="ital">your</span> souls.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7400"><span id="lf0610_label_9417">10</span> Of which salvation the prophets have enquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace <span class="ital">that should come</span> unto you:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7401"><span id="lf0610_label_9418">11</span> Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7402"><span id="lf0610_label_9419">12</span> Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7403"><span id="lf0610_label_9420">13</span> Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1929" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1929_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7404"><span id="lf0610_label_9422">14</span> As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7405"><span id="lf0610_label_9423">15</span> But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7406"><span id="lf0610_label_9424">16</span> Because it is written, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1930" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1930_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Be ye holy; for I am holy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7407"><span id="lf0610_label_9426">17</span> And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man&#x2019;s work, pass the time of your sojourning <span class="ital">here</span> in fear:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7408"><span id="lf0610_label_9427">18</span> Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, <span class="ital">as</span> silver and gold, from your vain conversation <span class="ital">received</span> by tradition from your fathers;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7409"><span id="lf0610_label_9428">19</span> But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7410"><span id="lf0610_label_9429">20</span> Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7411"><span id="lf0610_label_9430">21</span> Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7412"><span id="lf0610_label_9431">22</span> Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>271<span class="bracket">]</span></span> of the brethren, <span class="ital">see that ye</span> love one another with a pure heart fervently:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7413"><span id="lf0610_label_9432">23</span> Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7414"><span id="lf0610_label_9433">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1931" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1931_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>For all flesh <span class="ital">is</span> as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7415"><span id="lf0610_label_9435">25</span> But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_259" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9436">2</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7416"><span id="lf0610_label_9437">1</span> Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1932" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1932_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>all evil speakings,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7417"><span id="lf0610_label_9439">2</span> As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7418"><span id="lf0610_label_9440">3</span> If so be ye have tasted that the Lord <span class="ital">is</span> gracious.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7419"><span id="lf0610_label_9441">4</span> To whom coming, <span class="ital">as unto</span> a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, <span class="ital">and</span> precious,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7420"><span id="lf0610_label_9442">5</span> Ye also, as lively stones, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1933" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1933_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1934" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1934_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7421"><span id="lf0610_label_9445">6</span> Wherefore <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1935" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1935_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>also it is contained in the scripture, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1936" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1936_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7422"><span id="lf0610_label_9448">7</span> Unto you therefore which believe <span class="ital">he is</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1937" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1937_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>precious: but unto them which be disobedient, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1938" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1938_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7423"><span id="lf0610_label_9451">8</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1939" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1939_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, <span class="ital">even to them</span> which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7424"><span id="lf0610_label_9453">9</span> But ye <span class="ital">are</span> a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1940" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1940_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1941" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1941_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7425"><span id="lf0610_label_9456">10</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1942" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1942_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Which in time past <span class="ital">were</span> not a people, but <span class="ital">are</span> now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7426"><span id="lf0610_label_9458">11</span> Dearly beloved, I beseech <span class="ital">you</span> as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7427"><span id="lf0610_label_9459">12</span> Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1943" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1943_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by <span class="ital">your</span> good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7428"><span id="lf0610_label_9461">13</span> Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord&#x2019;s sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7429"><span id="lf0610_label_9462">14</span> Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7430"><span id="lf0610_label_9463">15</span> For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7431"><span id="lf0610_label_9464">16</span> As free, and not <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1944" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1944_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>using <span class="ital">your</span> liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7432"><span id="lf0610_label_9466">17</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1945" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1945_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>Honour all <span class="ital">men.</span> Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7433"><span id="lf0610_label_9468">18</span> Servants, <span class="ital">be</span> subject to <span class="ital">your</span> masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7434"><span id="lf0610_label_9469">19</span> For this <span class="ital">is</span> thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7435"><span id="lf0610_label_9470">20</span> For what glory <span class="ital">is it,</span> if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer <span class="ital">for it,</span> ye take it patiently, this <span class="ital">is</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1946" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1946_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>acceptable with God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7436"><span id="lf0610_label_9472">21</span> For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1947" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1947_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7437"><span id="lf0610_label_9474">22</span> Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7438"><span id="lf0610_label_9475">23</span> Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1948" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1948_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>committed <span class="ital">himself</span> to him that judgeth righteously:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7439"><span id="lf0610_label_9477">24</span> Who his own self bare our sins in his own <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>272<span class="bracket">]</span></span> body <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1949" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1949_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7440"><span id="lf0610_label_9479">25</span> For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_260" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_9480">3</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7441"><span id="lf0610_label_9481">1</span> Likewise, ye wives, <span class="ital">be</span> in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7442"><span id="lf0610_label_9482">2</span> While they behold your chaste conversation <span class="ital">coupled</span> with fear.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7443"><span id="lf0610_label_9483">3</span> Whose adorning let it not be that outward <span class="ital">adorning</span> of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7444"><span id="lf0610_label_9484">4</span> But <span class="ital">let it be</span> the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, <span class="ital">even the ornament</span> of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7445"><span id="lf0610_label_9485">5</span> For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7446"><span id="lf0610_label_9486">6</span> Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1950" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1950_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2020;</a>daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7447"><span id="lf0610_label_9488">7</span> Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with <span class="ital">them</span> according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7448"><span id="lf0610_label_9489">8</span> Finally, <span class="ital">be ye</span> all of one mind, having compassion one of another, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1951" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1951_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>love as brethren, <span class="ital">be</span> pitiful, <span class="ital">be</span> courteous:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7449"><span id="lf0610_label_9491">9</span> Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_7450"><span id="lf0610_label_9492">10</span> For <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt1952" id="lf0610_footnote_nt1952_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:</p>
