<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8056"><span id="lf0610_label_10248">2</span> And he laid hold on the dragon, that old serpent, which is the Devil, and Satan, and bound him a thousand years,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8057"><span id="lf0610_label_10249">3</span> And cast him into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he should deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years should be fulfilled: and after that he must be loosed a little season.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8058"><span id="lf0610_label_10250">4</span> And I saw thrones, and they sat upon them, and judgment was given unto them: and <span class="ital">I saw</span> the souls of them that were beheaded for the witness of Jesus, and for the word of God, and which had not worshipped the beast, neither his image, neither had received <span class="ital">his</span> mark upon their foreheads, or in their hands; and they lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8059"><span id="lf0610_label_10251">5</span> But the rest of the dead lived not again until the thousand years were finished. This <span class="ital">is</span> the first resurrection.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8060"><span id="lf0610_label_10252">6</span> Blessed and holy <span class="ital">is</span> he that hath part in the first resurrection: on such the second death hath no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8061"><span id="lf0610_label_10253">7</span> And when the thousand years are expired, Satan shall be loosed out of his prison,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8062"><span id="lf0610_label_10254">8</span> And shall go out to deceive the nations which are in the four quarters of the earth, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2069" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2069_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Gog and Magog, to gather them together to battle: the number of whom <span class="ital">is</span> as the sand of the sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8063"><span id="lf0610_label_10256">9</span> And they went up on the breadth of the earth, and compassed the camp of the saints about, and the beloved city: and fire came down from God out of heaven, and devoured them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8064"><span id="lf0610_label_10257">10</span> And the devil that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet <span class="ital">are,</span> and shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8065"><span id="lf0610_label_10258">11</span> And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8066"><span id="lf0610_label_10259">12</span> And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2070" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2070_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>book was opened, which is <span class="ital">the book</span> of life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8067"><span id="lf0610_label_10261">13</span> And the sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2071" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2071_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2225;</a>hell delivered up the dead which were in them: and they were judged every man according to their works.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8068"><span id="lf0610_label_10263">14</span> And death and hell were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8069"><span id="lf0610_label_10264">15</span> And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_300" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_10265">21</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8070"><span id="lf0610_label_10266">1</span> And <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2072" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2072_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8071"><span id="lf0610_label_10268">2</span> And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8072"><span id="lf0610_label_10269">3</span> And I heard a great voice out of heaven saying, Behold, the tabernacle of God <span class="ital">is</span> with men, and he will dwell with them, and they shall <span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>301<span class="bracket">]</span></span> be his people, and God himself shall be with them, <span class="ital">and be</span> their God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8073"><span id="lf0610_label_10270">4</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2073" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2073_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8074"><span id="lf0610_label_10272">5</span> And he that sat upon the throne said, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2074" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2074_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>Behold, I make all things new. And he said unto me, Write: for these words are true and faithful.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8075"><span id="lf0610_label_10274">6</span> And he said unto me, It is done. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2075" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2075_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2076" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2076_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>I will give unto him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8076"><span id="lf0610_label_10277">7</span> He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8077"><span id="lf0610_label_10278">8</span> But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone: which is the second death.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8078"><span id="lf0610_label_10279">9</span> And there came unto me one of the seven angels which had the seven vials full of the seven last plagues, and talked with me, saying, Come hither, I will shew thee the bride, the Lamb&#x2019;s wife.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8079"><span id="lf0610_label_10280">10</span> And he carried me away in the spirit to a great and high mountain, and shewed me that great city, the holy Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God,</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8080"><span id="lf0610_label_10281">11</span> Having the glory of God: and her light <span class="ital">was</span> like unto a stone most precious, even like a jasper stone, clear as crystal;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8081"><span id="lf0610_label_10282">12</span> And had a wall great and high, <span class="ital">and</span> had twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names written thereon, which are <span class="ital">the names</span> of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8082"><span id="lf0610_label_10283">13</span> On the east three gates; on the north three gates; on the south three gates; and on the west three gates.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8083"><span id="lf0610_label_10284">14</span> And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and in them the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8084"><span id="lf0610_label_10285">15</span> And he that talked with me had a golden reed to measure the city, and the gates thereof, and the wall thereof.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8085"><span id="lf0610_label_10286">16</span> And the city lieth foursquare, and the length is as large as the breadth: and he measured the city with the reed, twelve thousand furlongs. The length and the breadth and the height of it are equal.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8086"><span id="lf0610_label_10287">17</span> And he measured the wall thereof, an hundred <span class="ital">and</span> forty <span class="ital">and</span> four cubits, <span class="ital">according to</span> the measure of a man, that is, of the angel.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8087"><span id="lf0610_label_10288">18</span> And the building of the wall of it was <span class="ital">of</span> jasper: and the city <span class="ital">was</span> pure gold, like unto clear glass.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8088"><span id="lf0610_label_10289">19</span> And the foundations of the wall of the city <span class="ital">were</span> garnished with all manner of precious stones. The first foundation <span class="ital">was</span> jasper; the second, sapphire; the third, a chalcedony; the fourth, an emerald;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8089"><span id="lf0610_label_10290">20</span> The fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, chrysolyte; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, a topaz; the tenth, a chrysoprasus; the eleventh, a jacinth; the twelfth, an amethyst.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8090"><span id="lf0610_label_10291">21</span> And the twelve gates <span class="ital">were</span> twelve pearls; every several gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city <span class="ital">was</span> pure gold, as it were transparent glass.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8091"><span id="lf0610_label_10292">22</span> And I saw no temple therein: for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are the temple of it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8092"><span id="lf0610_label_10293">23</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2077" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2077_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the city had no need of the sun, neither of the moon, to shine in it: for the glory of God did lighten it, and the Lamb <span class="ital">is</span> the light thereof.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8093"><span id="lf0610_label_10295">24</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2078" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2078_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the nations of them which are saved shall walk in the light of it: and the kings of the earth do bring their glory and honour into it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8094"><span id="lf0610_label_10297">25</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2079" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2079_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And the gates of it shall not be shut at all by day: for there shall be no night there.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8095"><span id="lf0610_label_10299">26</span> And they shall bring the glory and honour of the nations into it.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8096"><span id="lf0610_label_10300">27</span> And there shall in no wise enter into it any thing that defileth, neither <span class="ital">whatsoever</span> worketh abomination, or <span class="ital">maketh</span> a lie: but they which are written in the Lamb&#x2019;s book of life.</p>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_div_301" class="type-chapter chapter_AV">
<h2 id="lf0610_label_10301">22</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8097"><span id="lf0610_label_10302">1</span> And he shewed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8098"><span id="lf0610_label_10303">2</span> In the midst of the street of it, and <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2080" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2080_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">&#x2021;</a>on either side of the river, <span class="ital">was there</span> the tree of life, which bare twelve <span class="ital">manner of</span> fruits, <span class="ital">and</span> yielded her fruit every month: and the leaves of the tree <span class="ital">were</span> for the healing of the nations.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8099"><span id="lf0610_label_10305">3</span> And there shall be no more curse: but the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it; and his servants shall serve him:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8100"><span id="lf0610_label_10306">4</span> And they shall see his face; and his name <span class="ital">shall be</span> in their foreheads.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8101"><span id="lf0610_label_10307">5</span> <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2081" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2081_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And there shall be no night there; and they need no candle, neither light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light: and they shall reign for ever and ever.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8102"><span id="lf0610_label_10309">6</span> And he said unto me, These sayings <span class="ital">are</span> faithful and true: and the Lord God of the holy prophets sent his angel to shew unto his servants the things which must shortly be done.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8103"><span id="lf0610_label_10310">7</span> Behold, I come quickly: blessed <span class="ital">is</span> he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8104"><span id="lf0610_label_10311">8</span> And I John saw these things, and heard <span class="ital">them.</span> And when I had heard and seen, I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel which shewed me these things.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8105"><span id="lf0610_label_10312">9</span> Then saith he unto me, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2082" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2082_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>See <span class="ital">thou do it</span> not: for I am thy fellowservant, and of thy brethren the prophets, and of them which keep the sayings of this book: worship God.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8106"><span id="lf0610_label_10314">10</span> And he saith unto me, Seal not the sayings of the prophecy of this book: for the time is at hand.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8107"><span id="lf0610_label_10315">11</span> He that is unjust, let him be unjust still: and he which is filthy, let him be filthy still: and he that is righteous, let him be righteous still: and he that is holy, let him be holy still.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8108"><span id="lf0610_label_10316">12</span> And, behold, I come quickly; and my reward <span class="ital">is</span> with me, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2083" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2083_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>to give every man according as his work shall be.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8109"><span id="lf0610_label_10318">13</span> I am Alpha and Omega, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2084" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2084_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>the beginning and the end, the first and the last.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8110"><span id="lf0610_label_10320">14</span> Blessed <span class="ital">are</span> they that do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life, and may enter in through the gates into the city.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8111"><span id="lf0610_label_10321">15</span> For without <span class="ital">are</span> dogs, and sorcerers, and whoremongers, and murderers, and idolaters, and whosoever loveth and maketh a lie.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8112"><span id="lf0610_label_10322">16</span> I Jesus have sent mine angel to testify unto you these things in the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David, <span class="ital">and</span> the bright and morning star.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8113"><span id="lf0610_label_10323">17</span> And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that heareth say, Come. <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2085" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2085_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>And let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8114"><span id="lf0610_label_10325">18</span> For I testify unto every man that heareth the words of the prophecy of this book, <a href="#lf0610_footnote_nt2086" id="lf0610_footnote_nt2086_ref" class="footnote-link type-footnote">*</a>If any man shall add unto these things, God shall add unto him the plagues that are written in this book:</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8115"><span id="lf0610_label_10327">19</span> And if any man shall take away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God shall take away his part out of the book of life, and out of the holy city, and <span class="ital">from</span> the things which are written in this book.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8116"><span id="lf0610_label_10328">20</span> He which testifieth these things saith, Surely I come quickly. Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8117"><span id="lf0610_label_10329">21</span> The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ <span class="ital">be</span> with you all. Amen.</p>
</div>
</div>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>303<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<div id="lf0610_div_302" class="type-section">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_061"><span class="ital">List of readings and renderings preferred by the American Committee, recorded at their desire. See Preface to New Testament.</span></h2>
<div id="lf0610_div_303" class="type-section">
<h2 id="lf0610_head_062">CLASSES OF PASSAGES.</h2>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8118"><span id="lf0610_label_10330">I.</span> Strike out &#x201C;S.&#x201D; (i. e. Saint) from the title of the Gospels and from the heading of the pages.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8119"><span id="lf0610_label_10331">II.</span> Strike out &#x201C;the Apostle&#x201D; from the title of the Pauline Epistles, and &#x201C;of Paul the Apostle&#x201D; from the title of the Epistle to the Hebrews; strike out the word &#x201C;General&#x201D; from the title of the Epistles of James, Peter, 1 John, and Jude; and let the title of the Revelation run &#x201C;The Revelation of John.&#x201D;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8120"><span id="lf0610_label_10332">III.</span> For &#x201C;Holy Ghost&#x201D; adopt uniformly the rendering &#x201C;Holy Spirit.&#x201D;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8121"><span id="lf0610_label_10333">IV.</span> At the word &#x201C;worship&#x201D; in Matt. ii. 2, etc., add the marginal note &#x201C;The Greek word denotes an act of reverence, whether paid to man (see chap. xviii. 26) or to God (see chap. iv. 10).&#x201D;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8122"><span id="lf0610_label_10334">V.</span> Put into the text uniformly the marginal rendering &#x201C;through&#x201D; in place of &#x201C;by&#x201D; when it relates to prophecy, viz. in Matt. ii. 5, 17, 23; iii. 3; iv. 14; viii. 17; xii. 17; xiii. 35; xxi. 4; xxiv. 15; xxvii. 9; Luke xviii. 31; Acts ii. 16; xxviii. 25.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8123"><span id="lf0610_label_10335">VI.</span> For &#x201C;tempt&#x201D; (&#x201C;temptation&#x201D;) substitute &#x201C;try&#x201D; or &#x201C;make trial of&#x201D; (&#x201C;trial&#x201D;) wherever enticement to what is wrong is not evidently spoken of; viz. in the following instances: Matt. iv. 7; xvi. 1; xix. 3; xxii. 18, 35; Mark viii. 11; x. 2; xii. 15; Luke iv. 12; x. 25; xi. 16; xxii. 28; John viii. 6; Acts v. 9; xv. 10; 1 Cor. x. 9; Heb. iii. 8, 9; 1 Pet. i. 6.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8124"><span id="lf0610_label_10336">VII.</span> Substitute modern forms of speech for the following archaisms, viz. &#x201C;who&#x201D; or &#x201C;that&#x201D; for &#x201C;which&#x201D; when used of persons; &#x201C;are&#x201D; for &#x201C;be&#x201D; in the present indicative; &#x201C;know&#x201D; &#x201C;knew&#x201D; for &#x201C;wot&#x201D; &#x201C;wist&#x201D;; &#x201C;drag&#x201D; or &#x201C;drag away&#x201D; for &#x201C;hale.&#x201D;</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8125"><span id="lf0610_label_10337">VIII.</span> Substitute for &#x201C;devil&#x201D; (&#x201C;devils&#x201D;) the word &#x201C;demon&#x201D; (&#x201C;demons&#x201D;) wherever the latter word is given in the margin (or represents the Greek words &#x3B4;&#x3B1;&#x3AF;&#x3BC;&#x3C9;&#x3BD;, &#x3B4;&#x3B1;&#x3B9;&#x3BC;&#x3CC;&#x3BD;&#x3B9;&#x3BF;&#x3BD;); and for &#x201C;possessed with a devil&#x201D; (or &#x201C;devils&#x201D;) substitute either &#x201C;demoniac&#x201D; or &#x201C;possessed with a demon&#x201D; (or &#x201C;demons&#x201D;).</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8126"><span id="lf0610_label_10338">IX.</span> After &#x201C;baptize&#x201D; let the marg. &#x201C;Or, <span class="ital">in</span>&#x201D; and the text &#x201C;with&#x201D; exchange places.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8127"><span id="lf0610_label_10339">X.</span> Let the word &#x201C;testament&#x201D; be everywhere changed to &#x201C;covenant&#x201D; (without an alternate in the margin), except in Heb. ix. 15-17.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8128"><span id="lf0610_label_10340">XI.</span> Wherever &#x201C;patience&#x201D; occurs as the rendering of &#x1F51;&#x3C0;&#x3BF;&#x3BC;&#x3BF;&#x3BD;&#x3AE; add &#x201C;stedfastness&#x201D; as an alternate in the margin, except in 2 Cor. i. 6; James v. 11; Luke viii. 15; Heb. xii. 1.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8129"><span id="lf0610_label_10341">XII.</span> Let &#x1F00;&#x3C3;&#x3C3;&#x3AC;&#x3C1;&#x3B9;&#x3BF;&#x3BD; (Matt. x. 29; Luke xii. 6) be translated &#x201C;penny,&#x201D; and &#x3B4;&#x3B7;&#x3BD;&#x3AC;&#x3C1;&#x3B9;&#x3BF;&#x3BD; &#x201C;shilling,&#x201D; except in Matt. xxii. 19; Mark xii. 15; Luke xx. 24, where the name of the coin, &#x201C;a denarius,&#x201D; should be given.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8130"><span id="lf0610_label_10342">XIII.</span> Against the expression &#x201C;the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ&#x201D; add the marginal rendering &#x201C;Or, <span class="ital">God and the Father</span>&#x201D; etc.; viz. in Rom. xv. 6; 2 Cor. i. 3; xi. 31; Eph. i. 3; Col. i. 3; 1 Pet. i. 3. And against the expression &#x201C;our God and Father&#x201D; add the marg. &#x201C;Or, <span class="ital">God and our Father</span>&#x201D;; viz. in Gal. i. 4; Phil. iv. 20; 1 Thess. i. 3; iii. 11, 13; Jas. i. 27. And against the expression &#x201C;his God and Father&#x201D; add the marg. &#x201C;Or, <span class="ital">God and his Father</span>&#x201D;, viz. in Rev. i. 6.</p>
<p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8131"><span id="lf0610_label_10343">XIV.</span> Let the use of &#x201C;fulfil&#x201D; be confined to those cases in which it denotes &#x201C;accomplish,&#x201D; &#x201C;bring to pass,&#x201D; or the like.</p>
<div id="lf0610_table_043" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_043">
<caption><span class="title"><b>MATTHEW.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />
</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>Against &#x201C;to his baptism&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>for baptism</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>10</td>
<td>For &#x201C;is the axe laid unto&#x201D; read &#x201C;the axe lieth at&#x201D; So in Luke iii. 9.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VI.</td>
<td>11</td>
<td>Let the marg. read Gr. <i>our bread for the coming day,</i> or <i>our needful bread.</i> So in Luke xi. 3.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>27</td>
<td>For &#x201C;his stature&#x201D; read &#x201C;the measure of his life&#x201D; (with marg. Or, <i>his stature</i>) So in Luke xii. 25.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VIII.</td>
<td>4</td>
<td>Here and in Matt. xxvii. 65; Mark i. 44, for &#x201C;go thy [your] way&#x201D; read simply &#x201C;go&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IX.</td>
<td>6, 8</td>
<td>For &#x201C;power&#x201D; read &#x201C;authority&#x201D; (see marg.) So in Mark ii. 10; Luke v. 24.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>X.</td>
<td>39</td>
<td>&#x201C;life&#x201D; strike out the marg. So in xvi. 25; Mark viii. 35; Luke ix. 24; xvii. 33; John xii. 25.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>23</td>
<td>For &#x201C;Is this the son of David?&#x201D; read &#x201C;Can this be the son of David?&#x201D; [Comp. John iv. 29.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>31</td>
<td>&#x201C;unto men&#x201D; strike out the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIX.</td>
<td>14</td>
<td>For &#x201C;of such is&#x201D; read &#x201C;to such belongeth&#x201D; with marg. Or, <i>of such is</i> So in Mark x. 14; Luke xviii. 16.</td>
</tr>
<?pb ed="current" n="304"?>
<tr>
<td>XX.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>For &#x201C;that is&#x201D; read &#x201C;that was&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXII.</td>
<td>23</td>
<td>For marg.<sup>5</sup> read &#x201C;Many ancient authorities read <i>saying.</i>&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXIII.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;Father, which is in heaven&#x201D; read &#x201C;Father, <i>even</i> he who is in heaven.&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>23</td>
<td>For &#x201C;judgement&#x201D; read &#x201C;justice&#x201D; So in Luke xi. 42.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXVI.</td>
<td>29</td>
<td>For &#x201C;I will not drink&#x201D; read &#x201C;I shall not drink&#x201D; Similarly in Mark xiv. 25; Luke xxii. 16, 18.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXVII.</td>
<td>27</td>
<td>For &#x201C;palace&#x201D; read &#x201C;Pr&#xE6;torium&#x201D; with marg. Or, <i>palace</i> [as in Mark xv. 16] So in John xviii. 28, 33; xix. 9.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_table_045" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_045">
<caption><span class="title"><b>MARK.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />
</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>4, 9, 11, 12</td>
<td>&#x201C;bed&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>pallet</i> So in vi. 55; John v. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12; Acts v. 15; ix. 33.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>4</td>
<td>For &#x201C;wash&#x201D; read &#x201C;bathe&#x201D; [Comp. Luke xi. 38.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>X.</td>
<td>13</td>
<td>For &#x201C;brought&#x201D; read &#x201C;were bringing&#x201D; So in Luke xviii. 15.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>32</td>
<td>&#x201C;and they that followed&#x201D; etc. omit the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>45</td>
<td>For &#x201C;For verily&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;For the Son of man also&#x201D; etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XI.</td>
<td>24</td>
<td>For &#x201C;have received&#x201D; read &#x201C;receive&#x201D; with marg. Gr. <i>received.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIV.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;spikenard&#x201D; read &#x201C;pure nard&#x201D; (with marg. Or, <i>liquid nard</i>), and omit marg.<sup>4</sup> So in John xii. 3.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>

<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>35</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>70</td>

<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>34</td>

<td>14</td>

<td>16</td>

<td>For &#x201C;were choked&#x201D; read &#x201C;were drowned&#x201D;</td>

<td></td>

<tr>

<tr>

<td>49</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIII.</td>
<td>32</td>
<td>&#x201C;I am perfected&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>I end my course</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XV.</td>
<td>16</td>
<td>For &#x201C;have been filled&#x201D; read &#x201C;have filled his belly&#x201D; (with the marg. Many ancient authorities read <i>have been filled.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVII.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;If ye had faith&#x201D; etc. and &#x201C;it would obey you.&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>11</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVIII.</td>
<td>5</td>
<td>&#x201C;lest she wear me&#x201D; etc. add marg. Or, <i>lest at last by her coming she wear me out</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>7</td>
<td>For &#x201C;and he&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;and <i>yet</i> he&#x201D; etc. with the marg. Or, <i>and is he slow to punish on their behalf?</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIX.</td>
<td>29</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>42</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>XX.</td>
<td>20</td>
<td>&#x201C;rule&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>ruling power</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXII.</td>
<td>24</td>
<td>For &#x201C;is accounted&#x201D; read &#x201C;was accounted&#x201D;</td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>70</td>
<td>For &#x201C;Ye say that I am&#x201D; read &#x201C;Ye say <i>it,</i> for I am&#x201D; and substitute the text for the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXIII.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>&#x201C;Christ a king&#x201D; omit the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>15</td>

</tr>

<td>For &#x201C;instant&#x201D; read &#x201C;urgent&#x201D;</td>

<td></td>
<td>46</td>
<td>Let margin and text exchange places.</td>

<td>I.</td>
<td>3, 10, 17</td>
<td>Substitute the marginal rendering for the text.</td>

<td>17</td>
<td>For &#x201C;The zeal of thine house&#x201D; read &#x201C;Zeal for thy house&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>20</td>
<td>For &#x201C;ill&#x201D; read &#x201C;evil&#x201D; So in v. 29.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>29</td>
<td>For &#x201C;fulfilled&#x201D; read &#x201C;made full&#x201D; [and so xv. 11; xvi. 24; xvii. 13. See &#x201C;Classes of Passages,&#x201D; xiv.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>27</td>
<td>Substitute the marginal rendering for the text.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>8</td>
<td>For &#x201C;I go not up yet&#x201D; read &#x201C;I go not up&#x201D; and change the marg. to Many ancient authorities add <i>yet.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>21, 22</td>
<td>For &#x201C;marvel. For this cause hath Moses&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;marvel because thereof. Moses hath&#x201D; etc. and omit the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>23</td>
<td>&#x201C;a man every whit whole&#x201D; add marg. Gr. <i>a whole man sound.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>38</td>
<td>For &#x201C;out of his belly&#x201D; read &#x201C;from within him&#x201D; (with marg. Gr. <i>out of his belly.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VIII.</td>
<td>24, 28</td>
<td>&#x201C;I am <i>he</i>&#x201D; omit marg.<sup>1</sup> (and the corresponding portion of marg.<sup>4</sup>) So in xiii. 19.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>25</td>
<td>Substitute for the present marg.<sup>2</sup> Or, <i>Altogether that which I also speak unto you</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>26</td>
<td>&#x201C;unto the world&#x201D; omit marg.<sup>3</sup> &#x201C;Gr. <i>into.</i>&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>44</td>
<td>For &#x201C;stood&#x201D; read &#x201C;standeth&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>2</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>52, 53</td>
<td>For &#x201C;is dead&#x201D; and &#x201C;are dead&#x201D; read &#x201C;died&#x201D; [Compare vi. 49, 58.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>58</td>
<td>For &#x201C;was&#x201D; read &#x201C;was born&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>6</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>X.</td>
<td>8</td>
<td>&#x201C;before me&#x201D; add marg. Some ancient authorities omit <i>before me</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>43</td>
<td>For &#x201C;the glory of men . . . the glory of God&#x201D; read &#x201C;the glory <i>that is</i> of men . . . the glory <i>that is</i> of God&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIV.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>2</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>14</td>
<td>For &#x201C;shall ask me anything&#x201D; read &#x201C;shall ask anything&#x201D; and let marg.<sup>6</sup> read Many ancient authorities add <i>me.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVI.</td>
<td>25, 29</td>
<td>For &#x201C;proverbs&#x201D; read &#x201C;dark sayings&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVII.</td>
<td>24</td>
<td>For &#x201C;I will&#x201D; read &#x201C;I desire&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVIII.</td>
<td>37</td>
<td>For &#x201C;Thou sayest that&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;Thou sayest <i>it,</i> for I am a king&#x201D; and substitute the present text for the marg. [Comp. Luke xxii. 70.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXI.</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>&#x201C;was naked&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>had on his under garment only</i></td>
</tr>

<div id="lf0610_table_048" class="table-wrap">

<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>47</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>21</td>
<td>For &#x201C;since the world began&#x201D; read &#x201C;from of old&#x201D;</td>

<tr>
<td>VIII.</td>
<td>16</td>

<tr>
<td>XIII.</td>
<td>18</td>
<td>For &#x201C;suffered he their manners&#x201D; read &#x201C;as a nursing-father bare he them&#x201D;, and in the marg. read Many ancient authorities read <i>suffered he their manners.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIV.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>&#x201C;made whole&#x201D; omit marg.<sup>3</sup></td>

<td>18</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>23</td>
<td>For &#x201C;The apostles and the elder brethren&#x201D; read &#x201C;The apostles and the elders, brethren,&#x201D; and put the present text into the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVII.</td>
<td>22</td>
<td>For &#x201C;somewhat superstitious&#x201D; read &#x201C;very religious&#x201D; and put the present text in the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIX.</td>
<td>31</td>
<td>For &#x201C;chief officers of Asia&#x201D; read &#x201C;Asiarchs&#x201D; (with marg. i.e. officers having charge of festivals in the Roman province of Asia.)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XX.</td>
<td>28</td>
<td>For &#x201C;God&#x201D; read &#x201C;the Lord&#x201D; (with marg. Some ancient authorities, including the two oldest MSS., read <i>God.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXI.</td>
<td>10</td>
<td>For &#x201C;many days&#x201D; read &#x201C;some days&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXIII.</td>
<td>30</td>
<td>&#x201C;against the man&#x201D; etc. add marg. Many ancient authorities read <i>against the man on their part, I sent him to thee, charging</i> etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>35</td>
<td>For &#x201C;hear thy cause&#x201D; read &#x201C;hear thee fully&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXIV.</td>
<td>17</td>
<td>For &#x201C;many years&#x201D; read &#x201C;some years&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXV.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;laying wait&#x201D; read &#x201C;laying a plot&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXVI.</td>
<td>28</td>
<td>&#x201C;With but&#x201D; etc. add marg. Or, <i>In a little</i> time</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>29</td>
<td>&#x201C;whether with little&#x201D; etc. add marg. Or, <i>both in little and in great,</i> i.e. in all respects</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXVII.</td>
<td>37</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>3</sup></td>
</tr>

<table summary="lf0610_table_049">
<caption><span class="title"><b>ROMANS.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>

</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>17</td>
<td>For &#x201C;by faith&#x201D; read &#x201C;from faith&#x201D; and omit the marg.</td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>18</td>
<td>For &#x201C;hold down&#x201D; read &#x201C;hinder&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>12</td>
<td>&#x201C;have sinned&#x201D; add marg. Gr. <i>sinned.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>13</td>
<td>For &#x201C;a law&#x201D; read &#x201C;the law&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>14</td>
<td>For &#x201C;which have no&#x201D; read &#x201C;that have not the&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td>For &#x201C;having no&#x201D; read &#x201C;not having the&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>14, 15</td>
<td>Enclose in a parenthesis.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>15</td>
<td>&#x201C;their thoughts&#x201D; etc. add marg. Or, <i>their thoughts accusing or else excusing</i> them <i>one with another</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>18</td>
<td>In marg.<sup>7</sup> for &#x201C;<i>provest</i>&#x201D; read &#x201C;<i>dost distinguish</i>&#x201D;</td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>22</td>
<td>Omit the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;in worse case&#x201D; read &#x201C;better&#x201D; and omit the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>21</td>
<td>Begin a paragraph.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>23</td>
<td>&#x201C;have sinned&#x201D; add marg. Gr. <i>sinned.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>25</td>
<td>&#x201C;set forth&#x201D; omit marg.<sup>9</sup> (&#x201C;<i>purposed</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td>For &#x201C;by his blood&#x201D; read &#x201C;in his blood&#x201D; (retaining the comma after &#x201C;faith&#x201D;) and omit marg.<sup>11</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>31</td>
<td>Make a paragraph of verse 31.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IV.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>For &#x201C;according to the flesh, hath found&#x201D; read &#x201C;hath found according to the flesh&#x201D; and put the present text into the margin</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>For &#x201C;let us have&#x201D; read &#x201C;we have&#x201D; and in marg.<sup>4</sup> read Many ancient authorities read <i>let us have</i> So in verses 2, 3 for &#x201C;let us&#x201D; read &#x201C;we&#x201D; (twice).</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>7</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>10</sup> (&#x201C;<i>that which is good</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VI.</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>&#x201C;justified&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>released</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>25</td>
<td>For &#x201C;I myself with the mind serve&#x201D; read &#x201C;I of myself with the mind, indeed, serve&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VIII.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>9</sup> (&#x201C;<i>and for sin</i>&#x201D;) and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>5, 6, 9, 13</td>
<td>For &#x201C;spirit&#x201D; read &#x201C;Spirit&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>13</td>
<td>For &#x201C;mortify&#x201D; read &#x201C;put to death&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>12</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>24</td>
<td>For &#x201C;by&#x201D; read &#x201C;in&#x201D; (with marg. Or, <i>by</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>26</td>
<td>For &#x201C;himself&#x201D; read &#x201C;itself&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>34</td>
<td>For &#x201C;shall condemn&#x201D; read &#x201C;condemneth&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IX.</td>
<td>5</td>
<td>For marg.<sup>10</sup> read Or, <i>flesh: he who is over all, God,</i> be <i>blessed for ever</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>22</td>
<td>&#x201C;willing&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>although willing</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XI.</td>
<td>11</td>
<td>Begin the paragraph here instead of at ver. 13.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>For &#x201C;reasonable&#x201D; read &#x201C;spiritual&#x201D; with marg. Gr. <i>belonging to the reason.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>6</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>8</sup> (&#x201C;<i>the faith</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>19</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>9</sup> (&#x201C;<i>the wrath</i> of God&#x201D;) and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>19</td>
<td>For &#x201C;And . . . reject&#x201D; read &#x201C;And the discernment of the discerning will I bring to nought&#x201D;</td>

<tr>
<td></td>

<td>For &#x201C;knoweth&#x201D; read &#x201C;hath known&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>12</td>
<td>For &#x201C;is of God&#x201D; read &#x201C;is from God&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td>For &#x201C;are freely given to us by God&#x201D; read &#x201C;were freely given to us of God&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>13</td>
<td>For &#x201C;comparing spiritual things with spiritual&#x201D; read &#x201C;combining spiritual things with spiritual <i>words</i>&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>17</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>14</td>
<td>&#x201C;natural&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>unspiritual</i> Gr. <i>psychical.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IV.</td>
<td>8</td>
<td>For &#x201C;have reigned&#x201D; read &#x201C;have come to reign&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;and to angels&#x201D; read &#x201C;both to angels&#x201D; and substitute the present text for the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>21</td>
<td>For &#x201C;meekness&#x201D; read &#x201C;gentleness&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>10, 11</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>1</sup> and<sup>2</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>For &#x201C;permission&#x201D; read &#x201C;concession&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>21</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>3</sup> (&#x201C;<i>nay, even if</i>&#x201D;) and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>25</td>
<td>For &#x201C;faithful&#x201D; read &#x201C;trustworthy&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<?pb ed="current" n="307"?>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>26</td>
<td>For &#x201C;the present distress&#x201D; read &#x201C;the distress that is upon us&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>31</td>
<td>For &#x201C;abusing it&#x201D; read &#x201C;using it to the full&#x201D; and omit the margin.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VIII.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;of him&#x201D; read &#x201C;by him&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>8</td>
<td>&#x201C;commend&#x201D; add marg. Gr. <i>present.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IX.</td>
<td>10</td>
<td>&#x201C;altogether&#x201D; let &#x201C;assuredly&#x201D; be the rendering in the text, and substitute &#x201C;<i>altogether</i>&#x201D; for the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>27</td>
<td>&#x201C;have preached&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>have been a herald</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XI.</td>
<td>10</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>1</sup> (&#x201C;<i>have authority over</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>19</td>
<td>For &#x201C;heresies&#x201D; read &#x201C;factions&#x201D; (with marg. Gr. <i>heresies.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>27</td>
<td>For &#x201C;unworthily&#x201D; read &#x201C;in an unworthy manner&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>31</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;And moreover a most excellent way&#x201D; etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIII.</td>
<td>12</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;then shall I know fully even as also I was fully known&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>8</sup> and<sup>9</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>13</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>10</sup> (&#x201C;<i>but greater than these</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIV.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;comfort&#x201D; read &#x201C;exhortation&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>33, 34</td>
<td>For &#x201C;of peace; as&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;of peace. As in all the churches of the saints, let&#x201D; etc. [and begin the paragraph with &#x201C;As&#x201D; etc.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XV.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>Adopt marg.<sup>2</sup> for the text (substituting &#x201C;<i>the word which</i>&#x201D; for &#x201C;<i>what</i>&#x201D;).</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>8</td>
<td>For &#x201C;as unto . . . time&#x201D; read &#x201C;as to the <i>child</i> untimely born&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>19</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>8</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>33</td>
<td>For &#x201C;Evil company doth corrupt good manners&#x201D; read &#x201C;Evil companionships corrupt good morals&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>34</td>
<td>For &#x201C;Awake up&#x201D; read &#x201C;Awake to soberness&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>3</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>44, 46</td>
<td>&#x201C;natural&#x201D; add marg. Gr. <i>psychical.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>51</td>
<td>For &#x201C;We shall not all&#x201D; read &#x201C;We all shall not&#x201D; and put the present text into the marg.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>

<tr>
<td>I.</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>15</td>
<td>For &#x201C;before&#x201D; read &#x201C;first&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>24</td>
<td>Read in the text &#x201C;for in faith ye stand fast&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>14</td>
<td>Begin a new paragraph with this verse.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>15</td>
<td>For &#x201C;are being saved . . . are perishing&#x201D; read &#x201C;are saved . . . perish&#x201D; and put the present text into the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;is glory&#x201D; read &#x201C;hath glory&#x201D; and let marg.<sup>3</sup> run Many etc. <i>For if the ministration of condemnation is glory.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>18</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>11</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>12</sup> (&#x201C;<i>the Spirit</i> which is <i>the Lord</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IV.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;are perishing&#x201D; read &#x201C;perish&#x201D; and put the present text into the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>8, 9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;I do not regret it, though&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;I do not regret it: though I did regret <i>it</i> (for I see that that epistle made you sorry, though but for a season), I now rejoice&#x201D; etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>Strike out &#x201C;&#x2014;wherefore&#x201D; and add marg. Some ancient authorities read &#x2014;<i>wherefore.</i></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>10</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;For am I now seeking the favour of men or of God&#x201D; and for &#x201C;seeking to please&#x201D; read &#x201C;striving to please&#x201D;</td>
</tr>

<td>1</td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td>For &#x201C;I <i>am</i> as&#x201D; read &#x201C;I also <i>am become</i> as&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>16</td>
<td>For &#x201C;because I tell you&#x201D; read &#x201C;by telling you&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>19</td>
<td>Substitute a dash for the comma after &#x201C;you&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<?pb ed="current" n="308"?>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>Substitute marg.<sup>2</sup> (&#x201C;<i>For freedom</i>&#x201D;) for the text.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>

<td>For &#x201C;cut themselves off&#x201D; read &#x201C;go beyond circumcision&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>20</td>
<td>Substitute marg.<sup>6</sup> (&#x201C;<i>parties</i>&#x201D;) for the text.</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>1</td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>10</td>
<td>&#x201C;as&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>since</i></td>

<tr>

</div>
<div id="lf0610_table_058" class="table-wrap">

<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />

<tbody>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>2</sup> run <i>claimed authority,</i> and then let the marg. and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IV.</td>
<td>12</td>
<td>For &#x201C;honestly&#x201D; read &#x201C;becomingly&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>22</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>7</sup> (&#x201C;<i>appearance</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<div id="lf0610_table_059" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_059">

<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>For &#x201C;is <i>now</i> present&#x201D; read &#x201C;is just at hand&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>10</td>
<td>For &#x201C;are perishing&#x201D; read &#x201C;perish&#x201D; with the text in the marg.</td>

<td>2</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>5</sup> (&#x201C;<i>the faith</i>&#x201D;)</td>

<div id="lf0610_table_060" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_060">
<caption><span class="title"><b>1 TIMOTHY.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />
</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>16</td>
<td>For &#x201C;hereafter&#x201D; read &#x201C;thereafter&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>18</td>
<td>Substitute marg.<sup>9</sup> (&#x201C;<i>led the way to thee</i>&#x201D;) for the text.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>4</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;who would have all men to be saved&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>15</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>3</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>12</td>
<td>For &#x201C;faith&#x201D; read &#x201C;pledge&#x201D; (with marg. Gr. <i>faith.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VI.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;desire&#x201D; read &#x201C;are minded&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<span class="pb"><span class="decoration">Edition: current; Page: </span><span class="bracket">[</span>309<span class="bracket">]</span></span>
<div id="lf0610_table_061" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_061">
<caption><span class="title"><b>2 TIMOTHY.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />

<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />
</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>10</td>
<td>For &#x201C;incorruption&#x201D; read &#x201C;immortality&#x201D; with marg. Gr. <i>incorruption.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>26</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;having been taken captive by him unto his will&#x201D;; and let marg.<sup>3</sup> run Or, <i>by him, unto the will of God</i> Gr. <i>by him</i> etc.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<div id="lf0610_table_062" class="table-wrap">

<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />

</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>&#x201C;before times eternal&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>long ages ago</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>13</td>
<td>Let the text and marg.<sup>7</sup> exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>10</td>
<td>For &#x201C;A man . . . heretical&#x201D; read &#x201C;a factious man&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
</tbody>

<div id="lf0610_table_063" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_063">
<caption><span class="title"><b>HEBREWS.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />
</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>7</sup> (&#x201C;<i>spirits</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>9</td>
<td>To the first &#x201C;God&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>O God</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>16</td>
<td>Let the text run &#x201C;For verily not to angels doth he give help, but he giveth help to&#x201D; etc. (with marg. Gr. <i>For verily not of angels doth he take hold, but he taketh hold of</i> etc.)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>17</td>
<td>For &#x201C;might be&#x201D; read &#x201C;might become&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>17</sup> (&#x201C;<i>Where</i>&#x201D;) and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>11</td>
<td>&#x201C;As&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>So</i> So in iv. 3.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IV.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>Let the text and marg.<sup>5</sup> exchange places, reading in marg. &#x201C;Many ancient authorities&#x201D; etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>7</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;a certain day, To-day, saying in David, so long a time afterward (even as hath been said before), To-day if ye&#x201D; etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VI.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>For &#x2018;let us cease&#x201D; etc. read &#x201C;leaving <sup>7</sup>the doctrine of the first principles of Christ, let us&#x201D; with marg.<sup>7</sup> Gr. <i>the word of the beginning of Christ.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>9</td>
<td>In marg.<sup>14</sup> for &#x201C;<i>are near to</i>&#x201D; read &#x201C;<i>belong to</i>&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VIII.</td>
<td>8</td>
<td>&#x201C;finding fault&#x201D; etc. add marg. Some ancient authorities read <i>finding fault</i> with it <i>he saith unto them.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IX.</td>
<td>4</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>1</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;parable&#x201D; read &#x201C;figure&#x201D; So in xi. 19.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td>Omit &#x201C;<i>now</i>&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>14</td>
<td>&#x201C;the eternal Spirit&#x201D; add marg. Or, his <i>eternal spirit</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>17</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>10</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>X.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>For &#x201C;they can&#x201D; read &#x201C;can&#x201D; (and for marg.<sup>1</sup> read Many ancient authorities read <i>they can.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>22, 23</td>
<td>Let the text and marg.<sup>8</sup> exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>25</td>
<td>For &#x201C;the assembling of ourselves together&#x201D; read &#x201C;our own assembling together&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>34</td>
<td>For &#x201C;<sup>3</sup>ye yourselves have&#x201D; read &#x201C;<sup>2</sup>ye have for yourselves&#x201D; (and omit marg.<sup>3</sup>, letting marg.<sup>2</sup> read Many ancient authorities read <i>that ye have your own selves for a</i> etc.)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XI.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>Read &#x201C;faith is assurance of things hoped for, a conviction&#x201D; etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>5</td>
<td>Read in the text &#x201C;for he hath had witness borne to him that before his translation he had been&#x201D; etc. with the present text in the marg.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;themselves&#x201D; read &#x201C;himself&#x201D; (and let marg.<sup>3</sup> run Many ancient authorities read <i>themselves.</i>)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>17</td>
<td>For &#x201C;rejected (for . . . of repentance)&#x201D; read &#x201C;rejected; for he found no place for a change of mind <i>in his father</i>&#x201D; with marg. Or, <i>rejected</i> (<i>for he found no place of repentance</i>), etc. Or, <i>rejected; for . . . of repentance</i> etc.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIII.</td>
<td>18</td>
<td>For &#x201C;honestly&#x201D; read &#x201C;honourably&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>20</td>
<td>For &#x201C;the eternal&#x201D; read &#x201C;an eternal&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>24</td>
<td>&#x201C;They of&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>The</i> brethren <i>from</i></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>

<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />

<td>2</td>

<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>For &#x201C;according unto God&#x201D; read &#x201C;according to <i>the will of</i> God&#x201D; (and so in marg.<sup>10</sup>). Comp. Rom. viii. 27.</td>

<caption><span class="title"><b>2 PETER.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />

<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />

<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>4</sup> and the text exchange places.</td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>7</td>
<td>For &#x201C;love of the brethren&#x201D; read &#x201C;brotherly kindness&#x201D; (twice) with marg. Gr. <i>love of the brethren.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>17</td>
<td>For &#x201C;came such a voice to him from the excellent glory&#x201D; read &#x201C;was borne such a voice to him by the Majestic Glory&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>4</sup></td>

<tr>
<td></td>
<td>18</td>
<td>For &#x201C;come&#x201D; read &#x201C;borne&#x201D; and omit marg.<sup>5</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>II.</td>
<td>13</td>
<td>For &#x201C;love-feasts&#x201D; read &#x201C;deceivings&#x201D; and in marg.<sup>20</sup> read Some ancient authorities read <i>love-feasts.</i></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>22</td>

</div>
<div id="lf0610_table_071" class="table-wrap">
<table summary="lf0610_table_071">
<caption><span class="title"><b>REVELATION.</b></span></caption>
<colgroup>
<col class="col1" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col2" span="1" align="right" />
<col class="col3" span="1" align="left" />
</colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>I.</td>
<td>8</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>8</sup> (&#x201C;<i>the Lord, the God</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>13</td>
<td>Omit marg.<sup>11</sup> (&#x201C;<i>the Son of man</i>&#x201D;)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>III.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>For &#x201C;fulfilled&#x201D; read &#x201C;perfected&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>IV.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>&#x201C;of the throne&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>before</i> [Comp. v. 6; vii. 17.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>V.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>&#x201C;in the midst of the throne&#x201D; etc. add marg. Or, <i>between the throne with the four living creatures, and the elders</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VI.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>&#x201C;A measure&#x201D; etc. add marg. [instead of marg.<sup>6</sup> and<sup>7</sup>] Or, <i>A ch&#x153;nix</i> (i.e. about a quart) <i>of wheat for a shilling</i>&#x2014;implying great scarcity.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>11</td>
<td>For &#x201C;be fulfilled&#x201D; read &#x201C;be fulfilled <i>in number</i>&#x201D; and then let the marg. and the text exchange places.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>VII.</td>
<td>17</td>
<td>&#x201C;of the throne&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>before</i> (See iv. 6.)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>X.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>Substitute marg.<sup>2</sup> (&#x201C;<i>delay</i>&#x201D;) for the text.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XII.</td>
<td>4</td>
<td>For &#x201C;stood . . . was . . . was . . . might&#x201D; read &#x201C;standeth . . . is . . . is . . . may&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIII.</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>&#x201C;he stood&#x201D; add marg. Some ancient authorities read <i>I stood</i> etc., connecting the clause with what follows.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>8</td>
<td>Let marg.<sup>5</sup> and the text exchange places. [Comp. xvii. 8.]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIV.</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>For &#x201C;an eternal gospel&#x201D; read &#x201C;eternal good tidings&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>15</td>
<td>For &#x201C;over-ripe&#x201D; read &#x201C;ripe&#x201D; with marg. Gr. <i>become dry.</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XV.</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>For &#x201C;that come&#x201D; read &#x201C;that come off&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XVI.</td>
<td>9</td>
<td>For &#x201C;the God&#x201D; read &#x201C;God&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>16</td>
<td>&#x201C;Har-Magedon&#x201D; add marg. Or, <i>Ar-Magedon</i></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XIX.</td>
<td>15</td>
<td>For &#x201C;of Almighty God&#x201D; read &#x201C;of God, the Almighty&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>XXII.</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>For &#x201C;do him service&#x201D; read &#x201C;serve him&#x201D;</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<div id="endnotes">
<div id="lf0610_footnote_nt002" class="type-footnote note"><a id="lf0610_label_005" href="#lf0610_footnote_nt002_ref">1 </a><p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8133">The earliest MS. of which the age is certainly known bears date <span class="sc"><span class="entity ad">ad</span></span> 916.</p></div>
<div id="lf0610_footnote_nt003" class="type-footnote note"><a id="lf0610_label_006" href="#lf0610_footnote_nt003_ref">2 </a><p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8134">See, for instance, 2 Sam. xvi. 12; 2 Chr. iii. 1, xxii. 6; Job xxxvii. 7; Ezek. xlvi. 10; Am. v. 26; Hag. i. 2.</p></div>

<div id="lf0610_footnote_nt794" class="type-footnote note"><a id="lf0610_label_3326" href="#lf0610_footnote_nt794_ref">* </a><p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8925">Matt. 18. 12.</p></div>
<div id="lf0610_footnote_nt795" class="type-footnote note"><a id="lf0610_label_3331" href="#lf0610_footnote_nt795_ref">&#x2225; </a><p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8926"><span class="ital">Drachma,</span> here translated <span class="ital">a piece of silver,</span> is the eighth part of an ounce, which cometh to seven pence half-penny, and is equal to the Roman penny, Matt. 18. 28.</p></div>
<div id="lf0610_footnote_nt796" class="type-footnote note"><a id="lf0610_label_3363" href="#lf0610_footnote_nt796_ref">&#x2225; </a><p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8927">The word <span class="ital">Batus</span> in the original containeth nine gallons three quarts.</p></div>
<div id="lf0610_footnote_nt797" class="type-footnote note"><a id="lf0610_label_3365" href="#lf0610_footnote_nt797_ref">&#x2225; </a><p id="Bible_0610_NewAuth_8928">The word here interpreted <span class="ital">a measure</span> in the original containeth about fourteen bushels and a pottle.</p></div>
